Invitation to Tender for the supply of 24 container terminal tractor trucks
Country: Trinidad and Tobago
Sector: Transportation and Warehousing
Date Added: 2015-03-10
Primary Funding Source: Government
Project Size (USD): 1000000
Status: In Procurement

Description:
The Port authority of Trinidad and Tobago (PATT) invites tenders from companies for the supply of 25 container terminal tracktor trucks in accordance with tender specifications, to be obtained from the port seretary's office. These specifications can be obtained upon payment in cash or manager's cheque of a non refundable sum of TT$1000 or approximately US$200 to the port authority administration building. Tenders close at 2:00pm on wednesday, APril 01, 2015. Late submissions will not be considered under any circumstances Tenders must be sealed within plain envelopes and deposited in the Tender Box located ont he ground floor of the Port Authorty Administration Building, Dock Road, Port of Spain, Trinidad.

" DATATABLE.1091,2015-03-09T08:41:23.582,2015-03-09T08:41:23.582,-61.516666999999984,10.666667,Trinidad and Tobago,Port of Spain,,RFP for Design-Build-Equip services fort he construction of three (3) pedestrian overpasses,,Construction,15000000,"3 pedestrian overpasses re to be located at: 1) Chancery lane, San Fernando 2) South quay, Port of Spain 3) Wrightson Road, Port of Spain These services will be goverened by contracts as defined in the FIDIC conditions of contract for plant and design-Build for electrical and Mechanical Plant and for building and engineering works designed by the contractor (Yellow Book) for the General conditions. The overpasses will be constructed via the Design-Bid-Build procurement methodology. Instructions for purchase of the RFP package 1) A complete set of documents for this project may be purchased by making a non-refundable deposit of TT$1,500.00 VAT inclusive, to UDECOTT/s operating account #852948 at any branch of First Citizen's Bank Limited, Trinidad. Only cash or manager's cheque will be accepted. 2) After pyamnet has been deposited into Udecott's account, RFP packages may then be collected at YDECOTT's head office, first floor, 38-40 Sackville street, Port of Spain from March 9-13, 2015 (excluding weekends and public holidays), between the hours of 9:00am to 4:00pm (EST), with proof of payment (stamped deposit receipt from the bank). Documents will not be available after this deadline Pre-submission meeting details Proponents will be invited to attend a pre-submission information session at UDECOTT's Head office located at the aforementioned address on March 18th, 2015 commencing at 10:00am EST. SUBMISSION DEADLINE: All submissions must be placed in sealed plan envelopes, labelled in accordance with the requirements outlined in the RFO and deposited in the appropriately labelled Tender box located on the first floor at the aforementioned address no later than 2:00pm EST on April 14, 2015 Additional information can be obtained in response to emails forwarded to the attention of the secretary of the Tenders committee: tendersecretary@udecott.com UDECOTT reserves the right to reject any or all proposals for failure to comply with mandatory requirements stated int he RFP.","Construction; Pedestrian Overpass; CARICOM; Trinidad; San Fernando, Port of Spain; UDECOTT; Design Build Equip",Post Identified Project,2015-03-05,2015-04-14,Government,,UDECOTT,tendersecretary@udecott.com,,Marissa Nicholas,nicholasmr@state.gov,http://www.udecott.com,http://trinidad.usembassy.gov/,,,1,In Procurement,0,POINT (-6848004.045739375 1194326.9765030826),"
RFP for Design-Build-Equip services fort he construction of three (3) pedestrian overpasses
Country: Trinidad and Tobago
Sector: Construction
Date Added: 2015-03-09
Primary Funding Source: Government
Project Size (USD): 15000000
Status: In Procurement

Description:
3 pedestrian overpasses re to be located at: 1) Chancery lane, San Fernando 2) South quay, Port of Spain 3) Wrightson Road, Port of Spain These services will be goverened by contracts as defined in the FIDIC conditions of contract for plant and design-Build for electrical and Mechanical Plant and for building and engineering works designed by the contractor (Yellow Book) for the General conditions. The overpasses will be constructed via the Design-Bid-Build procurement methodology. Instructions for purchase of the RFP package 1) A complete set of documents for this project may be purchased by making a non-refundable deposit of TT$1,500.00 VAT inclusive, to UDECOTT/s operating account #852948 at any branch of First Citizen's Bank Limited, Trinidad. Only cash or manager's cheque will be accepted. 2) After pyamnet has been deposited into Udecott's account, RFP packages may then be collected at YDECOTT's head office, first floor, 38-40 Sackville street, Port of Spain from March 9-13, 2015 (excluding weekends and public holidays), between the hours of 9:00am to 4:00pm (EST), with proof of payment (stamped deposit receipt from the bank). Documents will not be available after this deadline Pre-submission meeting details Proponents will be invited to attend a pre-submission information session at UDECOTT's Head office located at the aforementioned address on March 18th, 2015 commencing at 10:00am EST. SUBMISSION DEADLINE: All submissions must be placed in sealed plan envelopes, labelled in accordance with the requirements outlined in the RFO and deposited in the appropriately labelled Tender box located on the first floor at the aforementioned address no later than 2:00pm EST on April 14, 2015 Additional information can be obtained in response to emails forwarded to the attention of the secretary of the Tenders committee: tendersecretary@udecott.com UDECOTT reserves the right to reject any or all proposals for failure to comply with mandatory requirements stated int he RFP.

Road Program for Logistic and Integration - Ceara IV
Country: Brazil
Sector: Transportation and Warehousing
Date Added: 2012-11-01
Primary Funding Source: Development Bank
Project Size (USD): 200000000
Status: Fulfilled

Archived: Yes
Description:
Ceara IV is a multiple works program to finance: the rehabilitation of 1,375 km and the paving of 648 km of roads; the implementation of a pilot on result-driven maintenance/rehabilitation process in the EC-060, a major route connecting the two largest cities, Fortaleza (north) and Crato (south), and institutional strengthening of the DER / CE, including developing a State Plan for Logistics and Transport (PELT) and the implementation of actions identified in the Transport Master Plan and Environmental Management Plan, both funded by the Program Ceara III. It will also finance the development of technical, economic, social and environmental studies, engineering design, management of activities and audits, all related to the implementation of the program.

" DATATABLE.683,2014-02-21T17:12:17.501,2014-02-21T17:12:17.501,74.76609800000006,41.20438,Kyrgyzstan,Bishkek City ,,Bishkek Water II sub-project,44129,Utilities,20000000,"The EBRD is considering supporting the Bishkek Water Supply and Wastewater Rehabilitation Phase II project. The EBRD would extend a sovereign loan of up to €8 million to the Kyrgyz Republic, to be on-lent to Bishkek City for the benefit of the Bishkek Water Company for improvement of water supply and wastewater services. The Phase II Priority Investment Programme to be supported by EBRD will focus on supplementary renovation of the Company’s water supply infrastructure and wastewater collection and treatment in the City. The EBRD will also seek an investment grant from an international donor of €8 million to facilitate the implementation of the project which will address urgently needed water and wastewater infrastructure rehabilitation needs. ",water development city Kyrygz,European Bank for Reconstruction and Development,,,Development Banks,,Bishkek Water Company,,,Chuka Asike,asikec@state.gov,,,,,1,Pipeline,1,POINT (8322923.957959996 5042534.567123382),"
Bishkek Water II sub-project
Country: Kyrgyzstan
Sector: Utilities
Date Added: 2014-02-21
Primary Funding Source: Development Banks
Project Size (USD): 20000000
Status: Pipeline

Archived: Yes
Description:
The EBRD is considering supporting the Bishkek Water Supply and Wastewater Rehabilitation Phase II project. The EBRD would extend a sovereign loan of up to €8 million to the Kyrgyz Republic, to be on-lent to Bishkek City for the benefit of the Bishkek Water Company for improvement of water supply and wastewater services. The Phase II Priority Investment Programme to be supported by EBRD will focus on supplementary renovation of the Company’s water supply infrastructure and wastewater collection and treatment in the City. The EBRD will also seek an investment grant from an international donor of €8 million to facilitate the implementation of the project which will address urgently needed water and wastewater infrastructure rehabilitation needs.

This is an invitation to submit a proposal to create a luxury hotel development on a 124-acre parcel in St. George’s, Bermuda, partially within a UNESCO World Heritage Site. The property includes Gates Bay Beach, Tobacco Bay, a natural marina at Coot’s Pond and an 18-hole golf course with beautiful sea views redesigned by Robert Trent Jones. The Government of Bermuda has an integrated vision for the development, which will incorporate an upscale luxury hotel (branded or unbranded) along with the integration of the golf course and other customary amenities including restaurants, spa and wellness facilities. The ultimate objective is a sustainable world-class development that incorporates today’s required hospitality quality and services while integrating the project with the historic amenities of St. George’s.",Resort/Tourism Development ,Post Identified Project,2014-01-21,2014-03-31,Self Financed,,"Government of Bermuda, Ministry of Tourism Development and Transport","Attn: Francis Richardson The Government of Bermuda Ministry of Tourism Development & Transport 11 North Street Hamilton HM 17, Bermuda. St. George’s Tourism Development Site, a UNESCO World Heritage Destination
Country: United Kingdom
Sector: Construction
Date Added: 2014-02-28
Primary Funding Source: Self Financed
Project Size (USD): 100000000
Status: In Procurement

Description:
The Government of Bermuda is pleased to invite interested hospitality development firms to receive this Request for Proposal (RFP). This is an invitation to submit a proposal to create a luxury hotel development on a 124-acre parcel in St. George’s, Bermuda, partially within a UNESCO World Heritage Site. The property includes Gates Bay Beach, Tobacco Bay, a natural marina at Coot’s Pond and an 18-hole golf course with beautiful sea views redesigned by Robert Trent Jones. The Government of Bermuda has an integrated vision for the development, which will incorporate an upscale luxury hotel (branded or unbranded) along with the integration of the golf course and other customary amenities including restaurants, spa and wellness facilities. The ultimate objective is a sustainable world-class development that incorporates today’s required hospitality quality and services while integrating the project with the historic amenities of St. George’s.

Cold Storage Project Development
Country: Georgia
Sector: Transportation and Warehousing
Date Added: 2015-02-20
Primary Funding Source: Government
Project Size (USD): 7000000
Status: Pipeline

Description:
A study by Georgia's State-owned investment fund (Participation Fund, or PF) has identified a need for a 4,700 ton Fruit and Vegetable Cold Storage facility to serve Tbilisi, Rustavi and adjacent areas. A three hectare site is available. PF is looking for private investors to join the project on an equity basis, Interested parties should submit an expression of interest to include: Legal status of bidder; Relevant experience; List of construction or operation companies bidder intends to engage; Intended financing structure; 3 years of financial statements; etc. Expressions of interest must be submitted on or before March 20, 2015 to adress below.

Post Comments:
Note this is not a government procurement but an invitation for investment.

This ‘Lead Advisor’ will have overall responsibility on how to move the process forward. The expenditure budgeted for the contract consists of a Retainer Fee payable during the process and a Success Fee payable after transaction closing. As per the Government's commitment to Troika, the transaction must be finalized by December 2015. Therefore, the appointment of the Lead Advisor is urgent. Lead Advisors Sought for Commercialization of New Limassol Port
Country: Cyprus
Sector: Professional, Scientific, and Technical Services
Date Added: 2014-07-31
Primary Funding Source: Government
Project Size (USD): 1000
Status: In Procurement

Description:
""Provision of Lead Advisory Services to the Government, Aimed at the Successful Completion of the Process of Licensing of All or Part of the Commercial Operations of the Limassol Port in the Republic of Cyprus"" The Ministry is seeking a senior consultant, in addition to the existing consultants (KPMG), to provide technical advice on the project aimed at privatizing part of the commercial operations at the Limassol Port. This ‘Lead Advisor’ will have overall responsibility on how to move the process forward. The expenditure budgeted for the contract consists of a Retainer Fee payable during the process and a Success Fee payable after transaction closing. As per the Government's commitment to Troika, the transaction must be finalized by December 2015. Therefore, the appointment of the Lead Advisor is urgent.

" DATATABLE.914,2014-08-28T19:24:18.499,2014-08-28T19:24:18.499,153.02344889999995,-27.4710107,Australia,"Brisbane, Queensland",,BaT (Bus and Train) Project,,Construction,4600000000,"The BaT (Bus and Train) project is a proposed new 5km north-south tunnel that will deliver rail and bus together. It plans to combine a railway and a busway in a single, double-decked, 15m-wide tunnel with 3 underground stations beneath the Brisbane River and Brisbane’s central business district (CBD). It hopes to be open by 2021. The BaT project will be a critical new link in South East Queensland’s public transport network by creating new major transport hubs across the city and inner city suburbs. The project tackles Brisbane’s major public transport capacity challenges—the Merivale Bridge, the Cultural Centre bus precinct, Central Station and the Captain Cook Bridge. http://www.qld.gov.au/transport/projects/bat/about/overview/index.html","Transport, Tunnel, Road, Rail, Infrastructure",Post Identified Project,,,Government,,Queensland Government,"Queensland Government, batproject@tmr.qld.gov.au",,Alex Jones,jonesat2@state.gov,,,,,1,Pipeline,0,POINT (17034492.41097851 -3182442.5671451255),"
BaT (Bus and Train) Project
Country: Australia
Sector: Construction
Date Added: 2014-08-28
Primary Funding Source: Government
Project Size (USD): 4600000000
Status: Pipeline

Description:
The BaT (Bus and Train) project is a proposed new 5km north-south tunnel that will deliver rail and bus together. It plans to combine a railway and a busway in a single, double-decked, 15m-wide tunnel with 3 underground stations beneath the Brisbane River and Brisbane’s central business district (CBD). It hopes to be open by 2021. The BaT project will be a critical new link in South East Queensland’s public transport network by creating new major transport hubs across the city and inner city suburbs. The project tackles Brisbane’s major public transport capacity challenges—the Merivale Bridge, the Cultural Centre bus precinct, Central Station and the Captain Cook Bridge. http://www.qld.gov.au/transport/projects/bat/about/overview/index.html

Contact

" DATATABLE.1075,2015-02-22T00:42:09.66,2015-02-22T00:42:09.66,91.79999999999995,22.366667,Bangladesh,Chittagong,,2D Non-Exclusive Multi-Client Marine Seismic Survey in the Bay of Bengal,Ref. N0. 28.02.0000.051.15.102.14,"Mining, Quarrying, and Oil and Gas Extraction",30000000,"Petrobangla on behalf of the Government of the People’s Republic of Bangladesh invites Geophysical Companies to conduct marine 2D seismic survey on Non-Exclusive Multi-Client basis within the sovereign offshore areas of Bangladesh. The water depth to be covered by the survey will be from 20m to more than 2500m. The objective of the survey is to provide the oil and gas industry with 2D Non-Exclusive Multi-Client seismic data of the offshore areas of Bangladesh in order to help with basin evaluation, prospect generation and robust bid round participation. AGREEMENT FEATURES: - 2D Non-Exclusive Multi-Client marine seismic survey at no cost to the GoB or Petrobangla - 10 years Agreement Period - 24 months for data acquisition, processing and interpretation - Service Provider’s exclusive right to license the project data - Profit sharing after cost recovery - Bank guarantee for timely performance and data delivery EVALUATION FEATURES: - Offshore Multi-Client seismic survey experience at least in three different countries - Biddable survey volume - Biddable acquisition and processing parameters - Biddable profit sharing The interested companies are required to purchase bid documents at the price of TK 8000 or US$ 100. The bid document includes a Schedule and a Model Agreement for 2D Non-Exclusive Multi-Client seismic survey in the Offshore Area of Bangladesh. The bid documents can be purchased in local currency by cash payment or in US Dollars through wire transfer. FOR CASH PAYMENT IN BD TAKA. Bids in triplicate should be submitted in sealed envelopes subscribed ""Confidential"" “2D Non-Exclusive Multi-Client Seismic Survey in the Offshore Area of Bangladesh” not later than at 11:00 A.M. BST on March 29, 2015, to: Director Production Sharing Contract Directorate Bangladesh Oil, Gas & Mineral Corporation (Petrobangla) Petrocentre (Level 4) 3, Kawran Bazar C/A, Dhaka-1215, Bangladesh. Telephone 88-02-8114953, Fax: 88-02-9127400 web site: www. petrobangla.org.bd, E-mail: dpscpb@ petrobangla.org.bd Opening of bids before the authorized representatives of the bidders will take place at 12:05 P.M. BST on the same day at the same address. Bidders intending to be present during the bid opening should depute their authorized representative. Note: A pre-bid meeting will be held in Petrobangla approximately after 15 days from the date of publication of the notice to answer the queries from the bidders. The date and time of the pre-bid meeting will be confirmed to the bidders through letter/e-mail. Website: http://www.petrobangla.org.bd/notice_details.php?nid=882 ",2D Non-Exclusive Multi-Client Marine Seismic Survey in the Bay of Bengal,Post Identified Project,2015-02-08,2015-03-29,Government,None,Government of Bangladesh (PetroBangla),"Director Production Sharing Contract Directorate Bangladesh Oil, Gas & Mineral Corporation (Petrobangla) Petro Centre (Level 4) 3, Kawran Bazar C/A, Dhaka-1215, Bangladesh. Telephone 88-02-8114953, Fax: 88-02-9127400 web site: www. petrobangla.org.bd, E-mail: dpscpb@ petrobangla.org.bd",,Syeda Shahrazad Rahman,RahmanSS@state.gov,http://www.petrobangla.org.bd/notice_details.php?nid=882,http://dhaka.usembassy.gov/bids.html,,,1,Pipeline,0,POINT (10219129.25482251 2555605.2976250863),"
2D Non-Exclusive Multi-Client Marine Seismic Survey in the Bay of Bengal
Country: Bangladesh
Sector: Mining, Quarrying, and Oil and Gas Extraction
Date Added: 2015-02-22
Primary Funding Source: Government
Project Size (USD): 30000000
Status: Pipeline

Description:
Petrobangla on behalf of the Government of the People’s Republic of Bangladesh invites Geophysical Companies to conduct marine 2D seismic survey on Non-Exclusive Multi-Client basis within the sovereign offshore areas of Bangladesh. The water depth to be covered by the survey will be from 20m to more than 2500m. The objective of the survey is to provide the oil and gas industry with 2D Non-Exclusive Multi-Client seismic data of the offshore areas of Bangladesh in order to help with basin evaluation, prospect generation and robust bid round participation. AGREEMENT FEATURES: - 2D Non-Exclusive Multi-Client marine seismic survey at no cost to the GoB or Petrobangla - 10 years Agreement Period - 24 months for data acquisition, processing and interpretation - Service Provider’s exclusive right to license the project data - Profit sharing after cost recovery - Bank guarantee for timely performance and data delivery EVALUATION FEATURES: - Offshore Multi-Client seismic survey experience at least in three different countries - Biddable survey volume - Biddable acquisition and processing parameters - Biddable profit sharing The interested companies are required to purchase bid documents at the price of TK 8000 or US$ 100. The bid document includes a Schedule and a Model Agreement for 2D Non-Exclusive Multi-Client seismic survey in the Offshore Area of Bangladesh. The bid documents can be purchased in local currency by cash payment or in US Dollars through wire transfer. FOR CASH PAYMENT IN BD TAKA. Bids in triplicate should be submitted in sealed envelopes subscribed ""Confidential"" “2D Non-Exclusive Multi-Client Seismic Survey in the Offshore Area of Bangladesh” not later than at 11:00 A.M. BST on March 29, 2015, to: Director Production Sharing Contract Directorate Bangladesh Oil, Gas & Mineral Corporation (Petrobangla) Petrocentre (Level 4) 3, Kawran Bazar C/A, Dhaka-1215, Bangladesh. Telephone 88-02-8114953, Fax: 88-02-9127400 web site: www. petrobangla.org.bd, E-mail: dpscpb@ petrobangla.org.bd Opening of bids before the authorized representatives of the bidders will take place at 12:05 P.M. BST on the same day at the same address. Bidders intending to be present during the bid opening should depute their authorized representative. Note: A pre-bid meeting will be held in Petrobangla approximately after 15 days from the date of publication of the notice to answer the queries from the bidders. The date and time of the pre-bid meeting will be confirmed to the bidders through letter/e-mail. Website: http://www.petrobangla.org.bd/notice_details.php?nid=882

Project Website   Embassy Website   Contact

Samarinda-Balikpapan Toll Road
Country: Indonesia
Sector: Construction
Date Added: 2014-01-31
Primary Funding Source: Self Financed
Project Size (USD): 1200000000
Status: Pipeline

Description:
The road network in Kalimantan is part of the priority BIMP-EAGA Milti-Modal Transportation System, with the objective of enhancing the efficiency of distribution of goods and services. The toll road has been designated by government decree and is also a component of the ASEAN highway network. (99.4km, but broken into 4 phases).

Post Comments:
The Indonesian government would like this project to be procured as PPP and when bidding opens, the government is asking for bidders to be responsible for financing, engineering desgin, construction, and operation. The government will be responsible for land acquisition and partial construction to enhance the financial viability of the project.

" DATATABLE.76,2013-01-01T00:00:00,2013-11-24T19:00:00,90.356331,23.684994,Bangladesh,Bangladesh,SCA,Coastal Embankment Improvement Project,P128276,"Agriculture, Forestry, Fishing and Hunting",340000000,The objective of this project is to reduce forest degradation and increase forest coverage through participatory planning/monitoring and to contribute in building the long-term resilience of selected communities in coastal and hilly areas to climate change. The project development objective will be achieved by: (i) establishing newly afforested and reforested areas using climate resilient species to work as windbreak against cyclones; (ii) strengthening and diversifying alternative livelihoods of forest-dependent communities; and (iii) improving the institutional capacity of the forest department to sustainably manage forest resources in the face of the climate change.,"Water, General water, sanitation and flood protection sector (60%), General agriculture, fishing and forestry sector (30%), Other social services (10%)",World Bank,2012-04-09,2013-08-08,Development Bank,Government of Bangladesh,Bangladesh Water Development Board,Contact: Maria Sarraf Title: Senior Environmental Economist Email: msarraf@worldbank.org,,,,http://www.worldbank.org/projects/P128276/coastal-embankment-improvement-project-phase-1ceip-1?lang=en,http://dhaka.usembassy.gov/business.html,,,1,Fulfilled,1,POINT (10058420.75686848 2715069.9672812214),"
Coastal Embankment Improvement Project
Country: Bangladesh
Sector: Agriculture, Forestry, Fishing and Hunting
Date Added: 2013-01-01
Primary Funding Source: Development Bank
Project Size (USD): 340000000
Status: Fulfilled

Archived: Yes
Description:
The objective of this project is to reduce forest degradation and increase forest coverage through participatory planning/monitoring and to contribute in building the long-term resilience of selected communities in coastal and hilly areas to climate change. The project development objective will be achieved by: (i) establishing newly afforested and reforested areas using climate resilient species to work as windbreak against cyclones; (ii) strengthening and diversifying alternative livelihoods of forest-dependent communities; and (iii) improving the institutional capacity of the forest department to sustainably manage forest resources in the face of the climate change.

Railway Rehabilitation Project
Country: Kosovo
Sector: Transportation and Warehousing
Date Added: 2014-02-21
Primary Funding Source: Development Banks
Project Size (USD): 45000000
Status: Pipeline

Archived: Yes
Description:
The EBRD is considering providing a sovereign loan to the Republic of Kosovo, to be on-lent to Infrastructure of Kosovo Railways JSC (“InfraKos” or the “Company”). The loan would finance the urgent rehabilitation and upgrading of the southern section (Fushe Kosove – Macedonian border) of Rail Route 10 (Kosovo-Serbia border to Kosovo-Macedonia border) in Kosovo. This 64 km line is the only operational railway link connecting Kosovo’s domestic network to the international network.

" DATATABLE.677,2014-02-21T16:21:31.083,2014-07-23T12:18:01.475,114.34186199999999,30.546498,China,Hubei ,, Hubei Enshi Qing River Upstream Environment Rehabilitation Project,47048-002,Administrative and Support and Waste Management and Remediation Services,100000,"Inadequate wastewater collection and treatment, extensive nonpoint source pollution, and recurrent flooding combine to undermine living standards in the urban and rural areas of Enshi Tujia and Miao Autonomous Prefecture (ETMAP) of Hubei Province in the People s Republic of China (PRC). Hubei Enshi Qing River Upstream Environment Rehabilitation Project
Country: China
Sector: Administrative and Support and Waste Management and Remediation Services
Date Added: 2014-02-21
Primary Funding Source: Development Banks
Project Size (USD): 100000
Status: Pipeline

Description:
Inadequate wastewater collection and treatment, extensive nonpoint source pollution, and recurrent flooding combine to undermine living standards in the urban and rural areas of Enshi Tujia and Miao Autonomous Prefecture (ETMAP) of Hubei Province in the People s Republic of China (PRC). The Hubei Enshi Qing River Upstream Environment Rehabilitation Project will address these and other concerns, leading to improvements in water environment and quality of life. The proposed project will support: (i) improved pollution control; (ii) enhanced flood management; (iii) improved capacity for water resource management; and (iv) project management support and capacity development.

These are: • avoid technical disruptions, when a fault occurs it than the effect of the failure to minimize; • to prevent performance problems from the perspective of the user; • minimal impact to users (in this context, this is the user of the chain monitoring, management, technical and functional management, service, system owners); - Users make the transition from reactive to proactive management; - And end users are satisfied: • end users of the services are satisfied; • users of the monitoring system are satisfied with the use of the system; - Optimal implementation of the aspect of sustainability. Netherlands-Lelystad: Software package and information systems
Country: Netherlands
Sector: Information
Date Added: 2014-08-20
Primary Funding Source: Government
Project Size (USD): 1000
Status: In Procurement

Description:
In this tender, the following project objectives should be achieved: - Customer insight into changes in processes, services, infrastructure and systems which Client is able to optimize allowing end users to do their work without disrupting the continuity and availability of services and systems. These are: • avoid technical disruptions, when a fault occurs it than the effect of the failure to minimize; • to prevent performance problems from the perspective of the user; • minimal impact to users (in this context, this is the user of the chain monitoring, management, technical and functional management, service, system owners); - Users make the transition from reactive to proactive management; - And end users are satisfied: • end users of the services are satisfied; • users of the monitoring system are satisfied with the use of the system; - Optimal implementation of the aspect of sustainability. Note 1: At this time, still working on the final version of the project objectives. The above project objectives can therefore be changed or strengthened. Note 2: There is anticipated indefinite contract with an expected initial contract period of four years. The contract extension will be included as a unilateral option for the Province. Satisfaction at the contract extension.

Subprogram 2 was jointly prepared by representatives from the Government of the Cook Islands and the ADB.

Project Website   Embassy Website   " DATATABLE.964,2014-09-30T10:51:29.648,2014-09-30T10:51:29.648,15.981919000000062,45.8150108,Croatia,"Zagreb, Croatia",,Border Surveillance Upgrade,,Administrative and Support and Waste Management and Remediation Services,150000000,"Altough Croatia joined EU on July 1, 2013, it did not automatically join EU’s passport-free Schengen zone. Preparations to upgrade and modernize Croatian border control are already well underway, but there is still a lot of work to be done. The upcoming preparations will include better equipment for the border police patrolling its 1,400 kilometer land border with non-EU neighbors, and cutting the number of border crossings by half of what it currently has. In addition, Zagreb has yet to set up a computer-connected border management system at every single crossing. About three quarters of the funding needed for this preparation will come from EU’s Schengen Facility Fund, and 120 million Euros has already been earmarked for upgrading Croatia’s border control in the next few years.","Border surveillance, law enforcement, EU funds",Post Identified Project,,,Government,,Ministry of Interior,,,Nina Radicevic,radicevicn@state.gov,,,,,1,Pipeline,0,POINT (1779099.0849793511 5750753.966571199),"
Border Surveillance Upgrade
Country: Croatia
Sector: Administrative and Support and Waste Management and Remediation Services
Date Added: 2014-09-30
Primary Funding Source: Government
Project Size (USD): 150000000
Status: Pipeline

Description:
Altough Croatia joined EU on July 1, 2013, it did not automatically join EU’s passport-free Schengen zone. Preparations to upgrade and modernize Croatian border control are already well underway, but there is still a lot of work to be done. The upcoming preparations will include better equipment for the border police patrolling its 1,400 kilometer land border with non-EU neighbors, and cutting the number of border crossings by half of what it currently has. In addition, Zagreb has yet to set up a computer-connected border management system at every single crossing. About three quarters of the funding needed for this preparation will come from EU’s Schengen Facility Fund, and 120 million Euros has already been earmarked for upgrading Croatia’s border control in the next few years.

Contact

Submit proposals for the Design, Supply, Installation and Commissioning of Automatic Fire Detection and Alarm Systems at three selected sites. Bid documents may be purchased or downloaded from the Swaziland Water Services Corporation (SWSC) website www.swsc.co.sz or Revenue Office at SWSC Revenue Office, Gables Shopping Complex, MR103 Road, Ezulwini, Swaziland for a non-refundable fee of E500.00 (USD 50.00) from Thursday, August 21, 2014. Proof of payment must be included in the bid.Tender bids shall be valid for a period of 90 days after bid opening and must be accompanied by a tender bond of E10,000.00 (USD 1,000.00) and hand delivered in a sealsed envelope clearly marked ""Automatic Fire Detection and Alarm Systems"" to a designated tender box marked: Managing Director, Swaziland Water Services Corporation, Emtfonjeni Headquarters Building, cnr MR 103 and Cultural Village Road, Ezulwini, Swaziland. Closing time for receipt of tenders is 12:00 hours on Friday, September 12, 2014 at which time bids will be opened in the presence of bidders who elect to attend. Telegraphic, telephonic, fascimile, email and late bids will not be accepted. A compulsory site inspection will be conducted at 9:00 hours on Friday, August 29, 2014 and prospective bidders shall meet the Corporation's representative at te SWSC Woodlands Water Treatment Plant, Thembelihle, Mkhwakhwa Street before proceeding to the rest of the sites within the same day. The Corporation shall not bind itself to accept the lowest or any tender.

Post Comments:

Description:

Tourism resort Brijuni
Country: Croatia
Sector: Construction
Date Added: 2014-09-30
Primary Funding Source: Self Financed
Project Size (USD): 300000000
Status: In Procurement

Description:
Croatian Government will offer elite tourism resort Brijuni, a part of the Brijuni National Park, for concession by the end of 2014. The future concessionaire should build four and five star hotels, golf court, as well as manage the existing facilities on the island. Concession will be given for period of 50 years, and maximum investment required is 400 million USD. Environmental protection will remain the responsibility of the Ministry for Environment and Nature Protection.

" DATATABLE.25,2012-11-01T00:00:00,2013-11-24T19:00:00,-72.285215,18.971187,Haiti,Haiti,WHA,Improving Maternal and Child Health through Integrated Social Services,P123706,Health Care and Social Assistance,50000000,"The objectives of the proposed Project are to: increase the use, access and quality of basic services; and strengthen the Government's capacity to manage and monitor service delivery. The Project seeks to scale up two key Government programs to increase the use of and gradually improve the quality of basic services, with a focus on maternal and child health and nutrition. The Project would also reinforce the stewardship role of the Government and build capacity to manage and monitor service delivery. Although the Project would have a national scope, special emphasis will be placed on ensuring access to services in under-served rural areas and in communities where the vulnerable are being relocated, including in poor areas of Port au Prince.","Social Services, Support for Service Delivery Improvement",World Bank,2012-04-27,2013-03-14,Development Bank,Government of Haiti,Ministry of Public Health and Population,"Josefa Gauthier, General Director, Fonds D'assistance Economique et Sociale, jgauthier@faes.gouv.ht Florence Guillaume, Minister Of Public Health and Population, ministre@mspp.gouv.ht",,,asikec@state.gov,http://www.worldbank.org/projects/P123706/ensuring-health-nutrition-social-services-vulnerable?lang=en,http://haiti.usembassy.gov/business.html,,,1,Fulfilled,1,POINT (-8046753.325682299 2151543.9447495816),"
Improving Maternal and Child Health through Integrated Social Services
Country: Haiti
Sector: Health Care and Social Assistance
Date Added: 2012-11-01
Primary Funding Source: Development Bank
Project Size (USD): 50000000
Status: Fulfilled

Archived: Yes
Description:
The objectives of the proposed Project are to: increase the use, access and quality of basic services; and strengthen the Government's capacity to manage and monitor service delivery. The Project seeks to scale up two key Government programs to increase the use of and gradually improve the quality of basic services, with a focus on maternal and child health and nutrition. The Project would also reinforce the stewardship role of the Government and build capacity to manage and monitor service delivery. Although the Project would have a national scope, special emphasis will be placed on ensuring access to services in under-served rural areas and in communities where the vulnerable are being relocated, including in poor areas of Port au Prince.

" DATATABLE.24,2012-11-01T00:00:00,2013-11-24T19:00:00,-85.6023643,12.7690126,Central America,Central America,WHA,Central American Mezzanine Infrastructure Fund II,RG-L1051,Finance and Insurance,60000000,"The project consists of the establishment of the Central American Mezzanine Infrastructure Fund II to provide mezzanine lending NSG infrastructure projects in Central America (Costa Rica, El Salvador, Guatemala, Honduras, Nicaragua, and Panama) and the Caribbean (Barbados, Bahamas, Belize, Dominican Republic, Haiti, Jamaica, and Trinidad & Tobago) with a certain allocation of the Fund's resources to Mexico and Colombia (together the Targeted Region). The Fund will be a follow-on project to CAMIF I, which received an IDB senior loan of US$60 million that was approved in 2006. In light of the success of CAMIF I and the strong pipeline well in excess of CAMIF US$150 million, the fund manager is in the process of organizing and raising a second fund, CAMIF II, which will continue to support the long-term, quasi capital financing needs of mid-size companies and infrastructure projects in the target region.","Infrastructure, Finance",Inter-American Development Bank,2012-09-28,2020-01-01,Development Bank,Central American Mezzanine Fund,Central American Mezzanine Fund,"Daniel Fernando Fonseca, IDB team lead, danielfo@iadb.org",,,asikec@state.gov,"http://www.iadb.org/en/projects/project-description-title,1303.html?id=RG-L1051",http://costarica.usembassy.gov/business.html,,,1,Fulfilled,1,POINT (-9529211.604576299 1433354.7061220394),"
Central American Mezzanine Infrastructure Fund II
Country: Central America
Sector: Finance and Insurance
Date Added: 2012-11-01
Primary Funding Source: Development Bank
Project Size (USD): 60000000
Status: Fulfilled

Archived: Yes
Description:
The project consists of the establishment of the Central American Mezzanine Infrastructure Fund II to provide mezzanine lending NSG infrastructure projects in Central America (Costa Rica, El Salvador, Guatemala, Honduras, Nicaragua, and Panama) and the Caribbean (Barbados, Bahamas, Belize, Dominican Republic, Haiti, Jamaica, and Trinidad & Tobago) with a certain allocation of the Fund's resources to Mexico and Colombia (together the Targeted Region). The Fund will be a follow-on project to CAMIF I, which received an IDB senior loan of US$60 million that was approved in 2006. In light of the success of CAMIF I and the strong pipeline well in excess of CAMIF US$150 million, the fund manager is in the process of organizing and raising a second fund, CAMIF II, which will continue to support the long-term, quasi capital financing needs of mid-size companies and infrastructure projects in the target region.

" DATATABLE.98,2013-01-01T00:00:00,2013-12-04T00:00:00,51.17123,43.635609,Kazakhstan,"Aktau, Kazakhstan",SCA,Aktau Water Desalination Plant,42023,Utilities,12000000,"The EBRD is considering providing a $12 million senior loan to Caspiy Desalination Plant LLP to rehabilitate and modernize the water desalination plant supplying fresh water to the city of Aktau, in western Kazakhstan, the country's only seaport on the Caspian Sea. The project aims to improve the water supply services in Aktau by increasing the efficiency and production capacity of the plant. It also aims to improve the quality of the drinking water, introduce energy efficiency technologies in water desalination, and extend the plant's services to more residents of the city and its surrounding areas. Aktau Water Desalination Plant
Country: Kazakhstan
Sector: Utilities
Date Added: 2013-01-01
Primary Funding Source: Development Bank
Project Size (USD): 12000000
Status: Pipeline

Archived: Yes
Description:
The EBRD is considering providing a $12 million senior loan to Caspiy Desalination Plant LLP to rehabilitate and modernize the water desalination plant supplying fresh water to the city of Aktau, in western Kazakhstan, the country's only seaport on the Caspian Sea. The project aims to improve the water supply services in Aktau by increasing the efficiency and production capacity of the plant. It also aims to improve the quality of the drinking water, introduce energy efficiency technologies in water desalination, and extend the plant's services to more residents of the city and its surrounding areas. The loan will specifically replace the plant's obsolete equipment with modern technology to secure reliable high quality water supply.

Country: Indonesia
Sector: Utilities

Project Size (USD): 30000000
Status: Pipeline

Description:
The City of Surakarta has stressed the development of a waste management facility as its “most critical need” for investment capital. The city collects 350 tons of waste daily and its waste management facility no longer has the capacity to process or hold this volume. The city has dedicated 17 hectares for a new site and estimates the total amount of investment needed at $30 million.

Post Comments:
The Indonesian government would like this project to be procured as PPP and when bidding opens, the government is asking for bidders to be responsible for financing, engineering desgin, construction, and operation. The government will be responsible for land acquisition and partial construction to enhance the financial viability of the project.

Status: Pipeline

Description:
Nepal Rastra Bank is the central bank of Nepal. The Nepal Rastra Bank, Currency Management Department, has published a notice inviting global applications from Security Printers for pre-qualifying (PQ) for designing, printing and supply of Nepalese paper bank/currency notes of different denominations as per the requirement of the Bank. Interested security printers can purchase ‘Application Form’ upon submission of a written application addressed to the Executive Director, Nepal Rastra Bank, Currency Management Department, Thapathali, Kathmandu, Nepal during office hours from the first date of the publication of this notice. Forms will be available at the Currency Management Department, Thapathali, Kathmandu and Mint Division, Sundhara, Kathmandu upon payment of Rs. 15,000.00 ( Rupees Fifteen thousands), roughly US$ 150, which is non-refundable. Pre-qualification Documents completed in English should be submitted along with the receipt of the deposit and the purchased Form on or before February 22, 2015, during office hours (on or before 16:00 HRS NST) in a sealed envelope. Application received after the submission date and time would not be entertained. Mr. Suman Kumar Adhikari Executive Director Currency Management Department Nepal Rastra Bank Thapathali, Kathmandu, Nepal Tel. : +977 1 4227283 Fax : +977 1 4249541 Email : cmd@nrb.org.np

Post Comments:

The projects to be supported include four wind farms: Chiripa, Costa Rica (49.5MW) and Oaxaca II, Oaxaca III and Oaxaca IV, Mexico (102MW each). Acciona Energia is also considering two additional renewable energy concessions and intends to finance one of them through the proposed loan: a photovoltaic solar plant in Chile (30MW); or a wind plant in Punta Palmeras, Chile (39MW). The three Oaxaca projects recently completed construction and are in their long term take out financing phase, while the Chiripa wind farm is under due diligence for securing IDB financing (CR-L1060). Acciona Energia has 20 year experience in the renewable sector. Acciona, its parent company, has over 30,000 employees focused on sustainable renewable energy, infrastructure, water and environment projects.","Energy, Solar Power",Inter-American Development Bank,2012-09-17,2020-01-01,Development Bank,Acciona Energy,Acciona Energy,"Ivan Nunez, IDB team lead, ivann@iadb.org",,,asikec@state.gov,"http://www.iadb.org/en/projects/project-description-title,1303.html?id=RG-L1056",http://costarica.usembassy.gov/business.html,,,1,Fulfilled,1,POINT (-9529211.604576299 1433354.7061220394),"
Acciona Energia Renewable Energy Financing
Country: Central America
Sector: Utilities
Date Added: 2012-11-01
Primary Funding Source: Development Bank
Project Size (USD): 90000000
Status: Fulfilled

Archived: Yes
Description:
Acciona Energia, the wholly owned renewable energy subsidiary of the Spanish company Acciona, has requested an unsecured corporate loan from the IDB to support medium term financing of its equity contribution in renewable energy projects in the Region, totaling approximately 380MW. The projects to be supported include four wind farms: Chiripa, Costa Rica (49.5MW) and Oaxaca II, Oaxaca III and Oaxaca IV, Mexico (102MW each). Acciona Energia is also considering two additional renewable energy concessions and intends to finance one of them through the proposed loan: a photovoltaic solar plant in Chile (30MW); or a wind plant in Punta Palmeras, Chile (39MW). The three Oaxaca projects recently completed construction and are in their long term take out financing phase, while the Chiripa wind farm is under due diligence for securing IDB financing (CR-L1060). Acciona Energia has 20 year experience in the renewable sector. Acciona, its parent company, has over 30,000 employees focused on sustainable renewable energy, infrastructure, water and environment projects.

Project Website   Embassy Website   Contact

Kulon Progo International Airport (Yogyakarta)
Country: Indonesia
Sector: Transportation and Warehousing
Date Added: 2014-02-03
Primary Funding Source: Other
Project Size (USD): 500000000
Status: In Procurement

Description:
The Special Region of Yogyakarta (DIY) has plans to build a new airport that will accommodate its growing visitor traffic (up to 10 million passengers per year) and comply with international regulations. The project will be developed in the Kulon Progo Regency, where there are already 637 ha of dedicated land. The airport runway will have 3,250 meters of runway and the airport will be able to accommodate 28 aircraft..

Post Comments:
The Indonesian government would like this project to be procured as PPP and when bidding opens, the government is asking for bidders to be responsible for financing, engineering desgin, construction, and operation. The government will be responsible for land acquisition and partial construction to enhance the financial viability of the project.

" DATATABLE.813,2014-07-24T04:47:29.062,2014-07-25T11:50:30.896,12.087845000000016,55.64191,Denmark,Roskilde,,Denmark-Roskilde: Printed matter and related products,,Administrative and Support and Waste Management and Remediation Services,2200000,"Please see http://ted.europa.eu/TED/main/HomePage.do for all Danish public procurement. TED (Tenders Electronic Daily) is the online version of the 'Supplement to the Official Journal of the European Union', dedicated to European public procurement. Denmark-Roskilde: Printed matter and related products 2014/S 139-249248 Contract notice Supplies Directive 2004/18/EC Section I: Contracting authority I.1) Name, addresses and contact point(s) Roskilde Universitet Universitetsvej 1 For the attention of: Christian Lindemer 4000 Roskilde DENMARK Telephone: +45 53645132 E-mail: kontakt@tohv.dk Internet address(es): General address of the contracting authority: http://www.ruc.dk Further information can be obtained from: DENMARK Internet address: https://eu.eu-supply.com/login.asp?B=RUC Specifications and additional documents (including documents for competitive dialogue and a dynamic purchasing system) can be obtained from: DENMARK Internet address: https://eu.eu-supply.com/login.asp?B=RUC Tenders or requests to participate must be sent to: DENMARK Internet address: https://eu.eu-supply.com/login.asp?B=RUC I.2) Type of the contracting authority Other: Universitet I.3) Main activity Education I.4) Contract award on behalf of other contracting authorities The contracting authority is purchasing on behalf of other contracting authorities: no Section II: Object of the contract II.1) Description II.1.1) Title attributed to the contract by the contracting authority: Udbud af trykkeriydelser. II.1.2) Type of contract and location of works, place of delivery or of performance Supplies Purchase NUTS code DK022 II.1.3) Information about a public contract, a framework agreement or a dynamic purchasing system (DPS) The notice involves the establishment of a framework agreement II.1.4) Information on framework agreement Framework agreement with a single operator Duration of the framework agreement Duration in years: 2 Estimated total value of purchases for the entire duration of the framework agreement Estimated value excluding VAT: 12 000 000 DKK II.1.5) Short description of the contract or purchase(s) RUC søger en »full-scale« totalleverandør af alle typer af trykopgaver, fra basale sort/hvid kopi/print i mindre oplag til større digitale print-/kopiopgaver og endelig til store offset-produktioner — fra prøvetryk og trykstart til levering af den færdige tryksag. Opgaverne varierer fra mindre ad hoc-opgaver som forventeligt kan varetages af et on site trykkeri, til masseproduktioner, og der vil forekomme special- og rådgivningsopgaver af forskelligartet størrelse og karakter. Ordregiver ønsker at anskaffe trykkeriydelser omfattende: print og kopi af foldere, hæfter, magasiner/flexbind, løsblade/flyers, postkort, kuverter m. tryk, visitkort og plakater, omslag, blokke og eksamenspapir, samt kompendier og indleverede artikler såsom phd. afhandlinger mv. Desuden er vil aftalen blive anvendt til at købe roll-ups, bannere, flag og diverse merchandise. II.1.6) Common procurement vocabulary (CPV) 22000000, 22100000, 22110000, 22300000, 22400000, 22458000, 22460000, 22462000, 22610000, 22611000, 22800000, 22900000, 30197630, 30197645, 30199310, 30199700, 30199710, 30199711, 30199712, 30199740 II.1.7) Information about Government Procurement Agreement (GPA) The contract is covered by the Government Procurement Agreement (GPA): yes II.1.8) Lots This contract is divided into lots: no II.1.9) Information about variants Variants will be accepted: no II.2) Quantity or scope of the contract II.2.1) Total quantity or scope: Estimated value excluding VAT: 12 000 000 DKK II.2.2) Information about options Options: yes Description of these options: Rammeaftalen kan forlænges 2 x 12 måneder. II.2.3) Information about renewals This contract is subject to renewal: yes Number of possible renewals: 2 II.3) Duration of the contract or time limit for completion Duration in months: 48 (from the award of the contract) Section III: Legal, economic, financial and technical information III.1) Conditions relating to the contract III.1.1) Deposits and guarantees required: Ingen krav. III.1.2) Main financing conditions and payment arrangements and/or reference to the relevant provisions governing them: Priserne skal være faste de første 12 måneder regnet fra rammeaftalens start. Herefter kan der ske dokumenterede prisreguleringer. Prisreguleringerne kan ske én gang årligt svarende til udviklingen i Danmarks Statistik nettoprisindeks. Første prisregulering kan ske med virkning fra d. 1.10.2015. Betalingsbetingelser er: 30 dage netto fra korrekt modtaget faktura. III.1.3) Legal form to be taken by the group of economic operators to whom the contract is to be awarded: Konsortier: ved sammenslutninger af tilbudsgivere (konsortium) skal ovenstående oplysninger (del III) gives for hver deltager i konsortiet, ligesom det skal fremgå af tilbuddet, med hvilken tilbudsgiver, ordregiver kan føre afklarende drøftelser med bindende virkning for de(n) øvrige tilbudsgiver(e). Underleverandører: Tilbudsgiver kan i forbindelse med afgivelse af tilbud endvidere basere sig på en anden enheds økonomiske og finansielle formåen eller tekniske og/eller faglige formåen. I så fald skal tilbudsgiver vedlægge dokumentation for disse enheders forpligtelse i så henseende (underskrevet erklæring). III.1.4) Other particular conditions The performance of the contract is subject to particular conditions: no III.2) Conditions for participation III.2.1) Personal situation of economic operators, including requirements relating to enrolment on professional or trade registers Information and formalities necessary for evaluating if the requirements are met: Oplysninger om tilbudsgivers identitet (herunder CVR) samt anført kontaktperson med telefonnummer og mail-adresse. Udfyldt og underskrevet tro og love-erklæring om i hvilket omfang tilbudsgiver har ubetalt, forfalden gæld til det offentlige (jf. Finansministeriets bekendtgørelse nr. 336 af 13.5.1997) og om opfyldelse af udbudsdirektivets artikel 45. Fortrykt formular er vedlagt udbudsmaterialet som bilag 2. III.2.2) Economic and financial ability Information and formalities necessary for evaluating if the requirements are met: I muligt omfang, dvs. afhængigt af hvornår tilbudsgiver blev etableret eller startede sin virksomhed, oplysninger om tilbudsgivers samlede omsætning i de seneste 3 afsluttede regnskabsår, hvis tallene for denne omsætning foreligger. I muligt omfang, dvs. afhængigt af hvornår tilbudsgiver blev etableret eller startede sin virksomhed, nøgletal i form af tilbudsgivers egenkapital for de seneste 3 afsluttede regnskabsår. Kopi af tilbudsgivers relevante gyldige erhvervs- og produktansvarsforsikring. Minimum level(s) of standards possibly required: — Det er et mindstekrav, at tilbudsgiver de seneste 3 afsluttede regnskabsår har haft en positiv egenkapital. III.2.3) Technical capacity Information and formalities necessary for evaluating if the requirements are met: Referenceliste over de 3 betydeligste sammenlignelige referencer, hvori håndtering og produktion af trykkeriydelser og/eller rådgivning omkring kommunikationsfaglige leverancer indgår, der er udført i løbet af de sidste 3 år, med beskrivelse af leverancerne og angivelse af kontaktperson for den pågældende kunde med telefonnummer og/eller mail-adresse. En beskrivelse af de faglige kvalifikationer hos de personer, som bliver ansvarlige for udførelsen af trykkeriopgaverne og samarbejdet med RUC. Minimum level(s) of standards possibly required: — Det er et mindstekrav at de ansvarlige kontaktpersoner kan dokumentere erfaring med at løse opgaver for kunder/bestillere der ikke besidder trykkerifaglig viden. III.2.4) Information about reserved contracts III.3) Conditions specific to services contracts III.3.1) Information about a particular profession Execution of the service is reserved to a particular profession: no III.3.2) Staff responsible for the execution of the service Section IV: Procedure IV.1) Type of procedure IV.1.1) Type of procedure Open IV.1.2) Limitations on the number of operators who will be invited to tender or to participate IV.1.3) Reduction of the number of operators during the negotiation or dialogue IV.2) Award criteria IV.2.1) Award criteria Lowest price IV.2.2) Information about electronic auction An electronic auction will be used: no IV.3) Administrative information IV.3.1) File reference number attributed by the contracting authority: IV.3.2) Previous publication(s) concerning the same contract no IV.3.3) Conditions for obtaining specifications and additional documents or descriptive document Payable documents: no IV.3.4) Time limit for receipt of tenders or requests to participate 29.8.2014 - 10:00 IV.3.5) Date of dispatch of invitations to tender or to participate to selected candidates IV.3.6) Language(s) in which tenders or requests to participate may be drawn up Danish. IV.3.7) Minimum time frame during which the tenderer must maintain the tender Duration in months: 6 (from the date stated for receipt of tender) IV.3.8) Conditions for opening of tenders Date: 29.8.2014 - 10:00 Persons authorised to be present at the opening of tenders: no Section VI: Complementary information VI.1) Information about recurrence This is a recurrent procurement: no VI.2) Information about European Union funds The contract is related to a project and/or programme financed by European Union funds: no VI.3) Additional information For at modtage yderligere informationer om dette udbud, inklusive alle tillæg og/eller dokumenter og for at kunne anmode om dokumenter og/eller svar til dette udbud, skal du registrerer din interesse til dette udbud på den følgende side: https://www.eu-supply.com/ruc.asp VI.4) Procedures for appeal VI.4.1) Body responsible for appeal procedures Klagenævn for Udbud Dahlerups Pakhus, Langelinie Allé 17 2100 København Ø DENMARK E-mail: klfu@erst.dk Telephone: +45 35291000 Internet address: http://www.klfu.dk VI.4.2) Lodging of appeals Precise information on deadline(s) for lodging appeals: Håndhævelseslovens § 7 fastsætter følgende klagefrister for EU-udbud, som ordregiver henholder sig til: 1) Klage over ikke at være blevet prækvalificeret skal være indgivet til Klagenævnet for Udbud inden 30 kalenderdage regnet fra dagen efter den dag, hvor ordregiveren har afsendt en underretning til de berørte ansøgere om, hvem der er blevet prækvalificeret, jf. håndhævelseslovens § 2, stk. 1, nr. 1 hvis underretningen har angivet en kort redegørelse for de relevante grunde for beslutningen, jf. beslutningens § 7, stk. 1. 2) Klager over andet end ordregiverens prækvalifikationsbeslutninger under nr. 1) skal være indgivet til Klagenævnet for Udbud inden: 2.1) 6 måneder efter at ordregiveren har offentliggjort en bekendtgørelse i EU-Tidende om, at ordregiveren har indgået en kontrakt, hvor fristen regnes fra dagen efter den dag, hvor bekendtgørelsen er blevet offentliggjort. 2.2) 30 kalenderdage regnet fra dagen efter den dag, hvor ordregiveren har underrettet de berørte tilbudsgivere om, at en kontrakt baseret på en rammeaftale med genåbning af konkurrencen eller et dynamisk indkøbssystemer indgået, hvis underretningen har angivet en kort redegørelse for de relevante grunde for beslutningen. 2.3) 12 måneder efter at ordregiveren har indgået en rammeaftale regnet fra dagen efter den dag, hvor ordregiveren har underrettet de berørte ansøgere og tilbudsgivere, jf. håndhævelseslovens § 2, stk. 2. 3) Klager over kontraktindgåelse uden gennemførelse af udbud efter håndhævelseslovens § 4 skal være indgivet til Klagenævnet for Udbud inden 30 kalenderdage regnet fra dagen efter den dag, hvor ordregiveren har offentliggjort en bekendtgørelse i EU-Tidende om, at ordregiveren har indgået en kontrakt, forudsat at bekendtgørelsen indeholder begrundelsen for ordregiverens beslutning om at tildele kontrakten uden forudgående offentliggørelse af en udbudsbekendtgørelse i EU-Tidende. Ovenstående gælder også for sagsanlæg ved domstolene om, at de regler, der er nævnt i håndhævelseslovens § 1, stk. 2, nr. 1 og 2, er overtrådt, og ansøgeren ikke forinden har indgivet klage til Klagenævnet for Udbud herom. Konkurrence- og Forbrugerstyrelsens klage over ovenstående beslutninger skal være indgivet til Klagenævnet for Udbud inden 2 år efter at ordregiveren har offentliggjort en bekendtgørelse i EU-Tidende om, at ordregiveren har indgået en kontrakt, hvor fristen regnes fra dagen efter den dag, hvor bekendtgørelsen er blevet offentliggjort. For øvrige klager fastsætter håndhævelsesloven ikke nogen klagefrist. VI.4.3) Service from which information about the lodging of appeals may be obtained Konkurrence- og Forbrugerstyrelsen Carl Jacobsens Vej 35 2500 Valby DENMARK E-mail: kfst@kfst.dk Telephone: +45 41715000 Internet address: http://www.kfst.dk VI.5) Date of dispatch of this notice: 18.7.2014","Printed matter and related products. Printed books, brochures and leaflets. Printed books. Postcards, greeting cards and other printed matter. Stamps, cheque forms, banknotes, stock certificates, trade advertising material, catalogues and manuals. Bespoke printed matter. Trade-advertising material, commercial catalogues and manuals. Advertising material. Printing ink. Intaglio ink. Paper or paperboard registers, account books, binders, forms and other articles of printed stationery. Miscellaneous printed matter. Printing paper. Card for printing. Embossed or perforated printing paper. Printed stationery except forms. Printed envelopes. Printed window envelopes. Printed non-window envelopes. Compliment slips.",Post Identified Project,2014-07-23,2014-08-29,Other,,"Name, addresses and contact point(s) Roskilde Universitet Universitetsvej 1 For the attention of: Christian Lindemer 4000 Roskilde DENMARK Telephone: +45 53645132 E-mail: kontakt@tohv.dk Internet address(es): General address of the contracting authority: http://www.ruc.dk",,,Ulrik R. B Jakobsen,jakobsenur@state.gov,,http://denmark.usembassy.gov/business.html,,,1,In Procurement,0,POINT (1345612.7501880198 7487457.838996762),"
Denmark-Roskilde: Printed matter and related products
Country: Denmark
Sector: Administrative and Support and Waste Management and Remediation Services
Date Added: 2014-07-24
Primary Funding Source: Other
Project Size (USD): 2200000
Status: In Procurement

Description:
Please see http://ted.europa.eu/TED/main/HomePage.do for all Danish public procurement. TED (Tenders Electronic Daily) is the online version of the 'Supplement to the Official Journal of the European Union', dedicated to European public procurement. Denmark-Roskilde: Printed matter and related products 2014/S 139-249248 Contract notice Supplies Directive 2004/18/EC Section I: Contracting authority I.1) Name, addresses and contact point(s) Roskilde Universitet Universitetsvej 1 For the attention of: Christian Lindemer 4000 Roskilde DENMARK Telephone: +45 53645132 E-mail: kontakt@tohv.dk Internet address(es): General address of the contracting authority: http://www.ruc.dk Further information can be obtained from: DENMARK Internet address: https://eu.eu-supply.com/login.asp?B=RUC Specifications and additional documents (including documents for competitive dialogue and a dynamic purchasing system) can be obtained from: DENMARK Internet address: https://eu.eu-supply.com/login.asp?B=RUC Tenders or requests to participate must be sent to: DENMARK Internet address: https://eu.eu-supply.com/login.asp?B=RUC I.2) Type of the contracting authority Other: Universitet I.3) Main activity Education I.4) Contract award on behalf of other contracting authorities The contracting authority is purchasing on behalf of other contracting authorities: no Section II: Object of the contract II.1) Description II.1.1) Title attributed to the contract by the contracting authority: Udbud af trykkeriydelser. II.1.2) Type of contract and location of works, place of delivery or of performance Supplies Purchase NUTS code DK022 II.1.3) Information about a public contract, a framework agreement or a dynamic purchasing system (DPS) The notice involves the establishment of a framework agreement II.1.4) Information on framework agreement Framework agreement with a single operator Duration of the framework agreement Duration in years: 2 Estimated total value of purchases for the entire duration of the framework agreement Estimated value excluding VAT: 12 000 000 DKK II.1.5) Short description of the contract or purchase(s) RUC søger en »full-scale« totalleverandør af alle typer af trykopgaver, fra basale sort/hvid kopi/print i mindre oplag til større digitale print-/kopiopgaver og endelig til store offset-produktioner — fra prøvetryk og trykstart til levering af den færdige tryksag. Opgaverne varierer fra mindre ad hoc-opgaver som forventeligt kan varetages af et on site trykkeri, til masseproduktioner, og der vil forekomme special- og rådgivningsopgaver af forskelligartet størrelse og karakter. Ordregiver ønsker at anskaffe trykkeriydelser omfattende: print og kopi af foldere, hæfter, magasiner/flexbind, løsblade/flyers, postkort, kuverter m. tryk, visitkort og plakater, omslag, blokke og eksamenspapir, samt kompendier og indleverede artikler såsom phd. afhandlinger mv. Desuden er vil aftalen blive anvendt til at købe roll-ups, bannere, flag og diverse merchandise. II.1.6) Common procurement vocabulary (CPV) 22000000, 22100000, 22110000, 22300000, 22400000, 22458000, 22460000, 22462000, 22610000, 22611000, 22800000, 22900000, 30197630, 30197645, 30199310, 30199700, 30199710, 30199711, 30199712, 30199740 II.1.7) Information about Government Procurement Agreement (GPA) The contract is covered by the Government Procurement Agreement (GPA): yes II.1.8) Lots This contract is divided into lots: no II.1.9) Information about variants Variants will be accepted: no II.2) Quantity or scope of the contract II.2.1) Total quantity or scope: Estimated value excluding VAT: 12 000 000 DKK II.2.2) Information about options Options: yes Description of these options: Rammeaftalen kan forlænges 2 x 12 måneder. II.2.3) Information about renewals This contract is subject to renewal: yes Number of possible renewals: 2 II.3) Duration of the contract or time limit for completion Duration in months: 48 (from the award of the contract) Section III: Legal, economic, financial and technical information III.1) Conditions relating to the contract III.1.1) Deposits and guarantees required: Ingen krav. III.1.2) Main financing conditions and payment arrangements and/or reference to the relevant provisions governing them: Priserne skal være faste de første 12 måneder regnet fra rammeaftalens start. Herefter kan der ske dokumenterede prisreguleringer. Prisreguleringerne kan ske én gang årligt svarende til udviklingen i Danmarks Statistik nettoprisindeks. Første prisregulering kan ske med virkning fra d. 1.10.2015. Betalingsbetingelser er: 30 dage netto fra korrekt modtaget faktura. III.1.3) Legal form to be taken by the group of economic operators to whom the contract is to be awarded: Konsortier: ved sammenslutninger af tilbudsgivere (konsortium) skal ovenstående oplysninger (del III) gives for hver deltager i konsortiet, ligesom det skal fremgå af tilbuddet, med hvilken tilbudsgiver, ordregiver kan føre afklarende drøftelser med bindende virkning for de(n) øvrige tilbudsgiver(e). Underleverandører: Tilbudsgiver kan i forbindelse med afgivelse af tilbud endvidere basere sig på en anden enheds økonomiske og finansielle formåen eller tekniske og/eller faglige formåen. I så fald skal tilbudsgiver vedlægge dokumentation for disse enheders forpligtelse i så henseende (underskrevet erklæring). III.1.4) Other particular conditions The performance of the contract is subject to particular conditions: no III.2) Conditions for participation III.2.1) Personal situation of economic operators, including requirements relating to enrolment on professional or trade registers Information and formalities necessary for evaluating if the requirements are met: Oplysninger om tilbudsgivers identitet (herunder CVR) samt anført kontaktperson med telefonnummer og mail-adresse. Udfyldt og underskrevet tro og love-erklæring om i hvilket omfang tilbudsgiver har ubetalt, forfalden gæld til det offentlige (jf. Finansministeriets bekendtgørelse nr. 336 af 13.5.1997) og om opfyldelse af udbudsdirektivets artikel 45. Fortrykt formular er vedlagt udbudsmaterialet som bilag 2. III.2.2) Economic and financial ability Information and formalities necessary for evaluating if the requirements are met: I muligt omfang, dvs. afhængigt af hvornår tilbudsgiver blev etableret eller startede sin virksomhed, oplysninger om tilbudsgivers samlede omsætning i de seneste 3 afsluttede regnskabsår, hvis tallene for denne omsætning foreligger. I muligt omfang, dvs. afhængigt af hvornår tilbudsgiver blev etableret eller startede sin virksomhed, nøgletal i form af tilbudsgivers egenkapital for de seneste 3 afsluttede regnskabsår. Kopi af tilbudsgivers relevante gyldige erhvervs- og produktansvarsforsikring. Minimum level(s) of standards possibly required: — Det er et mindstekrav, at tilbudsgiver de seneste 3 afsluttede regnskabsår har haft en positiv egenkapital. III.2.3) Technical capacity Information and formalities necessary for evaluating if the requirements are met: Referenceliste over de 3 betydeligste sammenlignelige referencer, hvori håndtering og produktion af trykkeriydelser og/eller rådgivning omkring kommunikationsfaglige leverancer indgår, der er udført i løbet af de sidste 3 år, med beskrivelse af leverancerne og angivelse af kontaktperson for den pågældende kunde med telefonnummer og/eller mail-adresse. En beskrivelse af de faglige kvalifikationer hos de personer, som bliver ansvarlige for udførelsen af trykkeriopgaverne og samarbejdet med RUC. Minimum level(s) of standards possibly required: — Det er et mindstekrav at de ansvarlige kontaktpersoner kan dokumentere erfaring med at løse opgaver for kunder/bestillere der ikke besidder trykkerifaglig viden. III.2.4) Information about reserved contracts III.3) Conditions specific to services contracts III.3.1) Information about a particular profession Execution of the service is reserved to a particular profession: no III.3.2) Staff responsible for the execution of the service Section IV: Procedure IV.1) Type of procedure IV.1.1) Type of procedure Open IV.1.2) Limitations on the number of operators who will be invited to tender or to participate IV.1.3) Reduction of the number of operators during the negotiation or dialogue IV.2) Award criteria IV.2.1) Award criteria Lowest price IV.2.2) Information about electronic auction An electronic auction will be used: no IV.3) Administrative information IV.3.1) File reference number attributed by the contracting authority: IV.3.2) Previous publication(s) concerning the same contract no IV.3.3) Conditions for obtaining specifications and additional documents or descriptive document Payable documents: no IV.3.4) Time limit for receipt of tenders or requests to participate 29.8.2014 - 10:00 IV.3.5) Date of dispatch of invitations to tender or to participate to selected candidates IV.3.6) Language(s) in which tenders or requests to participate may be drawn up Danish. IV.3.7) Minimum time frame during which the tenderer must maintain the tender Duration in months: 6 (from the date stated for receipt of tender) IV.3.8) Conditions for opening of tenders Date: 29.8.2014 - 10:00 Persons authorised to be present at the opening of tenders: no Section VI: Complementary information VI.1) Information about recurrence This is a recurrent procurement: no VI.2) Information about European Union funds The contract is related to a project and/or programme financed by European Union funds: no VI.3) Additional information For at modtage yderligere informationer om dette udbud, inklusive alle tillæg og/eller dokumenter og for at kunne anmode om dokumenter og/eller svar til dette udbud, skal du registrerer din interesse til dette udbud på den følgende side: https://www.eu-supply.com/ruc.asp VI.4) Procedures for appeal VI.4.1) Body responsible for appeal procedures Klagenævn for Udbud Dahlerups Pakhus, Langelinie Allé 17 2100 København Ø DENMARK E-mail: klfu@erst.dk Telephone: +45 35291000 Internet address: http://www.klfu.dk VI.4.2) Lodging of appeals Precise information on deadline(s) for lodging appeals: Håndhævelseslovens § 7 fastsætter følgende klagefrister for EU-udbud, som ordregiver henholder sig til: 1) Klage over ikke at være blevet prækvalificeret skal være indgivet til Klagenævnet for Udbud inden 30 kalenderdage regnet fra dagen efter den dag, hvor ordregiveren har afsendt en underretning til de berørte ansøgere om, hvem der er blevet prækvalificeret, jf. håndhævelseslovens § 2, stk. 1, nr. 1 hvis underretningen har angivet en kort redegørelse for de relevante grunde for beslutningen, jf. beslutningens § 7, stk. 1. 2) Klager over andet end ordregiverens prækvalifikationsbeslutninger under nr. 1) skal være indgivet til Klagenævnet for Udbud inden: 2.1) 6 måneder efter at ordregiveren har offentliggjort en bekendtgørelse i EU-Tidende om, at ordregiveren har indgået en kontrakt, hvor fristen regnes fra dagen efter den dag, hvor bekendtgørelsen er blevet offentliggjort. 2.2) 30 kalenderdage regnet fra dagen efter den dag, hvor ordregiveren har underrettet de berørte tilbudsgivere om, at en kontrakt baseret på en rammeaftale med genåbning af konkurrencen eller et dynamisk indkøbssystemer indgået, hvis underretningen har angivet en kort redegørelse for de relevante grunde for beslutningen. 2.3) 12 måneder efter at ordregiveren har indgået en rammeaftale regnet fra dagen efter den dag, hvor ordregiveren har underrettet de berørte ansøgere og tilbudsgivere, jf. håndhævelseslovens § 2, stk. 2. 3) Klager over kontraktindgåelse uden gennemførelse af udbud efter håndhævelseslovens § 4 skal være indgivet til Klagenævnet for Udbud inden 30 kalenderdage regnet fra dagen efter den dag, hvor ordregiveren har offentliggjort en bekendtgørelse i EU-Tidende om, at ordregiveren har indgået en kontrakt, forudsat at bekendtgørelsen indeholder begrundelsen for ordregiverens beslutning om at tildele kontrakten uden forudgående offentliggørelse af en udbudsbekendtgørelse i EU-Tidende. Ovenstående gælder også for sagsanlæg ved domstolene om, at de regler, der er nævnt i håndhævelseslovens § 1, stk. 2, nr. 1 og 2, er overtrådt, og ansøgeren ikke forinden har indgivet klage til Klagenævnet for Udbud herom. Konkurrence- og Forbrugerstyrelsens klage over ovenstående beslutninger skal være indgivet til Klagenævnet for Udbud inden 2 år efter at ordregiveren har offentliggjort en bekendtgørelse i EU-Tidende om, at ordregiveren har indgået en kontrakt, hvor fristen regnes fra dagen efter den dag, hvor bekendtgørelsen er blevet offentliggjort. For øvrige klager fastsætter håndhævelsesloven ikke nogen klagefrist. National Urban Transport Improvement Project
