" DATATABLE.989,2014-11-20T01:33:28.711,2014-11-20T01:33:28.711,147.9145089,-41.698801,Australia,Northern Territory to the East Coast,,North East Gas Interconnector,,"Mining, Quarrying, and Oil and Gas Extraction",100000000,"The Northern Territory Government is calling for private sector proponents to submit an Expression of Interest (EOI) for the construction, operation and ownership of a gas pipeline connecting the Northern Territory to the Eastern Gas Market – the North East Gas Interconnector. Please email eoi.gaspipeline@nt.gov.au to request a copy of the EOI. Background The Northern Territory Government is working to facilitate the development of a gas pipeline connection from the Territory to meet energy demands on the eastern seaboard and to contribute to national energy security. The Northern Territory Government has granted Major Project Status to the proposed gas pipeline linking the Territory and East Coast gas grids and will now begin a formal search for proponents to build, own and operate the pipeline. “The construction of this gas pipeline is an infrastructure project of national significance. It’s also a matter of urgency for the eastern states which are fast approaching an energy security crisis,” Chief Minister Adam Giles said. An industry briefing was held in Alice Springs on 31 October 2014 to explain the project to potential proponents. The Northern Territory Government is now seeking formal Expressions of Interest. Council of Australian Governments (COAG) At the 38th meeting of the Council of Australian Governments on Friday, 10 October 2014, the nation’s leaders supported the connection of the Northern and Eastern Gas Markets. An extract from the 38th COAG communique on the gas pipeline is set out below: Gas pipeline connecting the Northern and Eastern Gas Markets COAG supported the work being undertaken by the Northern Territory to establish a competitive process for the private sector to bring forward proposals for the construction and operation of a pipeline to connect the Northern and Eastern Gas Markets. COAG agreed that connecting these gas markets is the next step to developing a national gas grid and will contribute to the development of a more national and competitive domestic gas market, helping to improve supply security. It is estimated that the Territory has more than 200 trillion cubic feet of unconventional gas resources in six onshore basins and 30 trillion cubic feet of conventional offshore reserves. Interest in the pipeline project is growing with more than 100 people attending an industry briefing in Alice Springs at the end of last month. Two routes have been proposed – one from Tennant Creek to Mt Isa in Queensland and the other from Alice Springs to Moomba in South Australia. Proposals will be accepted for both these routes or any other route that industry would like to suggest linking the two gas grids. Submissions close at 2pm (CST) on Monday 15 December 2014. ","pipeline, gas, EOI",Post Identified Project,2014-11-13,,Private,,Private companies and Government,General enquiries: gaspipeline@nt.gov.au; EOI enquiries: eoi.gaspipeline@nt.gov.au,The estimated value is not a real figure but a placeholder. Note that EOIs close at 2pm (CST) on Monday 15 December 2014.,Vanessa Colon,colonvd@state.gov,http://www.nt.gov.au/gaspipeline,,,,1,Pipeline,0,POINT (16465767.811685128 -5115967.53216824),"
North East Gas Interconnector
Country: Australia
Sector: Mining, Quarrying, and Oil and Gas Extraction
Date Added: 2014-11-20
Primary Funding Source: Private
Project Size (USD): 100000000
Status: Pipeline

Description:
The Northern Territory Government is calling for private sector proponents to submit an Expression of Interest (EOI) for the construction, operation and ownership of a gas pipeline connecting the Northern Territory to the Eastern Gas Market – the North East Gas Interconnector. Please email eoi.gaspipeline@nt.gov.au to request a copy of the EOI. Background The Northern Territory Government is working to facilitate the development of a gas pipeline connection from the Territory to meet energy demands on the eastern seaboard and to contribute to national energy security. The Northern Territory Government has granted Major Project Status to the proposed gas pipeline linking the Territory and East Coast gas grids and will now begin a formal search for proponents to build, own and operate the pipeline. “The construction of this gas pipeline is an infrastructure project of national significance. It’s also a matter of urgency for the eastern states which are fast approaching an energy security crisis,” Chief Minister Adam Giles said. An industry briefing was held in Alice Springs on 31 October 2014 to explain the project to potential proponents. The Northern Territory Government is now seeking formal Expressions of Interest. Council of Australian Governments (COAG) At the 38th meeting of the Council of Australian Governments on Friday, 10 October 2014, the nation’s leaders supported the connection of the Northern and Eastern Gas Markets. An extract from the 38th COAG communique on the gas pipeline is set out below: Gas pipeline connecting the Northern and Eastern Gas Markets COAG supported the work being undertaken by the Northern Territory to establish a competitive process for the private sector to bring forward proposals for the construction and operation of a pipeline to connect the Northern and Eastern Gas Markets. COAG agreed that connecting these gas markets is the next step to developing a national gas grid and will contribute to the development of a more national and competitive domestic gas market, helping to improve supply security. It is estimated that the Territory has more than 200 trillion cubic feet of unconventional gas resources in six onshore basins and 30 trillion cubic feet of conventional offshore reserves. Interest in the pipeline project is growing with more than 100 people attending an industry briefing in Alice Springs at the end of last month. Two routes have been proposed – one from Tennant Creek to Mt Isa in Queensland and the other from Alice Springs to Moomba in South Australia. Proposals will be accepted for both these routes or any other route that industry would like to suggest linking the two gas grids. Submissions close at 2pm (CST) on Monday 15 December 2014.

Post Comments:
The estimated value is not a real figure but a placeholder. Note that EOIs close at 2pm (CST) on Monday 15 December 2014.

Project Website   Contact

Macedonian Railways Transport JSC (‘MRT’) intends using the proceeds of a loan from the European Bank for Reconstruction and Development (the ‘Bank’) to finance the acquisition of new rolling stock as well as the rehabilitation of locomotives and maintenance workshops. The proposed project, which has a total estimated cost of EUR 59 million equivalent consists of the procurement of various goods, works and services. The following contracts remain to be procured under the project: Rehabilitation of three electric locomotives Rehabilitation of maintenance workshops Tendering for the above contracts is expected to begin in the second half of 2014. Contracts to be financed with the proceeds of a loan from the Bank will be subject to the Bank's Procurement Policies and Rules and will be open to firms from any country. The proceeds of the Bank's loan will not be used for the purpose of any payment to persons or entities, of for any import of goods, if such payment or import is prohibited by a decision of the United Nations Security Council taken under Chapter VII of the Charter of the United Nations or under a law of official regulation of the Purchaser's country.",Rehabilitation of three electric locomotives and rehabilitation of maintenance workshops,European Bank for Reconstruction and Development,2014-07-29,2014-10-15,Development Banks,Macedonian Railways Transport JSC (MRT),Macedonian Railways Transport JSC (MRT),"Macedonian Railways Transport JSC Skopje; Mr. Kire Dimanoski; III Makedonska Brigada 66; 1000, Skopje; Macedonia; tel: +389 2 324 8701; E-mail: kiredimanoski@mztransportad.com.mk",,"Arben Gega, Commercial Specialist",gegaa@state.gov,http://www.ebrd.com/english/pages/workingwithus/procurement/notices/project/140729a.shtml,http://macedonia.usembassy.gov/business.html,,,1,Pipeline,0,POINT (2385353.55891251 5160581.925968987),"

Sector: Transportation and Warehousing
Date Added: 2014-07-30

Project Size (USD): 79000000
Status: Pipeline

Description:
GENERAL PROCUREMENT NOTICE This GPN updates the previous version published on the Bank’s website on 15 July 2013. Macedonian Railways Transport JSC (‘MRT’) intends using the proceeds of a loan from the European Bank for Reconstruction and Development (the ‘Bank’) to finance the acquisition of new rolling stock as well as the rehabilitation of locomotives and maintenance workshops. The proposed project, which has a total estimated cost of EUR 59 million equivalent consists of the procurement of various goods, works and services. The following contracts remain to be procured under the project: Rehabilitation of three electric locomotives Rehabilitation of maintenance workshops Tendering for the above contracts is expected to begin in the second half of 2014. Contracts to be financed with the proceeds of a loan from the Bank will be subject to the Bank's Procurement Policies and Rules and will be open to firms from any country. The proceeds of the Bank's loan will not be used for the purpose of any payment to persons or entities, of for any import of goods, if such payment or import is prohibited by a decision of the United Nations Security Council taken under Chapter VII of the Charter of the United Nations or under a law of official regulation of the Purchaser's country.

Project Website   Embassy Website   " DATATABLE.922,2014-09-03T01:28:55.723,2014-09-03T01:28:55.723,121.62830980000001,-27.6728168,Australia,Western Australia,,Western Australia Government Asset Sales,,Transportation and Warehousing,1395000000,"On August 28, 2014 the State government of Western Australia announced details of its first round of asset sales. The structured progrram of asset sales is part of the WA government's strategy to reduce borrowings and regain a triple-A credit rating. Assets identified for sale are the Utah Point Bulk Handling Facility at Port Hedland in the state's northwest Pilbara, the Kwinana Bulk Terminal south of Perth, and Market City, a state-owned fresh fruit and vegetable market in the Perth metropolitan region. The Utah Point Bulk Handling Facility in Port Hedland is one of four berths owned by the Pilbara Ports Authority. It includes a shiploader, two stockyard product storage facilities and supporting infrastructure. It earned AUD$86.4million in revenue in the 2012-2013 financial year, with AUD$44.1million in expenditure. The Kwinana Bulk Terminal imports and exports bulk products including coal, iron ore, liquefied petroleum gas, cement clinker, gypsum, nut coke and slag. It is owned and operated by the Fremantle Port Authority. Total throughput was 5.2 million tonnes in 2012-2013, with a total revenue of AUD$61.6 million and total expenditure of AUD$36 million. Market City, located in Canning Vale and operated by the Perth Market Authority, markets and distributes fresh fruits and vegetables in Western Australia. It currently has 155 tenants. A condition of the sale is the ongoing operation of the markets. An invitation for Expressions of Interest will be released for bidders, followed by subsequent Request for Proposals from shortlisted bidders. http://www.mediastatements.wa.gov.au/Pages/StatementDetails.aspx?listName=StatementsBarnett&StatId=8584 ","Asset Sale, Bulk Handling Terminal, Fresh Produce Market",Post Identified Project,2014-08-28,,Private,,Western Australia State Government,http://www.mediastatements.wa.gov.au/Pages/StatementDetails.aspx?listName=StatementsBarnett&StatId=8584,,"Gina Soos, Economic Advisor, U.S. Consulate General Perth",soosrm@state.gov,http://www.mediastatements.wa.gov.au/Pages/StatementDetails.aspx?listName=StatementsBarnett&StatId=8584,http://perth.usconsulate.gov/,,,1,Pipeline,0,POINT (13539601.512982529 -3207785.7477162736),"
Western Australia Government Asset Sales
Country: Australia
Sector: Transportation and Warehousing
Date Added: 2014-09-03
Primary Funding Source: Private
Project Size (USD): 1395000000
Status: Pipeline

Description:
On August 28, 2014 the State government of Western Australia announced details of its first round of asset sales. The structured progrram of asset sales is part of the WA government's strategy to reduce borrowings and regain a triple-A credit rating. Assets identified for sale are the Utah Point Bulk Handling Facility at Port Hedland in the state's northwest Pilbara, the Kwinana Bulk Terminal south of Perth, and Market City, a state-owned fresh fruit and vegetable market in the Perth metropolitan region. The Utah Point Bulk Handling Facility in Port Hedland is one of four berths owned by the Pilbara Ports Authority. It includes a shiploader, two stockyard product storage facilities and supporting infrastructure. It earned AUD$86.4million in revenue in the 2012-2013 financial year, with AUD$44.1million in expenditure. The Kwinana Bulk Terminal imports and exports bulk products including coal, iron ore, liquefied petroleum gas, cement clinker, gypsum, nut coke and slag. It is owned and operated by the Fremantle Port Authority. Total throughput was 5.2 million tonnes in 2012-2013, with a total revenue of AUD$61.6 million and total expenditure of AUD$36 million. Market City, located in Canning Vale and operated by the Perth Market Authority, markets and distributes fresh fruits and vegetables in Western Australia. It currently has 155 tenants. A condition of the sale is the ongoing operation of the markets. An invitation for Expressions of Interest will be released for bidders, followed by subsequent Request for Proposals from shortlisted bidders. http://www.mediastatements.wa.gov.au/Pages/StatementDetails.aspx?listName=StatementsBarnett&StatId=8584

MEPSO Rehabilitation and Control Project
Country: Macedonia
Sector: Utilities
Date Added: 2014-07-30
Primary Funding Source: Development Banks
Project Size (USD): 54300000
Status: Pipeline

Description:
AD MEPSO (the Borrower or the Company), the electricity transmission system operator (TSO) in FYR Macedonia intends using the proceeds of a loan from the European Bank for the Rehabilitation and Modernisation of Transmission Grid and Power System Control Project. The proposed project, which has a total estimated cost of about EUR 40,5 Million will require the procurement of the following goods, works and services: Supply and installation of Equipment for sub-stations; Supply and installation of Remote monitoring, video supervision, controlling and adjustment of sub-stations; Closing of optical network in the transmission grid and preparation of a model for maximum utilization; Rehabilitation of 110 kV Overhead Transmission Lines (OHTL); Consulting services to the Project Implementation Unit (PIU). Tendering for the above contracts is expected to begin in the 1st quarter 2014. Contracts to be financed with the proceeds of a loan from the Bank will be subject to the Bank's Procurement Policies and Rules and will be open to firms from any country. The proceeds of the Bank's loan will not be used for the purpose of any payment to persons or entities, of for any import of goods, if such payment or import is prohibited by a decision of the United Nations Security Council taken under Chapter VII of the Charter of the United Nations or under a law of official regulation of the Purchaser's country.

" DATATABLE.494,2014-02-10T10:49:21.897,2014-02-10T10:49:21.897,10.165960000000041,36.81881,Tunisia,"Tunis, Ben Arous, Ariana, and Manouba ",,Construction of an exterior ring road in Greater Tunis,,Construction,266000000,"Project aims: the aim of the project is to build an exterior ring road in Greater Tunis. It consists in the following: - Provide links between the north, the west and the south Highways; - Reduce the pressure on some roads such as national roads 1,3,7 and 8; - Relieve congestion from expressways, currently used, responding to the needs of regional traffic, and equalize the load on the network;, - Provide a link between urban development and industrial areas; - Reduce transportation costs and increase time savings for users; - Reduce the number of accidents. Project owner: Ministry of Equipment and Environment Project components: construction of an exterior ring road in Greater Tunis to link between the A1, A3 and A4 highways with a length estimated to 80 km. Project estimated cost: the cost of the works is estimated at about 400 MTND. Project implementation status: - The call for tender concerning the studies was launched in October 2010. - The studies started in 2011 and will last 28 months; - The project steering committee approved the preparatory phase of the studies and selected the optimal track for the highway. - The detailed studies are in progress and they are expected to be completed in 2014. ",Road,Post Identified Project,2013-10-31,2013-10-31,Government,Ministry of Equipment and Environment,Ministry of Equipment and Environment,"Ministry of Equipment and Environment - Avenue Habib Chrita - Cité Jardins - 1002 Tunis Belvédère, Tunisia - Phone : (+216) 71 842 244 Fax : (+216) 71 840 495 e-mail : brc@mehat.gov.tn Website : http://www.equipement.tn","For more information about the status of the project, please email us.",Hanen Ltifi,ltifih@state.gov,http://www.investintunisia.tn/document/701.pdf,http://tunisia.usembassy.gov/business.html,,,1,Pipeline,0,POINT (1131669.490624792 4413881.240331966),"
Construction of an exterior ring road in Greater Tunis
Country: Tunisia
Sector: Construction
Date Added: 2014-02-10
Primary Funding Source: Government
Project Size (USD): 266000000
Status: Pipeline

Description:
Project aims: the aim of the project is to build an exterior ring road in Greater Tunis. It consists in the following: - Provide links between the north, the west and the south Highways; - Reduce the pressure on some roads such as national roads 1,3,7 and 8; - Relieve congestion from expressways, currently used, responding to the needs of regional traffic, and equalize the load on the network;, - Provide a link between urban development and industrial areas; - Reduce transportation costs and increase time savings for users; - Reduce the number of accidents. Project owner: Ministry of Equipment and Environment Project components: construction of an exterior ring road in Greater Tunis to link between the A1, A3 and A4 highways with a length estimated to 80 km. Project estimated cost: the cost of the works is estimated at about 400 MTND. Project implementation status: - The call for tender concerning the studies was launched in October 2010. - The studies started in 2011 and will last 28 months; - The project steering committee approved the preparatory phase of the studies and selected the optimal track for the highway. - The detailed studies are in progress and they are expected to be completed in 2014.

Post Comments:
For more information about the status of the project, please email us.

International Competitive Bidding for Engineering, Procuremet, and Construction (EPC) Package for 3 unit of 100/120 MW coal-based thermal Power Project in Senegal
Country: Senegal
Sector: Utilities
Date Added: 2014-02-28
Primary Funding Source: Private
Project Size (USD): 610000000
Status: In Procurement

Description:
Africa Energy SA (AESA) is implementing 3 unitsof 100/1020 W coal=-based thermal power plant at Darou Khoudoss, nera Mboro town, Thies, Senegal. Egateway India Pvt Ltd., the Consultant, invites bids on behalf of Africa Energy SA, under sealed cover in two parts (techno-commercial bid and price bid) from experienced individua/consortium/joint venture compny who should have extensive contracts on EPC basis and commisssioned at least one (1) year as on the Bid submission date. The crieria mentioned above should be met by one of the members or jointly by consortium/JV company. The brief scope of work on EPC package shall be design, engineering, procurement, supply, port clearance transportation to Site, handling, storage, erection, installation, testing, commissioning, performance testing, training of Owner's personnel and final completion of Coal Fired Thermal Power generation station including supply of mandatory/recommended spares and special tools and tackles. Detailed NIT with qualification requirements can be accesses at www.africaenergy-senegal.com Full set of diocuments can be obtained from the office of eGateway India, New Delhi from Febrruary 24, 2014 anytime between 10:00 am and 17:00 pm at a price of USD 1,800 by way of international pay order from reputed bank as Tender cost for EPC Package. The bid with supporting documents must be submitted in the office of eGateway, India by April 30, 2014 by 15:00 pm. Completion period of thework from date of Notice to Proceed (NTP) a) Commissioning of the 1st unit: 24 months B) Commissioning of the 2nd unit: 27 months c) Commissioning of the 3rd unit: 30 month Issuance of biidding documents will not be construed to mean that such Bidders are automatically considered to be qualified. Bidders meeting the qualifying requirements mentioned in NIT need to only apply. AESA/Consultant reserves the right to reject any offer as per their own discretion without assigning any reason whatsoever to the Bidder and the ASEA/Consultant will not be responsible for any liability arising out of this process Adresses: M/s eGateay India 8. Comunity Center, Mezzanine Floor, East of Kailash New Dehli - 110 065 India Tel: +91-11-26473020/21 Fax: + 91-11-42654618/26473021 Email: egateway@gmail.com

Post Comments:
Senegal has embarked in an energy plan which cals formore diversified sources of energy. As such, thecountry is looking atrenewable energy rojects. This project of a coal-fred plant is the second project of that kind to beimplemented in the country.

" DATATABLE.875,2014-08-12T09:44:32.32,2014-08-12T09:44:32.32,14.43780049999998,50.0755381,Czech Republic,Prague,,Reconstruction of NDT Kits,,Transportation and Warehousing,7094187,"The subject of the contract is the reconstruction and completion of diagnostic kits for non-destructive technologies for compact motor unit-destructive inspection (hereinafter referred to as ""DJ NDT"") used for automatic identification of internal and surface defects on railway rails. DJ NDT will consist of driving the vehicle, measuring and control of the car, as well as the car being equipped with measuring systems, ultrasonic rail inspection (UT), and the control of contact-fatigue defects in eddy current (ET). Details are contained in the technical conditions and specifications included in the tender documentation. Applicant qualification requirements: a) presentation of the ""certificate of technical competence of the supplier"" in the production, renovation, upgrading, repair, and inspection of railway vehicles and special vehicles derived from the scope of the Guideline SZDC no. j. 4859/2010-TÚDC and in accordance with SŽDC regulation S8 - Operation, maintenance and repair of special vehicles; b) Submission of photos and descriptions (including technical documentation) of the performance of the subject with the technological parts - (diagnostic and measuring systems) which will be evident in their functionality at least to the extent of the required parameters and properties (with an emphasis on systems UT and ET); c) placing at least one reference case of deployment and operational use of the supplied technology systems, including statements of the operators of these systems that all systems work reliably, at least to the extent required by the parameters and properties (with an emphasis on systems UT and ET)","Railways, transportation, ",Post Identified Project,,2014-09-09,Government,,Railway Infrastructure Administration - Správa železni?ní dopravní cesty ,,,Elaine Kelley,KelleyEV@state.gov,,,,,1,In Procurement,0,POINT (1607208.5998348682 6459368.000927814),"
Reconstruction of NDT Kits
Country: Czech Republic
Sector: Transportation and Warehousing
Date Added: 2014-08-12
Primary Funding Source: Government
Project Size (USD): 7094187
Status: In Procurement

Description:
The subject of the contract is the reconstruction and completion of diagnostic kits for non-destructive technologies for compact motor unit-destructive inspection (hereinafter referred to as ""DJ NDT"") used for automatic identification of internal and surface defects on railway rails. DJ NDT will consist of driving the vehicle, measuring and control of the car, as well as the car being equipped with measuring systems, ultrasonic rail inspection (UT), and the control of contact-fatigue defects in eddy current (ET). Details are contained in the technical conditions and specifications included in the tender documentation. Applicant qualification requirements: a) presentation of the ""certificate of technical competence of the supplier"" in the production, renovation, upgrading, repair, and inspection of railway vehicles and special vehicles derived from the scope of the Guideline SZDC no. j. 4859/2010-TÚDC and in accordance with SŽDC regulation S8 - Operation, maintenance and repair of special vehicles; b) Submission of photos and descriptions (including technical documentation) of the performance of the subject with the technological parts - (diagnostic and measuring systems) which will be evident in their functionality at least to the extent of the required parameters and properties (with an emphasis on systems UT and ET); c) placing at least one reference case of deployment and operational use of the supplied technology systems, including statements of the operators of these systems that all systems work reliably, at least to the extent required by the parameters and properties (with an emphasis on systems UT and ET)

Contact

" DATATABLE.739,2014-04-18T00:24:06.719,2014-04-18T00:24:06.719,82.38857830000006,29.0164923,Nepal,Midwestern Development Region,,Bheri Babai Diversion Multipurpose Project,,Construction,150000000,"Bheri Babai Diversion Multipurpose Project (BBDMP) aims to divert 40 cubic meters of water per second from the Bheri River to the Babai basin to irrigate 51,000 Ha agricultural land in Bardi and Banke districts as well as generate around 400 GWH hydroelectric energy annually. Main work under the contract includes construction of a 12 km long headrace runnel with about 4.2 m finished diameter. The tunnel shall be constructed using a suitable shield-type of Tunnel Boring Machine (TBM) and lined with precast concrete segments. It is expected that invitations to bid will be made in June 2014. Prequalification will be conducted following the criteria contained in the prequalification documents and is open to all eligible bidders. A complete set of prequalification documents in English may be purchased by interested bidders upon submission of a written application and a non refundable fee of NPR 15,000 (fifteen thousand Nepali rupees). Applications for prequalification should be submitted by June 2, 2014. ","irrigation, hydropower, construction",Post Identified Project,2014-04-17,2014-06-02,Government,,Government of Nepal,,,Christopher Collington,CollingtonCS@state.gov,http://www.doi.gov.np,,,,1,Pipeline,0,POINT (9171454.583537756 3377745.3026681077),"
Bheri Babai Diversion Multipurpose Project
Country: Nepal
Sector: Construction
Date Added: 2014-04-18
Primary Funding Source: Government
Project Size (USD): 150000000
Status: Pipeline

Description:
Bheri Babai Diversion Multipurpose Project (BBDMP) aims to divert 40 cubic meters of water per second from the Bheri River to the Babai basin to irrigate 51,000 Ha agricultural land in Bardi and Banke districts as well as generate around 400 GWH hydroelectric energy annually. Main work under the contract includes construction of a 12 km long headrace runnel with about 4.2 m finished diameter. The tunnel shall be constructed using a suitable shield-type of Tunnel Boring Machine (TBM) and lined with precast concrete segments. It is expected that invitations to bid will be made in June 2014. Prequalification will be conducted following the criteria contained in the prequalification documents and is open to all eligible bidders. A complete set of prequalification documents in English may be purchased by interested bidders upon submission of a written application and a non refundable fee of NPR 15,000 (fifteen thousand Nepali rupees). Applications for prequalification should be submitted by June 2, 2014.

Project Website   Contact

The government will be responsible for land acquisition and partial construction to enhance the financial viability of the project.",Tristan Allen,allentj@state.gov,,http://jakarta.usembassy.gov/doing-business-local.html,,,1,Pipeline,0,POINT (12826465.388812162 -967300.6642137526),"
Southern Bali Water Supply
Country: Indonesia
Sector: Utilities
Date Added: 2014-02-03
Primary Funding Source: Private
Project Size (USD): 287000000
Status: Pipeline

Description:
The Government of Klungkung Regency has set a plan to improve the water supply in the Denpasar, Badung, Gianyar, and Klungkung areas. Tourism and related development in Southern Bali is currently being constrained by an inadequate drinking water supply. The Southern Bali Water Supply project includes a water treatment plant, a reservoir, and transmission pipe, and the operation and management of the WTP to provide 1,000 liters/sec.

Post Comments:
The Indonesian government would like this project to be procured as PPP and when bidding opens, the government is asking for bidders to be responsible for financing, engineering desgin, construction, and operation. The government will be responsible for land acquisition and partial construction to enhance the financial viability of the project.

Rehabilitation of the railway line between Sousse, Kairouan and Kasserine
Country: Tunisia
Sector: Construction
Date Added: 2014-02-10
Primary Funding Source: Government
Project Size (USD): 150000000
Status: Pipeline

Description:
The project aims to promote the development of priority areas and reactivate the old line between Kasserine and Sousse, which will be achieved through linking the economic pole of the Sousse area, which hosting major projects and those planned in the air and sea ports infrastructure as well as in logistics and industrial areas; -The project will reduce trip time of two hours and half, which will encourage future investments in underdeveloped areas Project components: -Completion of a new line between Manzel Mhiri and Sbeitla over a length of 126 km through Sidi Bouzid. -Renovation of the line between Hajeb Laayoun and Kasserine and between Ain Gzazia and Manzel Mhiri. -Linking Kairouan to Sousse and better exploitation of existing infrastructure. Project components: U.S. $ 150 million (225 million Tunisian dinars) External financing needs: U.S. $ 100 million (150.0 million Tunisian dinars) Implementation period: 5 years. Project status: the line between Kairouan and Sousse and between Kairouan and Hajeb Laayoun is currently under study.

Post Comments:
For more information about the status of the project, please email us.

Project Website   Embassy Website   " DATATABLE.488,2014-02-07T16:44:32.853,2014-02-07T16:44:32.853,117.28492299999994,31.861184,China,Anhui,,Anhui Intermodal Sustainable Transport Development Project,45021-002,Transportation and Warehousing,200000000,"The Government of the People's Republic of China has requested a loan of $200.0 million from ADB's ordinary capital resources to help finance the Anhui Intermodal Sustainable Transport Project. ","Transport, Sustainable",Asian Development Bank,,,Development Banks,Government of the People's Republic of China,"Anhui provincial government, Anhui Provincial Department of Transport (APDOT).","Sharad Saxena, ssaxena@adb.org",,Chuka Asike,asikec@state.gov,http://www.adb.org/projects/45021-002/main,http://beijing.usembassy-china.org.cn/,,,1,Pipeline,1,POINT (13056097.906088293 3745102.6315689352),"

Country: China
Sector: Transportation and Warehousing
Date Added: 2014-02-07
Primary Funding Source: Development Banks
Project Size (USD): 200000000
Status: Pipeline

Archived: Yes
Description:
The Government of the People's Republic of China has requested a loan of $200.0 million from ADB's ordinary capital resources to help finance the Anhui Intermodal Sustainable Transport Project. The project will (i) upgrade sections of provincial and national highways in Anhui Province and improve the safety features on these roads; (ii) develop new highway sections designed to support public and nonmotorized transport; (iii) improve the capacity of the province's inland waterway network, (iv) construct an intermodal inland river port on the upgraded inland water channel, and (v) strengthen institutional capacity for road and inland water transport.

Project Size (USD): 1250000000
Status: In Procurement

Description:
Croatian electricity company HEP is planning to find foreign investors to construct a 500 MW third unit at the Plomin coal power plant on the Croatian coast in Istria County. The plant would run on coal transported by sea to the plant. HEP completed the second phase of the procedure for selecting the strategic partner in the construction and management of Plomin C thermal power plant by determining the bidders' ranking. The procedure will be continued in a form of negotiations with the prefereed bidder - 1. Marubeni (Japan), 2. Abenisa and Daewoo (Spain), 3. Edison (Italy). HEP aims at completing these negotiations by the end of this year and preparing the contracts to be signed in early 2015.

The main objective of acquiring the new ERP is to take advantage of the lastest technology in the ERP industry and to address the current system's weaknesses including security, key functionalities, bank reconciliation facility, systems for collection and tracking revenue, reports, and interfacing. Sector: Information
Date Added: 2015-02-19

Status: In Procurement

Description:
The Ministry of Finance, Economic Planning and Developments invites sealed proposals for the supply, customization, installation, configuration, integration, testing, deployment, and commissions the Enterprise Resource Planning (ERP) to drive the Integrated Financial Management Information System (IFMIS). Proposals should be based on any Oracle, SAP, or Epicor. The main objective of acquiring the new ERP is to take advantage of the lastest technology in the ERP industry and to address the current system's weaknesses including security, key functionalities, bank reconciliation facility, systems for collection and tracking revenue, reports, and interfacing. The new ERP is expected to be operational by July 1, 2016. It is expected that the successful bidder will begin work in May 2015 for a minimum period of 6 months. A complete set of bidding documents in English may be obtained from the address below upon payment of a non-refundable fee of USD500. Proposals must be delivered to the address below before 3:00 p.m. local time on March 9, 2015.

" DATATABLE.807,2014-07-23T06:16:49.75,2014-07-23T11:43:46.452,19.04023499999994,47.497912,Hungary,Budapest,,Automated Fare Collection System,44630,Transportation and Warehousing,100000000,"The foundation of the Centre for Budapest Transport (BKK) and the introduction of a new approach in the organization of transport, the time has come for ultimate changing the present fare scheme in Budapest, which is one of the most outdated systems in Europe. According to three decisions passed at its 6 April 2011 session, the General Assembly of the Municipality of Budapest called upon BKK to design and implement the new automated fare collection system. With the implementation of the new system we can introduce new types of ticket products that are working well in other cities, making the public transport more popular for passengers. In addition, our concept offers effective action against fare evasion and counterfeiting of passes at the same time. The system will be simple and easy to comprehend for passengers, but it will be backed by one of the most complex payment processing and IT development projects in Hungary when it comes to the type and number of transactions and the complexity of the system; therefore, thorough preparation is particularly important. The renewal of the fare system is one of our most important and challenging tasks, and the introduction of similar systems took several years even in Western European cities that had much more advanced technologies in place. The project requires the installation of new ticket validators on every vehicle, the installation of automatic gates on metro stations and manufacturing and distributing pass cards to hundreds of thousands of passengers. The switch from the old system to the new one will be successful if it is executed in accordance with a well thought-out and thoroughly planned structure, taking into account a variety of considerations. Therefore, the gradual introduction of the system will require several years, starting in 2014. The feasibility pre-study of the project was prepared in December 2011 by the dedicated project team of BKK. The strategic objectives of the new fare scheme were deduced from urban policy purposes and the study defines conceptually the operating principles and logic of the new system. The document – that was approved by the General Assembly in January 2012 – recommends starting/continuing the preparations of the project, provides information regarding the system to be implemented, the possible schedule of implementation, the projected costs and longer-term operational cost savings, and proposes possible sources of financing.",fare collection,European Bank for Reconstruction and Development,,,Development Banks,,Budapest Transport Center (BKK),,,Maximilian Gebhardt,gebhardtmr@state.gov,http://www.bkk.hu/en/2013/01/ebrd/,http://hungary.usembassy.gov/business.html,,,1,In Procurement,0,POINT (2119549.2647842583 6023728.078752173),"
Automated Fare Collection System
Country: Hungary
Sector: Transportation and Warehousing
Date Added: 2014-07-23
Primary Funding Source: Development Banks
Project Size (USD): 100000000
Status: In Procurement

Description:
The foundation of the Centre for Budapest Transport (BKK) and the introduction of a new approach in the organization of transport, the time has come for ultimate changing the present fare scheme in Budapest, which is one of the most outdated systems in Europe. According to three decisions passed at its 6 April 2011 session, the General Assembly of the Municipality of Budapest called upon BKK to design and implement the new automated fare collection system. With the implementation of the new system we can introduce new types of ticket products that are working well in other cities, making the public transport more popular for passengers. In addition, our concept offers effective action against fare evasion and counterfeiting of passes at the same time. The system will be simple and easy to comprehend for passengers, but it will be backed by one of the most complex payment processing and IT development projects in Hungary when it comes to the type and number of transactions and the complexity of the system; therefore, thorough preparation is particularly important. The renewal of the fare system is one of our most important and challenging tasks, and the introduction of similar systems took several years even in Western European cities that had much more advanced technologies in place. The project requires the installation of new ticket validators on every vehicle, the installation of automatic gates on metro stations and manufacturing and distributing pass cards to hundreds of thousands of passengers. The switch from the old system to the new one will be successful if it is executed in accordance with a well thought-out and thoroughly planned structure, taking into account a variety of considerations. Therefore, the gradual introduction of the system will require several years, starting in 2014. The feasibility pre-study of the project was prepared in December 2011 by the dedicated project team of BKK. The strategic objectives of the new fare scheme were deduced from urban policy purposes and the study defines conceptually the operating principles and logic of the new system. The document – that was approved by the General Assembly in January 2012 – recommends starting/continuing the preparations of the project, provides information regarding the system to be implemented, the possible schedule of implementation, the projected costs and longer-term operational cost savings, and proposes possible sources of financing.

Post Comments:


Project Website   Embassy Website   Contact

The partnership also recognizes private sector development, knowledge solutions, capacity development, and gender equity as major drivers of change to maximize development impacts in the PRC. The proposed project will promote inclusive growth in the project area through improving rural livelihood. Agricultural productivity will be enhanced through providing financial and technical support to private agricultural enterprises and farmer cooperatives for the construction of standard production and/or processing bases and strengthening of governance and management capacity. Further development of rural financial services will expand access to finance among rural residents and agricultural enterprises. The project has significant potential for innovation and knowledge generation in agricultural and rural finance, sustainable use of water resources, poverty targeting and reduction, and scientific evaluation of development interventions. Gansu Featured Agriculture and Financial Services System Development Project
Country: China
Sector: Administrative and Support and Waste Management and Remediation Services
Date Added: 2014-02-21
Primary Funding Source: Development Banks
Project Size (USD): 100000
Status: Pipeline

Description:
ADB s country partnership strategy for PRC (2011 2015) identifies inclusive growth as one of the three pillars in the partnership which will be supported by boosting rural livelihoods and improving access to microfinance and small and medium enterprise finance. The partnership also recognizes private sector development, knowledge solutions, capacity development, and gender equity as major drivers of change to maximize development impacts in the PRC. The proposed project will promote inclusive growth in the project area through improving rural livelihood. Agricultural productivity will be enhanced through providing financial and technical support to private agricultural enterprises and farmer cooperatives for the construction of standard production and/or processing bases and strengthening of governance and management capacity. Further development of rural financial services will expand access to finance among rural residents and agricultural enterprises. The project has significant potential for innovation and knowledge generation in agricultural and rural finance, sustainable use of water resources, poverty targeting and reduction, and scientific evaluation of development interventions. Finally, the project

Post Comments:

The scope includes real-time monitoring of the following parameters: pH, Chemical Oxygen Demand, Conductivity and Flow (inffluent and effluent) at Nhlambeni and Ezulwini Waste Water Treatment Plants. Bid documents may be purchased from the SWSC website www.swsc.co.sz or the revenue office at Gables Shopping Complex, MR103 Road, Ezulwini, Swaziland, for a non refundable fee of E500.00 (USD50.00) Proof of payment for bid documents must be included in the bid. Tender bids shall be valid for a period of 90 days after bid opening and must be accompanied by a tender bond of E10,000.00 (USD1,000.00) and hand delivered in a sealed envelope clarly marked ""Supply, Installation, Calibration and Commissioning of On-Line Quality Monitoring Instruments: to a designated tender box at the following address: The Managing Director, Swaziland Water Servoces Corporation, Emtfjonjeni Headquarters Building, Cnr MR 103 and Cultural Village Road, Ezulwini, Swaziland. The closing time for receipt of tenders is 12:00 hours on Friday September 12, 2014 at which time bids will be opened in the presence of bidders who elect to attend. Telegraphic, telephonic, telex, facsimile, email and late tenders will not be accepted. A compulsory site inspection will be conducted on Friday, August 29 at 10:00 hours and prospective bidders shall meet the Corporation's representative at the SWSC Ezulwini Waste Water Treatment Plant, exit onto D36 before proceeding to the rest of the sites within the same day.",Swaziland Water Services Corporation,Post Identified Project,2014-08-26,2014-09-12,Development Banks,African Development Bank,Swaziland Water Services Corporation,+268 2416 9000,SWSC is a parastatal but wholly owned by the Swaziland Government.,Christian Olsen,olsencr@state.gov,Http://www.swsc.co.sz,http://swaziland.usembassy.gov/ ,,,1,In Procurement,0,POINT (3469457.5001635184 -3048707.597328697),"
Supply, Installation, Calibratuion and Commissioning of On-line Quality Monitoring Instruments
Country: Swaziland
Sector: Utilities
Date Added: 2014-08-26
Primary Funding Source: Development Banks
Project Size (USD): 1000
Status: In Procurement

Description:
The Swaziland Water Services Corporation (SWSC) invites eligible companies registered with reputable profession bodies in Swaziland and/or elsewhere to submit proposals for the Supply, Installation, Calibration and Commissioning of On-Line Quality Monitoring Instruments. The scope includes real-time monitoring of the following parameters: pH, Chemical Oxygen Demand, Conductivity and Flow (inffluent and effluent) at Nhlambeni and Ezulwini Waste Water Treatment Plants. Bid documents may be purchased from the SWSC website www.swsc.co.sz or the revenue office at Gables Shopping Complex, MR103 Road, Ezulwini, Swaziland, for a non refundable fee of E500.00 (USD50.00) Proof of payment for bid documents must be included in the bid. Tender bids shall be valid for a period of 90 days after bid opening and must be accompanied by a tender bond of E10,000.00 (USD1,000.00) and hand delivered in a sealed envelope clarly marked ""Supply, Installation, Calibration and Commissioning of On-Line Quality Monitoring Instruments: to a designated tender box at the following address: The Managing Director, Swaziland Water Servoces Corporation, Emtfjonjeni Headquarters Building, Cnr MR 103 and Cultural Village Road, Ezulwini, Swaziland. The closing time for receipt of tenders is 12:00 hours on Friday September 12, 2014 at which time bids will be opened in the presence of bidders who elect to attend. Telegraphic, telephonic, telex, facsimile, email and late tenders will not be accepted. A compulsory site inspection will be conducted on Friday, August 29 at 10:00 hours and prospective bidders shall meet the Corporation's representative at the SWSC Ezulwini Waste Water Treatment Plant, exit onto D36 before proceeding to the rest of the sites within the same day.

Post Comments:
SWSC is a parastatal but wholly owned by the Swaziland Government.

Firms are invited to submit proposals and applications will be evaluated according to the following basic criteria, among others, as required by this request for proposal (RFP): • General background of the firm • Financial capability of the firm • Performance history • Work experience of the firm in performing construction services for projects of a similar value and nature • Available manpower and other resources • Present workload • Eligibility based on submission of required statutory certificates (local firms) Proponents are advised that request for proposal packages (RFP) will be available for download at www.nipdec.com upon payment of the tender fee of TT$3,450.00. Only firms purchasing the RFP package shall be permitted to submit a proposal. Any proposal submitted by a firm which has not purchased a RFP package will be rejected as invalid. Submission deadline: March 19th, 2015 at 2:00pm. Late applications will not be accepted. Electronic tender submissions will not be accepted. Country: Trinidad and Tobago
Sector: Construction
Date Added: 2015-02-04
Primary Funding Source: Government
Project Size (USD): 30000000
Status: In Procurement

Description:
The National Property Development Company Limited (NIPDEC), acting on behalf of the Ministry of Health, Government of Trinidad and Tobago invites proponents for the construction and equipping of the Chaguanas Health facility. Firms are invited to submit proposals and applications will be evaluated according to the following basic criteria, among others, as required by this request for proposal (RFP): • General background of the firm • Financial capability of the firm • Performance history • Work experience of the firm in performing construction services for projects of a similar value and nature • Available manpower and other resources • Present workload • Eligibility based on submission of required statutory certificates (local firms) Proponents are advised that request for proposal packages (RFP) will be available for download at www.nipdec.com upon payment of the tender fee of TT$3,450.00. Only firms purchasing the RFP package shall be permitted to submit a proposal. Any proposal submitted by a firm which has not purchased a RFP package will be rejected as invalid. Submission deadline: March 19th, 2015 at 2:00pm. Late applications will not be accepted. Electronic tender submissions will not be accepted. Complete proposals must be addressed to: The chairman of the Tenders Committee National Insurance Property Development Company Limited (NIPDEC) 56-60 St. Vincent Street Port of Spain, Republic of Trinidad and Tobago The proposal must be accompanied by a tender security of fifteen thousand, six hundred and twenty five U.S. dollars. Please note that proponents shall bear all costs associated with the preparation and submission of the proposal including the tender fee which is not reimbursable. Non T&T proponents are expected to comply with the requirements in the RFP package to the extent to which such requirements are applicable to them.

PRDP aims to increase farm and fishery productivity and incomes in the targeted program areas. Philippine Rural Development Program
Country: Philippines
Sector: Agriculture, Forestry, Fishing and Hunting
Date Added: 2013-02-01
Primary Funding Source: Development Bank
Project Size (USD): 501000000
Status: Pipeline

Archived: Yes
Description:
The proposed Philippine Rural Development Program (PRDP) would build on the experiences and approach developed over the past decade from the Department of Agriculture's implementation of two Mindanao Rural Development projects. PRDP aims to increase farm and fishery productivity and incomes in the targeted program areas. This will be done by improving access to a strategic network of infrastructure, market information, support services, and increasing the value of producers' market surplus. In support of the Philippines' decentralization goals, the project will engage with the local government units to carry out its activities.

Sector: Utilities
Date Added: 2013-01-01
Primary Funding Source: Development Bank
Project Size (USD): 1500000
Status: Fulfilled

Archived: Yes
Description:
The EBRD is considering financing the Kant Water Sub-Project. The EBRD would extend a sovereign loan of up to $ 1.5 million to the Kyrgyz Republic, to be on-lent to Kant City for improvement of water supply services. Water supply services in Kant are managed by a private operator under a lease agreement. The overall objectives of this sub-project Priority Investment Plan (PIP) are to: (a) rehabilitate the water supply network; and (b) improve financial and operational management through the implementation of a city-wide metering program to bring water production and consumption under control.

" DATATABLE.95,2013-01-01T00:00:00,2013-11-24T19:00:00,84.124008,28.394857,Nepal,Nepal,SCA,Sub regional Electricity Transmission Capacity Expansion Project,44219-013,Utilities,225000,"The Sub-regional Transmission Capacity Expansion Project (Project) is included in COBP 2013-2015 and Regional COBP 2012-2014, and is scheduled for consideration by ADB's board in 2014. Transmission network strengthening and expansion, in conjunction with current hydropower generation development, is a precondition to reducing load shedding and increased cross border electricity trade. The Project targets the strengthening and expansion of transmission systems and enables Nepal to further benefit its abundant hydropower resources. The proposed S-PPTA will help finalize the scope of subprojects to be included in the Project, and make initial assessment on technical, financial, economic, environmental and social aspects of the selected subprojects, which will be the necessary inputs for further processing the Project in next stage.","Energy, Electricity Transmission",Asian Development Bank,2012-12-13,2020-01-01,Development Bank,,"Nepal Electricity Authority, NEA",Zhang Lei (zlei@adb.org),,,,http://www.adb.org/projects/44219-013/main,http://nepal.usembassy.gov/business.html,,,1,Fulfilled,1,POINT (9364641.734049272 3298848.051850203),"
Sub regional Electricity Transmission Capacity Expansion Project
Country: Nepal
Sector: Utilities
Date Added: 2013-01-01
Primary Funding Source: Development Bank
Project Size (USD): 225000
Status: Fulfilled

Archived: Yes
Description:
The Sub-regional Transmission Capacity Expansion Project (Project) is included in COBP 2013-2015 and Regional COBP 2012-2014, and is scheduled for consideration by ADB's board in 2014. Transmission network strengthening and expansion, in conjunction with current hydropower generation development, is a precondition to reducing load shedding and increased cross border electricity trade. The Project targets the strengthening and expansion of transmission systems and enables Nepal to further benefit its abundant hydropower resources. The proposed S-PPTA will help finalize the scope of subprojects to be included in the Project, and make initial assessment on technical, financial, economic, environmental and social aspects of the selected subprojects, which will be the necessary inputs for further processing the Project in next stage.

Description:
Combination of weak systems and absence of a regulatory framework governing involuntary resettlement pose a major challenge to safeguards compliance in ADB-financed projects in the country. The TA will focus on improving institutional safeguards management to effectively address internal capacity constraints, and providing legal advice, interpretation and recommendations on applicable national and provincial laws to address resettlement related issues in two key federal agencies, the National Highway Authority (NHA) and the Water and Power Development Authority (WAPDA), responsible for transport, and water and power development, respectively.

" DATATABLE.493,2014-02-10T10:38:28.962,2014-02-10T10:38:28.962,9.537499000000025,33.886917,Tunisia,Tunisia,,Road improvement program (phase 2),,Construction,500000000,Project aims: - This project will improve the utilization and increase the capacity of the network in various intersections which have high traffic density and the completion of quick and direct links between the different regions so as to improve traffic safety on the road network. - Such projects of signposted roads can only improve the connections between inland areas and cities. Project owner: Ministry of Equipment and Environment Project components: the project is made up of the following components: - Roads of the Greater Tunis: 9 projects consisting in the development and enlargement of roads to 4 tracks (2x2) and the construction of new roads and building interchange lanes so as to raise the traffic capacity of these roads and facilitate traffic to ensure a smooth flow of road traffic and reduce pollution. - Reinforcing 368.1 km of signposted roads in 10 governorates. The intervention covers 11 sections of national roads and 13 sections of regional roads and one section of local roads by reinforcing asphalt concrete layer to ensure the sustainability of these roads and improve the level of welfare of road users. ? Structured roads for cities: 9 projects consisting in doubling the streets to four tracks (2x2) and building escape turns in areas with high traffic density in addition to the construction of transit facilities to avoid crossing cities. Project estimated cost: the cost of the works is estimated at about 755 MTND. Studies progress: studies are in progress or in the process of call for tenders. ,Road,Post Identified Project,2013-10-31,2013-10-31,Government,Ministry of Equipment and Environment,Ministry of Equipment and Environment," Ministry of Equipment and Environment - Avenue Habib Chrita - Cité Jardins - 1002 Tunis Belvédère, Tunisia - Phone : (+216) 71 842 244 Fax : (+216) 71 840 495 e-mail : brc@mehat.gov.tn Website : http://www.equipement.tn","For more information about the status of the project, please email us.",Hanen Ltifi,ltifiH@state.gov,http://www.investintunisia.tn/document/701.pdf,http://tunisia.usembassy.gov/business.html,,,1,Pipeline,0,POINT (1061709.5321213587 4013627.8303939076),"
Road improvement program (phase 2)
Country: Tunisia
Sector: Construction
Date Added: 2014-02-10
Primary Funding Source: Government
Project Size (USD): 500000000
Status: Pipeline

Description:
Project aims: - This project will improve the utilization and increase the capacity of the network in various intersections which have high traffic density and the completion of quick and direct links between the different regions so as to improve traffic safety on the road network. - Such projects of signposted roads can only improve the connections between inland areas and cities. Project owner: Ministry of Equipment and Environment Project components: the project is made up of the following components: - Roads of the Greater Tunis: 9 projects consisting in the development and enlargement of roads to 4 tracks (2x2) and the construction of new roads and building interchange lanes so as to raise the traffic capacity of these roads and facilitate traffic to ensure a smooth flow of road traffic and reduce pollution. - Reinforcing 368.1 km of signposted roads in 10 governorates. The intervention covers 11 sections of national roads and 13 sections of regional roads and one section of local roads by reinforcing asphalt concrete layer to ensure the sustainability of these roads and improve the level of welfare of road users. ? Structured roads for cities: 9 projects consisting in doubling the streets to four tracks (2x2) and building escape turns in areas with high traffic density in addition to the construction of transit facilities to avoid crossing cities. Project estimated cost: the cost of the works is estimated at about 755 MTND. Studies progress: studies are in progress or in the process of call for tenders.

Post Comments:
For more information about the status of the project, please email us.

CAIASA,PR-L1071,"Agriculture, Forestry, Fishing and Hunting",92000000,"IDB financing is proposed for the design, development, construction and operations of a new soybean crushing plant, and related facilities (the 'Project'). The new plant, to be located in Villeta, 40 km from Asuncion (Paraguay), will have a crushing capacity of 4,000 tons/day. The Borrower is Complejo Agro-Industrial Angostura S.A ('CAIASA' or the 'Company'), and the Project Sponsors are Bunge Paraguay S.A., LDC Paraguay S.A., and Losur Overseas SL, all of which are major players in South American agribusiness and have existing raw soybean export operations in Paraguay.","Agriculture, Food Processing",Inter-American Development Bank,2012-06-04,2012-11-28,Development Bank,Complejo Agro-Industrial Angostura,Complejo Agro-Industrial Angostura,"Martin Javier Duhart, IDB Team Lead, martindu@iadb.org",,,asikec@state.gov,"http://www.iadb.org/en/projects/project-description-title,1303.html?id=PR-L1071",http://paraguay.usembassy.gov/business.html,,,1,Fulfilled,1,POINT (-6407549.890060826 -2938517.8291831035),"

Primary Funding Source: Development Bank
Project Size (USD): 92000000
Status: Fulfilled

Archived: Yes
Description:
IDB financing is proposed for the design, development, construction and operations of a new soybean crushing plant, and related facilities (the 'Project'). The new plant, to be located in Villeta, 40 km from Asuncion (Paraguay), will have a crushing capacity of 4,000 tons/day. The Borrower is Complejo Agro-Industrial Angostura S.A ('CAIASA' or the 'Company'), and the Project Sponsors are Bunge Paraguay S.A., LDC Paraguay S.A., and Losur Overseas SL, all of which are major players in South American agribusiness and have existing raw soybean export operations in Paraguay.

Date Added: 2013-07-23
Primary Funding Source: Development Bank
Project Size (USD): 8500000
Status: Pipeline

Archived: Yes
Description:
The project seeks to support SMEs in MENA countries by increasing market access, building better access to information, and ultimately expanding SME revenues and creating job growth. It will (i) launch a targeted capacity building program for Export Promotion Agencies (EPAs) to support SMEs; and (ii) support a Regional Implementation Agency (RIA).

Multip irrigation/drinking water Proj for the Mun of Batallas,Pucaracani,El Alto
Country: Bolivia
Sector: Utilities
Date Added: 2015-02-13
Primary Funding Source: Development Banks
Project Size (USD): 62000000
Status: Pipeline

Description:
Given the high vulnerability of the water and sanitation system in La Paz and El Alto due to population growth (including migration from the country to the city), and the observed and anticipated effects of climate change on water resources, there is an urgent need to improve existing systems and develop new ones for the collection and distribution of water. Through its implementation, the ""Multipurpose water resources project for El Alto and La Paz"" will seek to increase the resilience of the water supply system of La Paz and El Alto. Program beneficiaries include rural communities living in the selected river basin areas and the inhabitants of La Paz and El Alto.

Port of Veracruz Expansion
Country: Mexico
Sector: Construction
Date Added: 2014-08-12
Primary Funding Source: Private
Project Size (USD): 180000000
Status: In Procurement

Description:
The Mexican Administration announced the expansion of the Veracruz Port. It is anticipated that by the end of the current administration the port will increase its current cargo capability by 300%. The majority of the works, procurement, and acquisition of equipment will be done diretly by the port adminsitration: API Veracruz and its private operators. Currently, API Verazcruz is in the process of purchasing IT systems for communications and closed circuit TV sytems and has hired IDOM Ingenieria, S.A. to conduct a market study for the Port of Veracruz development project. API Veracruz will announce the first projects for the port: - The public tenders to build a 2.2 km breakwater, basin dredging, and construction of two new wharfs. - A public tedner to grant a concession to build and operate a new container terminal

" DATATABLE.983,2014-10-20T10:50:14.644,2014-10-20T10:50:14.644,24.684866000000056,-22.328474,Botswana,Botswana and Namibia,,Trans-Kalahari Railway,,Construction,11000000000,"The Government of Botswana’s (GOB) private consultants are currently conducting a development plan, which is a pre-feasibility study that will provide a groundwork assessment in advance of the feasibility study for a 1,500 km railway from Namibia’s Walvis Bay to Botswana’s eastern coal reserves at a projected total cost of $11 - $15 billion. After the feasibility study, the project will go forward if Botswana’s mining companies are able to raise sufficient capital. The project’s timetable is currently : 1) March through December 2015: GOB complete feasibility study; 2) December 2015: GOB to issue the Environmental Impact Assessment; 3) Early 2016: GOB to issue the design tender; 4) Summer 2016: GOB to issue the construction tender; 5) 2017: GOB to finalize the project contract; 6) Early 2018: railroad construction begins; and, 9) End of 2019: railroad construction completed. ","coal, railway",Post Identified Project,,,Private,,"Ministry of Minerals, Energy and Water Resources",,,Chansonette Yun,YunCR@state.gov,,,,,1,Pipeline,0,POINT (2747906.713420198 -2551008.4207925885),"
Trans-Kalahari Railway
Country: Botswana
Sector: Construction
Date Added: 2014-10-20
Primary Funding Source: Private
Project Size (USD): 11000000000
Status: Pipeline

Description:
The Government of Botswana’s (GOB) private consultants are currently conducting a development plan, which is a pre-feasibility study that will provide a groundwork assessment in advance of the feasibility study for a 1,500 km railway from Namibia’s Walvis Bay to Botswana’s eastern coal reserves at a projected total cost of $11 - $15 billion. After the feasibility study, the project will go forward if Botswana’s mining companies are able to raise sufficient capital. The project’s timetable is currently : 1) March through December 2015: GOB complete feasibility study; 2) December 2015: GOB to issue the Environmental Impact Assessment; 3) Early 2016: GOB to issue the design tender; 4) Summer 2016: GOB to issue the construction tender; 5) 2017: GOB to finalize the project contract; 6) Early 2018: railroad construction begins; and, 9) End of 2019: railroad construction completed.

Contact

Project to Support the Reform of the Health Sector (Health II)
Country: Tunisia
Sector: Health Care and Social Assistance
Date Added: 2014-02-25
Primary Funding Source: Development Banks
Project Size (USD): 79772160
Status: Pipeline

Description:
The project will focus on the following priority intervention areas: - Upgrading Public Hospitals - Development and Management of Human Resource Institutional Strengthening - Quality management services - Support to reform health insurance Objectives Support the Government's efforts reforming the health sector to better respond to the needs created by the multiple transitions the country faces. This project will not only respond to current challenges induced by the multiple transitions the country faces, but will reduce inequalities between the poorest quintile and the other quintiles of the Tunisian population. This project will contribute sectoral studies to better understand the health sector and implement activities to address inequities between rural and urban areas in terms of access to quality health services. It will also benefit the health workforce through improvement of working conditions and training activities.

Post Comments:
The Commercial Liaison with the African Development Bank (AfDB) within the U.S. Embassy Tunis helps U.S. firms through: •counseling and market research, •introductions/appointments with key AfDB officers, • Individual advocacy to ensure fair and transparent competition. The AfDB Commercial Liaison coordinates with the Office of the U.S. Executive Director at AfDB on its efforts on behalf of U.S. clients and the global network of U.S. Commercial Service offices and partner posts. For more information, please email: AfdbCommercialLiaison@state.gov

This project will seek to specifically: Improve awareness to natural hazards and the associated preparation and response protocols in 6 pilot communities. Demonstrate the Common Alerting Protocol (CAP) as a process to improve community alerting with a view to wider application within the pilot countries and other Caribbean states.

" DATATABLE.236,2013-08-15T10:04:13.639,2013-12-31T19:00:00,69.133333,34.533333,Afghanistan,Afghanistan,NEA,Artisanal Mining Survey,,"Mining, Quarrying, and Oil and Gas Extraction",0,"The Government of Afghanistan has received a grant from the World Bank to support the development of the natural resources sector and intends to apply part of the proceeds for consultancy services. Under this project the Ministry of Mines and Petroleum (MoMP) is developing regulatory capacity to enforce sector laws and improve sector governance. At this time, the MoMP is seeking to identify firms and agencies with appropriate geological survey mapping/mineral exploration background and demonstrated experience in institutional strengthening in the mining sector. Objectives: The consultancy service will address the economically and socially promising subsector of artisanal and small-scale mining (ASM) in general and gemstone mining in particular. ASM mining can have strong regional labor market effects, rise income levels, create demand for different input goods, and can further trigger the development of the value chain if the processing of the products, for instance of gemstones, is conducted locally.",Mining,Post Identified Project,2013-08-12,2013-08-24,Development Bank,World Bank,Afghan Ministry of Mines and Petroleum,,,Stephen Wheeler,wheelerss@state.gov,http://mom.gov.af/en/tender/consultancy-services-in-support-of-strengthening-the-formalization-of-the-artisanal-and-small-scale-mining-asm-and-gemstone-sector-in-afghanistan,http://kabul.usembassy.gov/business.html,,,1,Pipeline,1,POINT (7695887.426401814 4100642.422175022),"
Artisanal Mining Survey
Country: Afghanistan
Sector: Mining, Quarrying, and Oil and Gas Extraction
Date Added: 2013-08-15
Primary Funding Source: Development Bank
Project Size (USD): 0
Status: Pipeline

Archived: Yes
Description:
The Government of Afghanistan has received a grant from the World Bank to support the development of the natural resources sector and intends to apply part of the proceeds for consultancy services. Under this project the Ministry of Mines and Petroleum (MoMP) is developing regulatory capacity to enforce sector laws and improve sector governance. At this time, the MoMP is seeking to identify firms and agencies with appropriate geological survey mapping/mineral exploration background and demonstrated experience in institutional strengthening in the mining sector. Objectives: The consultancy service will address the economically and socially promising subsector of artisanal and small-scale mining (ASM) in general and gemstone mining in particular. ASM mining can have strong regional labor market effects, rise income levels, create demand for different input goods, and can further trigger the development of the value chain if the processing of the products, for instance of gemstones, is conducted locally.

The Botswana Power Corporation requires the services of an engineering contractor to develop, construct, install and commission an authentic/true to actual process power plant simulator for the purposes of training operators, technicians, and engineers on the operation of Morupule B Power Station. Request for Expression of Interest (EoI) for Development, Construction & Commissioning of a Power Plant Simulator for Morupule B 600MW Coal Fired Power Station in Botswana. Morupule B Power Station is located in Palapye, 280km north from Gaborone and is a mine mouth coal fired power station comprising 4 units with a capacity of 150MW (Gross) each. The Botswana Power Corporation requires the services of an engineering contractor to develop, construct, install and commission an authentic/true to actual process power plant simulator for the purposes of training operators, technicians, and engineers on the operation of Morupule B Power Station. Interested service providers must indicate their interst by submitting information indicating their experience and qualification to perform the services by submitting brochures, firm profile, description of similar assignments, relevant experience, at least three (3) references from customers/employers where similar services have been offered in the past 5-8 years. Expressions of Interest (EoI) should be deposited in the TENDER BOX situated in the Botswana Power Corporation, Supply Chain (Procurement) Office, Nkrumah Road, Gaborone, Botswana by 27th August 2014 on or before 10:00am and should be marked as follows: The Chief Executive Officer Botswana Corporation Expression of Interest: Development, Construction & Commissioning of a Power Plant Simulator Morupule B 600MW Coal Fired Power Station - Botswana, Tender Number 9305/14 Short listed service providers would be invited to tender for the required services by responding to a detailed Request for Proposal (RfP).

Bidders can contact the post or the contact person at Botswana Power Corporation, on the provided contact detaios for any further information or clarification of the project. Scope of Work SEC is currently in the process of upgrading her Enterprise Resource Planning (ERP) system (Ellipse by Ventyx) and also implementing her CRM (Customer Relationship Management, by AccTech). The Ellipse Project started in May 2014 under IT staff management, and Phase 1 of the project was completed in July 2014. Phase II of the project is the outstanding work, which covers the implementation of the Human Resource and Maintenace modules of the system. The CRM project started in May 2013 and is planned to be completed by the end of the 2014/2015 financial year. The remaining phases of the CRM project are 3 and 4, which cover integration with the receipting and ERP systems. Provision of IT Project and Change
Country: Swaziland
Sector: Utilities
Date Added: 2014-10-09
Primary Funding Source: Self Financed
Project Size (USD): 1000
Status: In Procurement

Description:
Bids are invited from reputable consulting firms for the provision of IT Project and Change Management Serices to the Swaziland Electricity Company (SEC), a category C public enterprise. The service is required for a minimum period of three (3) months, commencting on November 1, 2014. Scope of Work SEC is currently in the process of upgrading her Enterprise Resource Planning (ERP) system (Ellipse by Ventyx) and also implementing her CRM (Customer Relationship Management, by AccTech). The Ellipse Project started in May 2014 under IT staff management, and Phase 1 of the project was completed in July 2014. Phase II of the project is the outstanding work, which covers the implementation of the Human Resource and Maintenace modules of the system. The CRM project started in May 2013 and is planned to be completed by the end of the 2014/2015 financial year. The remaining phases of the CRM project are 3 and 4, which cover integration with the receipting and ERP systems. All proposals must be signed and submitted in a sealed official envelope, clearly marked ""Tender No. 59 of 2014/15 - Provision of IT Project and Change Management Services"" and shoul dbe deposited in the tender box situated at the SEC Head Office, Eluvatsini Building, Mhlambanyatsi Road, Mbabane, Swazialnd. If posted, it must be ensured that the proposal reaches SEC on or before Wedenesday, October 15, 2014 at 16:00 hours for the attention of the Secretary of the Tender Committee.

Post Comments:
Because of the time frame it woudl be advisable for companies to courier documents. The Embassy can assist with delivery.
