" DATATABLE.925,2014-09-05T06:24:43.351,2014-09-05T06:24:43.351,84.124008,28.394857,Nepal,Nepal,,Chemical Fertilizer Plant ,,Manufacturing,560000000,"The Investment Board of Nepal (IBN) is considering establishing an Ammonia-Urea Chemical Fertilizer Plant (Plant) in Nepal through private sector investments. Nepal's economic is mainly dependent on the agricultural sector, accounting for 36% of the GDP and 66% of the labor population. The demand for chemical fertilizer in fiscal year 2011-2012 was 700,000 metric tons according to the Ministry of Agricultural Development. The IBN is exploring the possibility of establishing a fertilizer plant. The consulting work will be funded by the Government of Nepal. The projected cost is based on similar plants constructed in Ethiopia.","Consulting, chemical fertilizer, urea, ammonia",Post Identified Project,2014-09-03,2014-10-03,Government,none,Ministry of Agricultural Development,www.investmentboard.gov.np/page/publications/downloads fertilizerplant@investmentboard.gov.np +1-977-1-4475277; +1-977-1-4475278; +1-977-1-4475282; fax 977-1-447-5281,This is currently an expression of interest only to hire a consulting firm to study the feasability of building a chemical fertilizer plant..,Todd Jungenberg,jungenbergth@state.gov,,http://nepal.usembassy.gov/business.html,,,1,In Procurement,0,POINT (9364641.734049272 3298848.051850203),"
Chemical Fertilizer Plant
Country: Nepal
Sector: Manufacturing
Date Added: 2014-09-05
Primary Funding Source: Government
Project Size (USD): 560000000
Status: In Procurement

Description:
The Investment Board of Nepal (IBN) is considering establishing an Ammonia-Urea Chemical Fertilizer Plant (Plant) in Nepal through private sector investments. Nepal's economic is mainly dependent on the agricultural sector, accounting for 36% of the GDP and 66% of the labor population. The demand for chemical fertilizer in fiscal year 2011-2012 was 700,000 metric tons according to the Ministry of Agricultural Development. The IBN is exploring the possibility of establishing a fertilizer plant. The consulting work will be funded by the Government of Nepal. The projected cost is based on similar plants constructed in Ethiopia.

Post Comments:
This is currently an expression of interest only to hire a consulting firm to study the feasability of building a chemical fertilizer plant..

Embassy Website   Contact
" DATATABLE.893,2014-08-19T10:19:51.508,2014-08-19T10:19:51.508,34.98957100000007,32.7940463,Israel,Haifa,, CONTINUOUS SHIP UNLOADER ,8/14,Transportation and Warehousing,100001,"1. Pursuant to the Agreement on Government Procurement (GATT) and the Tender Laws of the State of Israel, Israel Ports - Development and Assets Co. LTD (hereafter “IPC”) wishes to receive proposals for the supply of: One (1) CONTINUOUS SHIP UNLOADER (CSU), with a nominal capacity of 1200 ton/hour, for the Dagon Terminal, Haifa Port (hereafter “the Works” or “the Unloader” or ""the CSU""). 2. The Works include, inter alia, the design, manufacturing, erection, testing, supplying, training and Warranting of the Unloader in accordance with the terms and conditions of the Tender documents, the Technical Specifications, attached as Attachment B to the Tender documents, and the Contract Attachment C to the Tender documents. 3. The tendering process shall be governed solely by the provisions contained in the Tender Documents. Without derogation from the aforesaid, the tendering process shall be conducted in two phases, as follows: 3.1 The first stage will consist of an examination of the bidders' compliance with the pre-qualification requirements and an examination of the qualified bidders' Technical Proposal only, without any reference to prices. 3.2 The second stage will consist of submission, by the qualified participants only, of the Price Proposal and examination thereof. At the second stage the Bidders will also be required to submit an autonomic and unconditional bank guarantee in the value of 100,000 Euros or $130,000. 4. The Bidder may submit different proposals for different technologies of the CSU. An Independent, fully inclusive and comprehensive proposal must be submitted for each technology of CSU as defined in paragraph 5. 5. Pre Requisites The Bidder must meet all the following pre- requisites requirements to be entitled to participate in the tender process: Definitions CSU in this paragraph means, a self-propelled or stationary Continuous Ship Unloader, used for unloading bulk cargo from ships and other vessels, positioned on the quay during the unloading operation and has a structural configuration with gantry, superstructure and a double jib, which allows kick in/ kick out - KIKO. Technology in this paragraph means, the conveying mechanism in the vertical jib, e.g. Screw, Double Belt, Chain, Bucket, etc. 5.1 Past Experience (supply): 5.1.1 Supply of at least 5 (five) CSUs of the proposed technology of any capacity, since January 2003. 5.1.2 Supply of at least Two (2) CSUs (may be part of the CSUs mentioned in section 5.1.1), since January 2008. 5.2 Past Experience (technical): Incorporating the following technical features (not necessarily all the features on the same CSU): 5.2.1 Capacity - Supply of at least 1 (one) CSU of the proposed technology with minimum 1000 ton/hour, used for unloading of Grains, since January 2003. 5.2.2 Configuration - Supply of at least 1 (one) CSU rails mounted self-propelled, since January 2003. 5.2.3 Configuration - Supply of at least 1 (one) CSU with KIKO jib configuration, since January 2003. 5.3 Engineering and Technical Competence The following functions are an integral part of the Bidder's company structure and activities (all and each one): Design; Quality Assurance & Control; After Sale Service. 5.4 Submission of Declaration of Compliance with Mandatory Technical Requirements, as set forth in the Tender Documents (TMR), as specified in Annex 4 of the Tender documents. 5.5 A local Bidder must submit all the valid certificates and affidavits required under the Entities Transactions Law, 5736-1976. 6. IPC reserves the right to negotiate with one or more Bidders. The procedures for conducting such negotiations will be determined by the IPC. 7. Furthermore, the IPC reserves the right to request Bidders or any of them to clarify, correct, modify, supplement, add or amend any item contained in its Bid and/or to submit, within a given time, any document proving a pre-requisite that was not submitted with the proposal and technical documents or clarifications on technical issues (but not any guarantee, if required), all as detailed in the tender documents. 8. The contract will be awarded to the Bidder whose proposal scored the highest Final Grading, without derogating from the IPC right not to select any bidder at all. 9. The last date to submit proposals is not later than Thursday, October 23rd 2014, at 12.00 hours (Israeli time), at IPC's offices as specified in paragraph 11. 10. Tender documents 10.1 Bidders may review the Tender documents without charge, or purchase them for the amount equal to 500NIS (including V.A.T.), not refundable, at IPC's offices as specified in paragraph 11, during working hours, Sunday – Thursday 08.30-15.30, as of July 22nd 2014. 10.2 For participating in the Tender and prior to submitting the proposal, Bidders are required to pay an additional sum equal to 3,500NIS (including V.A.T.), not refundable. Payment may be made at IPC's offices as specified in paragraph 11, or by direct transfer to IPC's account Bank Hapoalim, Ayalon business branch 063 account No. 7517. Tender No., Tender title and Bidder's name should be specified on the transfer note. 11. The address for reviewing or purchasing the tender documents and submitting proposals is: Israel Ports, Development & Assets Co. LTD, 74 Menachem Begin Rd., 12th floor, Room 1207, Tel-Aviv 67215 12. All documents should be submitted in Hebrew or in English. 13. Only the full English version of the tender documents is binding. Only information provided by the IPC in writing shall be deemed to be part of this Tender. 14. Clarifications Participants may raise questions and request clarifications or interpretations of the Tender Documents, in writing, from the IPC by no later than Thursday, September 4th, 2014, Such questions shall be addressed to Mr. Pinhas Epshtain - Director, Purchasing and Contracting, Fax: 972-3-5616027, E-Mail: pinhase@israports.co.il. 15. A Bidder which is a ""foreign supplier"" (sapak hutz), as such term is defined under the Mandatory Tender Regulations (Mandatory Industrial Cooperation), 5767-2008 must submit a signed Industrial Cooperation Undertaking towards the State of Israel and a program for the fulfillment of such undertaking, as specified in Annex 5 of the tender documents and in accordance with the above Regulations. Should its bid be selected as the winning bid under the tender process, the winning bidder shall perform Industrial Cooperation Undertaking with the State of Israel and fulfillment program submitted as part of its bid. 16. Term - Budgetary Approval It is hereby brought to the attention of the bidders, that the performing of the Work according to this Tender and any decision regarding a winner in the Tender and/or contracting with one according to the Tender, is and will be conditioned by receiving an appropriate budgetary approval, and will not be valid unless this term has been met, all as detailed in the tender documents. 17. All expenses of any kind, relating to the preparation of the proposal for the tender and participation in it, will be the sole responsibility of the bidder and will not be refunded for any reason. 18. The statements in this advertisement does not exhaust the terms of this tender that appear in their completeness in the tender documents. In the event of any contradiction between the statements in this advertisement and the tender documents, it will be determined by the tender documents. ","Isare, Haifa, CSU, Port",Post Identified Project,2014-07-21,2014-10-23,Government,Israel Ports,Dagon Terminal Haifa Port,Unknown,Please contact Charles Brown at US Embassy Tel Aviv for more details.,Charles Brown,browncl3@state.gov,http://eng.israports.co.il/PortsDevelop/internationaltender/Pages/InvitationforBidSubmissionforCONTINUOUSSHIPUNLOADER(CSU).aspx,http://israel.usembassy.gov/business.html,,,1,In Procurement,0,POINT (3895021.2267950997 3867998.852946981),"
CONTINUOUS SHIP UNLOADER
Country: Israel
Sector: Transportation and Warehousing
Date Added: 2014-08-19
Primary Funding Source: Government
Project Size (USD): 100001
Status: In Procurement

Description:
1. Pursuant to the Agreement on Government Procurement (GATT) and the Tender Laws of the State of Israel, Israel Ports - Development and Assets Co. LTD (hereafter “IPC”) wishes to receive proposals for the supply of: One (1) CONTINUOUS SHIP UNLOADER (CSU), with a nominal capacity of 1200 ton/hour, for the Dagon Terminal, Haifa Port (hereafter “the Works” or “the Unloader” or ""the CSU""). 2. The Works include, inter alia, the design, manufacturing, erection, testing, supplying, training and Warranting of the Unloader in accordance with the terms and conditions of the Tender documents, the Technical Specifications, attached as Attachment B to the Tender documents, and the Contract Attachment C to the Tender documents. 3. The tendering process shall be governed solely by the provisions contained in the Tender Documents. Without derogation from the aforesaid, the tendering process shall be conducted in two phases, as follows: 3.1 The first stage will consist of an examination of the bidders' compliance with the pre-qualification requirements and an examination of the qualified bidders' Technical Proposal only, without any reference to prices. 3.2 The second stage will consist of submission, by the qualified participants only, of the Price Proposal and examination thereof. At the second stage the Bidders will also be required to submit an autonomic and unconditional bank guarantee in the value of 100,000 Euros or $130,000. 4. The Bidder may submit different proposals for different technologies of the CSU. An Independent, fully inclusive and comprehensive proposal must be submitted for each technology of CSU as defined in paragraph 5. 5. Pre Requisites The Bidder must meet all the following pre- requisites requirements to be entitled to participate in the tender process: Definitions CSU in this paragraph means, a self-propelled or stationary Continuous Ship Unloader, used for unloading bulk cargo from ships and other vessels, positioned on the quay during the unloading operation and has a structural configuration with gantry, superstructure and a double jib, which allows kick in/ kick out - KIKO. Technology in this paragraph means, the conveying mechanism in the vertical jib, e.g. Screw, Double Belt, Chain, Bucket, etc. 5.1 Past Experience (supply): 5.1.1 Supply of at least 5 (five) CSUs of the proposed technology of any capacity, since January 2003. 5.1.2 Supply of at least Two (2) CSUs (may be part of the CSUs mentioned in section 5.1.1), since January 2008. 5.2 Past Experience (technical): Incorporating the following technical features (not necessarily all the features on the same CSU): 5.2.1 Capacity - Supply of at least 1 (one) CSU of the proposed technology with minimum 1000 ton/hour, used for unloading of Grains, since January 2003. 5.2.2 Configuration - Supply of at least 1 (one) CSU rails mounted self-propelled, since January 2003. 5.2.3 Configuration - Supply of at least 1 (one) CSU with KIKO jib configuration, since January 2003. 5.3 Engineering and Technical Competence The following functions are an integral part of the Bidder's company structure and activities (all and each one): Design; Quality Assurance & Control; After Sale Service. 5.4 Submission of Declaration of Compliance with Mandatory Technical Requirements, as set forth in the Tender Documents (TMR), as specified in Annex 4 of the Tender documents. 5.5 A local Bidder must submit all the valid certificates and affidavits required under the Entities Transactions Law, 5736-1976. 6. IPC reserves the right to negotiate with one or more Bidders. The procedures for conducting such negotiations will be determined by the IPC. 7. Furthermore, the IPC reserves the right to request Bidders or any of them to clarify, correct, modify, supplement, add or amend any item contained in its Bid and/or to submit, within a given time, any document proving a pre-requisite that was not submitted with the proposal and technical documents or clarifications on technical issues (but not any guarantee, if required), all as detailed in the tender documents. 8. The contract will be awarded to the Bidder whose proposal scored the highest Final Grading, without derogating from the IPC right not to select any bidder at all. 9. The last date to submit proposals is not later than Thursday, October 23rd 2014, at 12.00 hours (Israeli time), at IPC's offices as specified in paragraph 11. 10. Tender documents 10.1 Bidders may review the Tender documents without charge, or purchase them for the amount equal to 500NIS (including V.A.T.), not refundable, at IPC's offices as specified in paragraph 11, during working hours, Sunday – Thursday 08.30-15.30, as of July 22nd 2014. 10.2 For participating in the Tender and prior to submitting the proposal, Bidders are required to pay an additional sum equal to 3,500NIS (including V.A.T.), not refundable. Payment may be made at IPC's offices as specified in paragraph 11, or by direct transfer to IPC's account Bank Hapoalim, Ayalon business branch 063 account No. 7517. Tender No., Tender title and Bidder's name should be specified on the transfer note. 11. The address for reviewing or purchasing the tender documents and submitting proposals is: Israel Ports, Development & Assets Co. LTD, 74 Menachem Begin Rd., 12th floor, Room 1207, Tel-Aviv 67215 12. All documents should be submitted in Hebrew or in English. 13. Only the full English version of the tender documents is binding. Only information provided by the IPC in writing shall be deemed to be part of this Tender. 14. Clarifications Participants may raise questions and request clarifications or interpretations of the Tender Documents, in writing, from the IPC by no later than Thursday, September 4th, 2014, Such questions shall be addressed to Mr. Pinhas Epshtain - Director, Purchasing and Contracting, Fax: 972-3-5616027, E-Mail: pinhase@israports.co.il. 15. A Bidder which is a ""foreign supplier"" (sapak hutz), as such term is defined under the Mandatory Tender Regulations (Mandatory Industrial Cooperation), 5767-2008 must submit a signed Industrial Cooperation Undertaking towards the State of Israel and a program for the fulfillment of such undertaking, as specified in Annex 5 of the tender documents and in accordance with the above Regulations. Should its bid be selected as the winning bid under the tender process, the winning bidder shall perform Industrial Cooperation Undertaking with the State of Israel and fulfillment program submitted as part of its bid. 16. Term - Budgetary Approval It is hereby brought to the attention of the bidders, that the performing of the Work according to this Tender and any decision regarding a winner in the Tender and/or contracting with one according to the Tender, is and will be conditioned by receiving an appropriate budgetary approval, and will not be valid unless this term has been met, all as detailed in the tender documents. 17. All expenses of any kind, relating to the preparation of the proposal for the tender and participation in it, will be the sole responsibility of the bidder and will not be refunded for any reason. 18. The statements in this advertisement does not exhaust the terms of this tender that appear in their completeness in the tender documents. In the event of any contradiction between the statements in this advertisement and the tender documents, it will be determined by the tender documents.

" DATATABLE.545,2014-02-12T10:57:42.354,2014-02-12T10:57:42.354,9.537499000000025,33.886917,Tunisia,"Skhira, Sfax",,Skhira Refinery,,"Mining, Quarrying, and Oil and Gas Extraction",2500000000,"Project aims: - Reducing the cost of shipping and meeting the needs of the Tunisian market in oil products at lower costs. - Increasing the activity of the Aturabsa Company and especially for the petroleum port activity where it is expected that its development rate will reach 150% when the refinery starts production. - Expected employment of 500 people Project presentation: the project consists in the construction of : - Refinery station with production capacity over 4.5 million tons of petroleum products in the area of Skhira south of Tunisia. - Storage units and facilities such as offices and others. The project will be built on a piece of land covering 100 hectares in the area of Skhira and will be awarded within a concession. Project cost: between 2,500 and 3,000 million U.S. dollars, basis on final option of the refinery Project progress: - Signature of a memorandum of understanding between the Tunisian government and the State of Qatar on the 16th of July 2012 under which Qatar Petroleum will carry out the economic and feasibility study for the project; - The memorandum of understanding stipulates that the Tunisian and Qataris discuss and prepare the final agreement after the achievement of economic and feasibility study; - A Commission was created in the Ministry of Industry to oversee the study of proposals for the project under the framework of implementing the memorandum of understanding between the Tunisian government and the State of Qatar. The representatives of the commission are from the Prime Ministry, Ministries of Industry, Finance, Development and International Cooperation, Central Bank of Tunisia and the Tunisian Company of Refining Industries. - The economic feasibility study of the project has not yet started; - The Tunisian position can only be taken just after the completion by the Qatari side of the economic and feasibility study of the project, which will be the starting point for the preparation of the document of the investment agreement. - Two options should be studied whether the implementation of a new factory in Skhira in partnership with foreign investors or the transfer of the Tunisian Company for refining industries (Bizerte refinery) to Skhira. ",Refinery,Post Identified Project,2013-10-31,2013-10-31,Government,Ministry of industry,Ministry of industry,"Address : 40 Rue Sidi ElHani Montplaisir 1073, Tunis, Tunisia Phone : (+216) 71 905 132, (+216) 71 904 216 Fax : (+216) 71 902 742 E-mail : mind@ministeres.tn Website: http://www.industrie.gov.tn","For more information about the status of this project, please email us!",Hanen Ltifi,ltifiH@state.gov,http://www.investintunisia.tn/document/701.pdf,http://tunisia.usembassy.gov/business.html,,,1,Pipeline,0,POINT (1061709.5321213587 4013627.8303939076),"
Skhira Refinery
Country: Tunisia
Sector: Mining, Quarrying, and Oil and Gas Extraction
Date Added: 2014-02-12
Primary Funding Source: Government
Project Size (USD): 2500000000
Status: Pipeline

Description:
Project aims: - Reducing the cost of shipping and meeting the needs of the Tunisian market in oil products at lower costs. - Increasing the activity of the Aturabsa Company and especially for the petroleum port activity where it is expected that its development rate will reach 150% when the refinery starts production. - Expected employment of 500 people Project presentation: the project consists in the construction of : - Refinery station with production capacity over 4.5 million tons of petroleum products in the area of Skhira south of Tunisia. - Storage units and facilities such as offices and others. The project will be built on a piece of land covering 100 hectares in the area of Skhira and will be awarded within a concession. Project cost: between 2,500 and 3,000 million U.S. dollars, basis on final option of the refinery Project progress: - Signature of a memorandum of understanding between the Tunisian government and the State of Qatar on the 16th of July 2012 under which Qatar Petroleum will carry out the economic and feasibility study for the project; - The memorandum of understanding stipulates that the Tunisian and Qataris discuss and prepare the final agreement after the achievement of economic and feasibility study; - A Commission was created in the Ministry of Industry to oversee the study of proposals for the project under the framework of implementing the memorandum of understanding between the Tunisian government and the State of Qatar. The representatives of the commission are from the Prime Ministry, Ministries of Industry, Finance, Development and International Cooperation, Central Bank of Tunisia and the Tunisian Company of Refining Industries. - The economic feasibility study of the project has not yet started; - The Tunisian position can only be taken just after the completion by the Qatari side of the economic and feasibility study of the project, which will be the starting point for the preparation of the document of the investment agreement. - Two options should be studied whether the implementation of a new factory in Skhira in partnership with foreign investors or the transfer of the Tunisian Company for refining industries (Bizerte refinery) to Skhira.

Post Comments:
For more information about the status of this project, please email us!

Project Website   Embassy Website   Contact

" DATATABLE.219,2013-07-23T00:00:00,2013-12-05T00:00:00,35.4954794,33.8886289,Lebanon,"Beirut, Lebanon",NEA,Environmental Pollution Abatement Project,P143594,Public Administration,15000000,"This project reduces industrial pollution in targeted industrial enterprises, strengthens the monitoring and enforcement capabilities of the Ministry of Environment, and establishes a financial mechanism for environmental investments.","MENA, Lebanese Republic, General industry and trade sector, Pollution management",World Bank,2013-01-14,2013-10-21,Development Bank,Ministry of Finance,Ministry of Environment,"Alaa Ahmed Sarhan, Senior Environmental Economist, World Bank, asarhan@worldbank.org",,,,http://www.worldbank.org/projects/P143594/lb-environmental-pollution-abatement-project?lang=en,http://lebanon.usembassy.gov/business.html,,,1,Pipeline,1,POINT (3951338.692271131 4013857.393884088),"

Country: Lebanon

Primary Funding Source: Development Bank
Project Size (USD): 15000000

Description:

Project Website   Embassy Website   " DATATABLE.820,2014-07-25T08:16:49.993,2014-07-25T12:00:55.971,33.022617399999945,34.7071301,Cyprus,Limassol,,"Management, operation, exploitation, and maintenance of the area and buildings of the Old Limassol Port",,Transportation and Warehousing,31000000,"The Cyprus Ports Authority, a state-owned enterprise heading for partial privatization, is seeking tenders for the management, operation, exploitation, and maintenance of the ground facilities of the Old Limassol Port. This was recently renovated at a cost of €17.8 million. It includes 18 new buildings and two that were recently renovated, covering a commercial space of 5,800 square meters. The area is offered in an open tender for a ten-year lease against an annual fee of no less than $3.1 million (€2.3 million) per year, with an option to renew for a further ten years. The bid is open to local as well as foreign investors from countries that have signed the Government Procurement Agreement (GPA), which includes the United States. The new investor will undertake to rent out the facilities to third parties but also to maintain and repair the buildings. One of the two renovated buildings will house a winery and the other will be used for exhibition purposes. The 18 new buildings will house four restaurants, bars and cafes, three tavernas, three snack bars, 17 shops and seven floors of office space. The project area also includes a public square, parking spaces, and a deck and a public bridge from where pedestrians can look onto the harbor area, as well as the adjacent newly-built Limassol Marina. Meanwhile, the Old Port will continue to operate as a fishing harbor and fish market, and will also house the Department of Fisheries, which is responsible for the anchorage of fishing boats. ","Cyprus, Limassol, maintenance, port, management, operation ",Post Identified Project,,,Government,,Cyprus Port Authority,,,George F. Demetriou,DemetriouGF@state.gov,,http://cyprus.usembassy.gov/business.html,,,1,In Procurement,0,POINT (3676060.9536290895 4124152.177108458),"
Management, operation, exploitation, and maintenance of the area and buildings of the Old Limassol Port
Country: Cyprus
Sector: Transportation and Warehousing
Date Added: 2014-07-25
Primary Funding Source: Government
Project Size (USD): 31000000
Status: In Procurement

Description:
The Cyprus Ports Authority, a state-owned enterprise heading for partial privatization, is seeking tenders for the management, operation, exploitation, and maintenance of the ground facilities of the Old Limassol Port. This was recently renovated at a cost of €17.8 million. It includes 18 new buildings and two that were recently renovated, covering a commercial space of 5,800 square meters. The area is offered in an open tender for a ten-year lease against an annual fee of no less than $3.1 million (€2.3 million) per year, with an option to renew for a further ten years. The bid is open to local as well as foreign investors from countries that have signed the Government Procurement Agreement (GPA), which includes the United States. The new investor will undertake to rent out the facilities to third parties but also to maintain and repair the buildings. One of the two renovated buildings will house a winery and the other will be used for exhibition purposes. The 18 new buildings will house four restaurants, bars and cafes, three tavernas, three snack bars, 17 shops and seven floors of office space. The project area also includes a public square, parking spaces, and a deck and a public bridge from where pedestrians can look onto the harbor area, as well as the adjacent newly-built Limassol Marina. Meanwhile, the Old Port will continue to operate as a fishing harbor and fish market, and will also house the Department of Fisheries, which is responsible for the anchorage of fishing boats.

Post Comments:


Project Website   Embassy Website   Contact

Description:

The project also aims to support climate-smart agricultural practices and to implement soil conservation and land management practices.

" DATATABLE.320,2014-01-02T04:21:58.806,2014-07-15T11:18:04.771,142.3613378,-7.584644,Indonesia,Western Indonesia,,Western Indonesia National Roads Improvement Project,P090990,Construction,250000000,"The objective of the Western Indonesia National Roads Improvement Project is to increase the effective use of selected sections of national roads along the Western Sumatera corridor by reducing road user costs. There are four components to the project, the first component being betterment and capacity expansion of national roads. Betterment (including base course strengthening, minor widening, providing a new asphalt wearing course and improving drainage); and capacity expansion of approximately 715.6 kilometers of national roads, including replacement of approximately 194 meters of bridges. The second component is the implementation support. The third component is the road sector institutional development. This component will provide technical assistance and capacity building support to strengthen disaster risk mitigation in the road sector, including capacity building support for the new environment and risk mitigation and road safety unit of Directorate General of Highways, Ministry of Public Works (DGH) capacity to conduct disaster risk assessments and planning, risk mapping of land-slides, coastal erosion, earthquake and floods, and analysis of alternative designs for road segments that pass through critical environmental assets and vulnerable areas. Finally, the fourth component is the contingency for disaster risk response.","Indonesia, Roads, Infrastructure",World Bank,2011-05-26,,Development Banks,Government of indonesia,Ministry of Public Works,,,Tristan Allen,AllenTJ@state.gov,http://www.worldbank.org/projects/P090990/western-indonesia-national-roads-improvement-project?lang=en,,,,1,In Procurement,1,POINT (15847591.632545209 -846795.4937242458),"
Western Indonesia National Roads Improvement Project
Country: Indonesia
Sector: Construction
Date Added: 2014-01-02
Primary Funding Source: Development Banks
Project Size (USD): 250000000
Status: In Procurement

Archived: Yes
Description:
The objective of the Western Indonesia National Roads Improvement Project is to increase the effective use of selected sections of national roads along the Western Sumatera corridor by reducing road user costs. There are four components to the project, the first component being betterment and capacity expansion of national roads. Betterment (including base course strengthening, minor widening, providing a new asphalt wearing course and improving drainage); and capacity expansion of approximately 715.6 kilometers of national roads, including replacement of approximately 194 meters of bridges. The second component is the implementation support. The third component is the road sector institutional development. This component will provide technical assistance and capacity building support to strengthen disaster risk mitigation in the road sector, including capacity building support for the new environment and risk mitigation and road safety unit of Directorate General of Highways, Ministry of Public Works (DGH) capacity to conduct disaster risk assessments and planning, risk mapping of land-slides, coastal erosion, earthquake and floods, and analysis of alternative designs for road segments that pass through critical environmental assets and vulnerable areas. Finally, the fourth component is the contingency for disaster risk response.

Post Comments:


Project Website   Embassy Website   Contact

CADANGAN PROJEK JAMBATAN TEMBURONG (PROPOSED TEMBURONG BRIDGE PROJECT) PACKAGE CC1 - MENTIRI TUNNELS
Country: Brunei
Sector: Transportation and Warehousing
Date Added: 2014-09-22
Primary Funding Source: Government
Project Size (USD): 10000000
Status: In Procurement

Description:
Package CC1 of this Project is the link connecting the Brunei Channel Bridge (CC3) with the existing Jalan Utama Mentiri. The anticipates scope of Works comprises the following: a. three tunnels of approximate length 750m, 490m, and 220m; b. two stretches of road between the three tunnels consisting of viaducts and at grade roads; c. four ramps which connect the western tunnel portal with the existing Jalan Utama Mentiri; and d) associated civil, structural, geotechnical, environmental protection, landscaping, drainage, highways mechanical and electrical works, road lighting provisions, traffic aids and sign gantries, lightning protection system, civil and structural provision for installation of traffic control and surveillance system (TCSS). Interested firms muct be local contractors with valid Class VI (Category KA01) registration with Ministry of Development, Brunei Darusslam or international contractors in joint-venture with a local contractor with valid Class VI (Category KA01) registration with Ministry of Development, Brunei Darussalam.

" DATATABLE.540,2014-02-12T06:13:15.195,2014-02-12T06:13:15.195,9.537499000000025,33.886917,Tunisia,"Cap Bon, Sahel and Sfax",,Project financing: the study is funded by a grant provided from the FEMIP,,Administrative and Support and Waste Management and Remediation Services,110000000,"Developing the infrastructure to transfer northern waters to the Cap Bon, Sahel and Sfax Project aims: the project aims to cover the needs of the Cap Bon regions, the Sahel and Sfax of water supply in the case of exceptional circumstances such as breakdown in the treatment plant of Billi or in the supply channel. In addition to ensure the supply these areas of drinking water in by 2030. Project owner: National Operating And Distribution Of Water Company “SONEDE” Project components: - Construction of a treatment plant with a flow of 4 m3/second. - Construction of water pumping stations: - A pumping station with a capacity of 2m3/second and a pumping station with a capacity of 4 m3/second around the El Kalaa Reservoir, - A pumping station with a capacity of 2 m3/second in El Khouin - Purchase and installation of about 35 km of pipelines with a diameter of 1,600 mm. - Building 2 tanks with a capacity of 5,000 m3. - Works to separate the two water supply pipes (building two pressure breakers and installation of pipes). Project cost: the cost of the project is estimated to 110 Million U.S. Dollars. Project progress: - The preliminary studies are in progress for the remaining components of the project. - The detailed study for the construction of the reservoir in El Kalaa El Kobra is completed and will be funded by the Arab Fund for Economic and Social Development. ","Water treatment, pumping, ",Post Identified Project,2013-10-31,2013-10-31,Government,National Operating And Distribution Of Water Company “SONEDE” ,National Operating And Distribution Of Water Company “SONEDE” ,"Address: Avenue Sliman Ben Sliman - Manar 2, 2092 MANAR II Tunis Phone: 71887000 / 71493700 Fax: 71871000 / 71497621 E-mail: sonede@sonede.com.tn Website: www.sonede.com.tn","For more information about this project, please email us.",Hanen Ltifi,ltifiH@state.gov,http://www.investintunisia.tn/document/701.pdf,http://tunisia.usembassy.gov/business.html,,,1,Pipeline,0,POINT (1061709.5321213587 4013627.8303939076),"
Project financing: the study is funded by a grant provided from the FEMIP
Country: Tunisia
Sector: Administrative and Support and Waste Management and Remediation Services
Date Added: 2014-02-12
Primary Funding Source: Government
Project Size (USD): 110000000
Status: Pipeline

Description:
Developing the infrastructure to transfer northern waters to the Cap Bon, Sahel and Sfax Project aims: the project aims to cover the needs of the Cap Bon regions, the Sahel and Sfax of water supply in the case of exceptional circumstances such as breakdown in the treatment plant of Billi or in the supply channel. In addition to ensure the supply these areas of drinking water in by 2030. Project owner: National Operating And Distribution Of Water Company “SONEDE” Project components: - Construction of a treatment plant with a flow of 4 m3/second. - Construction of water pumping stations: - A pumping station with a capacity of 2m3/second and a pumping station with a capacity of 4 m3/second around the El Kalaa Reservoir, - A pumping station with a capacity of 2 m3/second in El Khouin - Purchase and installation of about 35 km of pipelines with a diameter of 1,600 mm. - Building 2 tanks with a capacity of 5,000 m3. - Works to separate the two water supply pipes (building two pressure breakers and installation of pipes). Project cost: the cost of the project is estimated to 110 Million U.S. Dollars. Project progress: - The preliminary studies are in progress for the remaining components of the project. - The detailed study for the construction of the reservoir in El Kalaa El Kobra is completed and will be funded by the Arab Fund for Economic and Social Development.

Post Comments:
For more information about this project, please email us.

Project Website   Embassy Website   Contact

Description:
Project Location and Area: Located on the east side of Kaohsiung Railway Station in Sanmin District, Kaohsiung, total area approx. 2.77 ha. Land Use:Type 2 specific commercial district (Building coverage ratio: 50%; Floor area ratio: 300%) with an area of approx.22,916 m2, comprising 78.63% of total area. Land for roads has an area of approx.4,829 m2, comprising 21.37% of total area. Primary Sources of Revenue: Real estate revenue after conversion of rights and income from the department store and hotel via the creation of superficies. Estimated Rate of Return: Shopping Malls: Approx. 11%; Mixed-Use residential and commercial Building: Approx. 20% Concession Period: 20-50 years. Schedule: 1. Preparation of invitation to tender (January 1, 2014 – November 30, 2014) 2. Invitation to tender (December 1, 2014 – April 30, 2015) 3. Screening and evaluation (May 1, 2015 – August 31, 2015) 4. Negotiation and signing of contract (September 1, 2015 – December 1, 2015)

Post Comments:
The english version of this website is outdated. Post recommends that you contact the responsible agency for information.

Criterion for the contract award is the economically most favourable bid. By applying the criterion of the economically most favourable bid, the Client will make a selection from the submitted bids by ranking them according to number of points awarded to the criteria elements defined in section V of the Tender Documentation. The tender documentation may be examined and taken over via Public Procurement Portal portal.ujn.gov.rs and at the client’s internet portal www.telekom.rs The bids shall be submitted in the Serbian or English language in a closed envelope by registered mail or handed in person at the address of the Client’s file room: TELEKOM SRBIJA a.d. 11000 Belgrade, Takovska 2, office 530 – file room Logistics and General Affairs Function (Procurement Department) marked as: “Bid for Procurement of the Management Consulting Service Provided by an Advisor in the Form of Professional Assistance in Establishing a Proposal for the Privatization Model for Telekom Srbija a.d. The public bid opening will be conducted on 06/03/2015 upon the expiration of the bid submission deadline, starting at 11:00 a.m., on the premises of the Client, Telekom Srbija a.d, in Belgrade, Takovska 2, IV floor, office 419. Participant in the public bid opening procedure – the bidder is obliged to submit, no later than the time of public bid opening, the proxy statement for participation in the bid opening procedure including the data on the person authorized to participate in the opening procedure, namely: name and family name, ID number and police directorate which issued the ID and Personal Identification Number. For foreign citizens, it is obligatory to submit name and family name, passport number and the country from which they arrive. The Client shall make decision on contract award within 25 days as from the public bid opening date and shall submit the same to all the bidders within three days as from the decision date. Contact: e-mail: nabavka.konsalting@telekom.rs In order for the potential bidder to have direct communication with the Client related to obtaining answers to the questions made by all potential bidders, as well as to possible modifications and supplements of the Tender Documentation, it is necessary to submit the e-mail address to the above stated contact along with the information that it has taken over the Tender Documentation and that it wants all the information related to the subject procurement to be submitted to the stated e-mail. Otherwise, the information will be available on Public Procurement Portal. Sector: Information

Primary Funding Source: Government
Project Size (USD): 1000000
Status: In Procurement

Description:
The scope of public procurement includes the management consulting services provided by an advisor in the form of professional assistance in establishing a proposal for the privatization model for Joint Stock Telecommunications Company Telekom Srbija Beograd for the purpose of development in the field of telecommunications in the Republic of Serbia. Criterion for the contract award is the economically most favourable bid. By applying the criterion of the economically most favourable bid, the Client will make a selection from the submitted bids by ranking them according to number of points awarded to the criteria elements defined in section V of the Tender Documentation. The tender documentation may be examined and taken over via Public Procurement Portal portal.ujn.gov.rs and at the client’s internet portal www.telekom.rs The bids shall be submitted in the Serbian or English language in a closed envelope by registered mail or handed in person at the address of the Client’s file room: TELEKOM SRBIJA a.d. 11000 Belgrade, Takovska 2, office 530 – file room Logistics and General Affairs Function (Procurement Department) marked as: “Bid for Procurement of the Management Consulting Service Provided by an Advisor in the Form of Professional Assistance in Establishing a Proposal for the Privatization Model for Telekom Srbija a.d. Beograd” (PP no. 02/15) – TO BE OPENED BY THE COMMISSION – Deadline for bid submission at the Client’s file room is 06/03/2015 until 10:00 a.m. The bid which arrives to the Client’s file room after the stated deadline (date and hour), shall be deemed untimely and shall not be considered in this procedure. The public bid opening will be conducted on 06/03/2015 upon the expiration of the bid submission deadline, starting at 11:00 a.m., on the premises of the Client, Telekom Srbija a.d, in Belgrade, Takovska 2, IV floor, office 419. Participant in the public bid opening procedure – the bidder is obliged to submit, no later than the time of public bid opening, the proxy statement for participation in the bid opening procedure including the data on the person authorized to participate in the opening procedure, namely: name and family name, ID number and police directorate which issued the ID and Personal Identification Number. For foreign citizens, it is obligatory to submit name and family name, passport number and the country from which they arrive. The Client shall make decision on contract award within 25 days as from the public bid opening date and shall submit the same to all the bidders within three days as from the decision date. Contact: e-mail: nabavka.konsalting@telekom.rs In order for the potential bidder to have direct communication with the Client related to obtaining answers to the questions made by all potential bidders, as well as to possible modifications and supplements of the Tender Documentation, it is necessary to submit the e-mail address to the above stated contact along with the information that it has taken over the Tender Documentation and that it wants all the information related to the subject procurement to be submitted to the stated e-mail. Otherwise, the information will be available on Public Procurement Portal.

External financing needs: U.S. $ 69.0 million (104.0 million Tunisian dinars) Implementation period: 2012 -2016. Project status: At the financial level -A commitment of 46.7 MTND from state budget (42 MTND – under budget year 2011 and 4.7 MTND under budget year 2012) covering the components of protecting houses against floods for an amount of 13 MTND and 34.7 MTND for the acquisition of railway equipment. -Payments of 17.832 MTND (4.7 MTND for the year 2011 and 12.136 MTND for the year 2012 and 1 MTND for the year 2013). At the material level: -Start of flood protection works at a cost about 13 MTND as follows: -Phase 1: (Bir el Kassaa - El Fahs): preparation of the call for tenders in progress. -Phase 2: (El Fahs - Sidi Bourouis), El Fahs – El Krib Section: the process of sorting offers, and El Krib - Sidi Bourouis preparation of the call for tenders in progress. -Phase 3: (Sidi Bourouis - Dahmani): implementation has started and the completion of works is expected during 2013. -Conclusion of contracts for the acquisition of equipment ( iron bars, rail adapters, wooden beams, sheets of concrete beams and welding sets ...) during the year 2012 which is at the stage of manufacturing and delivery will be made in portions -Correction of the railroad track: The study was launched on 7 March 2013 and will be finished in 10 months.",Please contact us for updates on the status of the project.,Hanen Ltifi,ltifih@state.gov,http://www.investintunisia.tn/document/701.pdf,http://tunisia.usembassy.gov/business.html,,,1,Pipeline,0,POINT (982811.3977436629 4187217.1127647194),"

" DATATABLE.543,2014-02-12T10:39:53.854,2014-02-12T10:39:53.854,9.537499000000025,33.886917,Tunisia,Beja,,Construction of the Khalled dam in the governorate of Beja,,Construction,40000000,"Project aims: the project aims to control the water flow of Khalled River; it’s integrated in the Master Plan of protecting the areas near the Medjerda River against floods. The construction of the dam will reduce the flow pressure on the Majerda River at the point of intersection with the Khalled River near the city of Testour. It also aims to enhance activity and development of rural areas through the implementation of irrigated areas around the dam by for the benefit of Tborsouk population. In addition, the dam will contribute to strengthening of the national plan of water resource mobilization, which aims to achieve 95% of the mobilization by 2016, compared with 92% currently. Project owner: Ministry of Agriculture Project components: construction of a dam with a capacity of 21 million m3 with the following characteristics: - Dam type: compacted earth. - Dam basin area 303 km2. - Dam height: 64 m. Implementation of irrigated areas cover about 1500 hectares close to the dam. Project cost: the cost of the project is estimated to 40 Million U.S. Dollars distributed as follows: - 30 Million U.S. Dollars for dam construction; - 10 Million U.S. Dollars for the irrigated area. Project progress: the detailed studies of the dam are in progress and they are expected to be completed during 2014. As for the studies concerning the irrigated areas, they haven’t yet started since they depend on the completion of the dam. ",dam,Post Identified Project,2013-10-31,2013-10-31,Government,Ministry of Agriculture,Ministry of Agriculture,"Adresse : 30, rue Alain Savary 1002-Tunis le Belvédère Téléphone : (+216) 71 786 833 Fax : (+216) 71 780 391 ; 71 799 457 e-mail : mag@ministeres.tn Site web : http://www.onagri.nat.tn","For more information about the status of this project, please email us",Hanen Ltifi,ltifiH@state.gov,http://www.investintunisia.tn/document/701.pdf,http://tunisia.usembassy.gov/business.html,,,1,Pipeline,0,POINT (1061709.5321213587 4013627.8303939076),"
Construction of the Khalled dam in the governorate of Beja
Country: Tunisia
Sector: Construction
Date Added: 2014-02-12
Primary Funding Source: Government
Project Size (USD): 40000000
Status: Pipeline

Description:
Project aims: the project aims to control the water flow of Khalled River; it’s integrated in the Master Plan of protecting the areas near the Medjerda River against floods. The construction of the dam will reduce the flow pressure on the Majerda River at the point of intersection with the Khalled River near the city of Testour. It also aims to enhance activity and development of rural areas through the implementation of irrigated areas around the dam by for the benefit of Tborsouk population. In addition, the dam will contribute to strengthening of the national plan of water resource mobilization, which aims to achieve 95% of the mobilization by 2016, compared with 92% currently. Project owner: Ministry of Agriculture Project components: construction of a dam with a capacity of 21 million m3 with the following characteristics: - Dam type: compacted earth. - Dam basin area 303 km2. - Dam height: 64 m. Implementation of irrigated areas cover about 1500 hectares close to the dam. Project cost: the cost of the project is estimated to 40 Million U.S. Dollars distributed as follows: - 30 Million U.S. Dollars for dam construction; - 10 Million U.S. Dollars for the irrigated area. Project progress: the detailed studies of the dam are in progress and they are expected to be completed during 2014. As for the studies concerning the irrigated areas, they haven’t yet started since they depend on the completion of the dam.

Post Comments:
For more information about the status of this project, please email us

Project Website   Embassy Website   Contact

" DATATABLE.331,2014-01-17T07:42:26.944,2014-01-17T07:42:26.944,20.168330999999966,41.153332,Albania,Dumre Region,,TAP Natural Gas Storage Salt Cavern Project,,"Mining, Quarrying, and Oil and Gas Extraction",1000,The Trans Adriatic Pipeline project is investigating the option of developing gas storage facilities in the Dumre region in central Albania, using underground salt formations. This area is located approximately 50 km to the south of Tirana, and 20 km to the north of the planned Trans Adriatic Pipeline route. The Albanian government has a (currently non-operational) dual-fired oil/gas power plant in the region that it plans to bring back online to use with TAP gas. Having access to gas storage facilities may allow the government to better manage its energy mix, relying on its traditional hydro sources in winter and storing gas for the dry spring and summer months. http://www.trans-adriatic-pipeline.com/en/tap-project/key-features/gas-storage/,"natural gas, oil, pipeline",Post Identified Project,,,Private,,Trans-Adriatic Pipeline,,TAP has not yet announced a tender or project value for this project. ,Donald Brown,brownda8@state.gov,,,,,1,Pipeline,0,POINT (2245128.3370701903 5034984.473549389),
TAP Natural Gas Storage Salt Cavern Project
Country: Albania
Sector: Mining, Quarrying, and Oil and Gas Extraction
Date Added: 2014-01-17
Primary Funding Source: Private
Project Size (USD): 1000
Status: Pipeline

Description:
The Trans Adriatic Pipeline project is investigating the option of developing gas storage facilities in the Dumre region in central Albania, using underground salt formations. This area is located approximately 50 km to the south of Tirana, and 20 km to the north of the planned Trans Adriatic Pipeline route. The Albanian government has a (currently non-operational) dual-fired oil/gas power plant in the region that it plans to bring back online to use with TAP gas. Having access to gas storage facilities may allow the government to better manage its energy mix, relying on its traditional hydro sources in winter and storing gas for the dry spring and summer months. http://www.trans-adriatic-pipeline.com/en/tap-project/key-features/gas-storage/

Post Comments:
TAP has not yet announced a tender or project value for this project.

Contact

Description:
The project objective of Phase 3 is to establish a sustainable basis for decentralized rural development through: (i) further institutional development and capacity building; (ii) implementation of rural land tenure reforms and (iii) social, economic and environmental investments at the commune level.

Status: Fulfilled

Archived: Yes
Description:
The proposed program involves a budget support for the Government of Bhutan which is currently facing weakening growth prospects as well as challenges in macroeconomic management. The objective of the program is, therefore, to strengthen macrofinancial management in the country to ensure adequate and sound development financing in a balanced and non-distortionary manner. The expected impact of the proposed program is strengthened macrofinancial management of the government in a sustainable manner. The outcome will be increased predictability in funds-flow and creation of greater fiscal space in the government budget.

Expansion of Tanjung Sauh Port
Country: Indonesia
Sector: Construction
Date Added: 2014-02-03
Primary Funding Source: Other
Project Size (USD): 756000000
Status: Pipeline

Description:
The Batam Management Board plans to develop a transshipment terminal located in Tanjung Sauh, Batam. The project will develop the terminal (located in the Sijori Growth Triangle) and serve as a transit point for smaller feeder ports in the region without transshipment from Singapore. The government has prioritized this project in its Acceleration and Expansion of Indonesia Economic Development Masterplan (MP3EI).

Post Comments:
The Indonesian government would like this project to be procured as PPP and when bidding opens, the government is asking for bidders to be responsible for financing, engineering desgin, construction, and operation. The government will be responsible for land acquisition and partial construction to enhance the financial viability of the project.
