?tudes de d?veloppement des ?nergies renouvelables et d'efficacit? ?nerg?tique (Energy Efficiency and Renewable Energy Study)
Country: Cameroon
Sector: Utilities
Date Added: 2013-07-23
Primary Funding Source: Development Bank
Project Size (USD): 4527000
Status: Pipeline

Archived: Yes
Description:
This study will produce an action plan to develop renewable energy in Cameroon from 2014 to 2035. Renewable energy could reduce Cameroon's energy dependence, better economic competitiveness, and improve energy security.

Project Website   Embassy Website   " DATATABLE.234,2013-08-14T09:39:08.885,2013-12-31T19:00:00,24.745278,59.437222,Estonia,Tallinn,EUR,Building construction work,CPV 45210000,Construction,0,"The Estonian state real estate management company RKAS has announced a tender aimed to find the developer for a complex of buildings that would house four Estonian government ministries in the future. The building is expected to be ready in 2016. Under the arrangement, the developer would get the right of superficies to the property and a rental agreement on the complex would be concluded for ten years. New buildings put up today must have energy consumption not higher than 160 kilowatt-hours per square meter per year. Starting 2019 all new buildings of the public sector must be near zero energy buildings. The annual energy consumption of the planned structure of the four ministries is from 100-120 kWh per square meter. The building design of the complex was completed by EA Reng AS http://www.eareng.ee/index.php?page=358& . The deadline for applying for the concession is Oct. 11. All procurement documentation is available in Estonian after registration on the State Procurement website: https://riigihanked.riik.ee/register/RegisterHanked.html. Tender is also published in the: http://ted.europa.eu/udl?uri=TED:NOTICE:273467-2013:TEXT:EN:HTML&src=0&tabId=0",Construction,Post Identified Project,2013-08-12,2013-10-11,Other,,, Riigi Kinnisvara Aktsiaselts 10788733 Lasnamâ??e 2 For the attention of: Kristiina Kaarna 11412 Tallinn ESTONIA Telephone: +372 53092775 E-mail: kristiina.kaarna@rkas.ee,,Reene Sepp,seppr@state.gov,http://ted.europa.eu/udl?uri=TED:NOTICE:273467-2013:TEXT:EN:HTML&src=0&tabId=0,http://estonia.usembassy.gov/business.html,,,1,Pipeline,1,POINT (2754631.7464979948 8275493.479054799),"
Building construction work
Country: Estonia
Sector: Construction
Date Added: 2013-08-14
Primary Funding Source: Other
Project Size (USD): 0
Status: Pipeline

Archived: Yes
Description:
The Estonian state real estate management company RKAS has announced a tender aimed to find the developer for a complex of buildings that would house four Estonian government ministries in the future. The building is expected to be ready in 2016. Under the arrangement, the developer would get the right of superficies to the property and a rental agreement on the complex would be concluded for ten years. New buildings put up today must have energy consumption not higher than 160 kilowatt-hours per square meter per year. Starting 2019 all new buildings of the public sector must be near zero energy buildings. The annual energy consumption of the planned structure of the four ministries is from 100-120 kWh per square meter. The building design of the complex was completed by EA Reng AS http://www.eareng.ee/index.php?page=358& . The deadline for applying for the concession is Oct. 11. All procurement documentation is available in Estonian after registration on the State Procurement website: https://riigihanked.riik.ee/register/RegisterHanked.html. Tender is also published in the: http://ted.europa.eu/udl?uri=TED:NOTICE:273467-2013:TEXT:EN:HTML&src=0&tabId=0

Project Website   Embassy Website   Contact
" DATATABLE.197,2013-07-23T00:00:00,2013-12-05T00:00:00,38.746799,9.022736,Ethiopia,"Addis Ababa, Ethiopia",AF,Ethiopia Local Government Development Project II,P133592,Public Administration,350000000,The government introduced the Urban Local Government Development program (ULGDP) in 2008 as a performance grant to urban local governments for infrastructure and services. This project will extend the program to additional cities.,"Africa, Ethiopia, Federal Democratic Republic of Ethiopia, Local government, Administration, Services",World Bank,2013-05-07,2014-03-20,Development Bank,Federal Democratic Republic of Ethiopia,Ministry of Urban Development and Construction,"Abebaw Alemayehu, Senior Urban Development Specialist, World Bank, aalemayehu@worldbank.org; Yehya Aman, Director General, Urban Governance and Capacity Building Bureau, Ministry of Urban Development and Construction, ugcbb@gmail.com ",,,,http://www.worldbank.org/projects/P133592/ethiopia-local-government-development-project-ii?lang=en,http://ethiopia.usembassy.gov/business.html,,,1,Pipeline,1,POINT (4313273.934549321 1008583.6520290761),"
Ethiopia Local Government Development Project II
Country: Ethiopia
Sector: Public Administration
Date Added: 2013-07-23
Primary Funding Source: Development Bank
Project Size (USD): 350000000
Status: Pipeline

Archived: Yes
Description:
The government introduced the Urban Local Government Development program (ULGDP) in 2008 as a performance grant to urban local governments for infrastructure and services. This project will extend the program to additional cities.

Project Website   Embassy Website   " DATATABLE.824,2014-07-28T05:17:10.614,2014-07-28T05:17:10.614,14.480832999999961,35.926389,Malta,Pembroke,,"International Expression of Interest for the Concession to Design, Build and Operate White Rocks Malta",,Construction,1000,"This Expression of Interest has the primary objective of exploring the possibility of implementing an up-market and development project with the participation of the private sector at ‘White Rocks Malta’. This EoI’s objective is to seek modern, creative and innovative ideas from prospective entrepreneurs regarding the utilization of ‘White Rocks Malta’. The total planned location has an approximate area of 449,885 square meters (45 Hectares). The former White Rocks Holiday Complex and its grounds occupy approximately 135, 600 square meters of land on the southern part of the site, which comprises roughly 38% of the total planned location. The developmet of ‘White Rocks Malta’ may be utilized for up-market real estate development that includes amongst others; Luxury Hotels of not less than 5 stars, Luxury units and a High quality lifestyle community village. The development of ‘ White Rocks Malta’ will need to adhere to rigid sustainable development concepts based on green construction principles in the design, build and operation of the planned location.","Construction, real estate development, Luxury Hotel",Post Identified Project,2014-06-20,2014-09-20,Private,N/A,Successful bidder,"Ministry for the Economy, Investment and Small Business. POC: Privatization Unit, email: whiterocksmalta.meib@gov.mt",Closing date for collecting EoI document 20 September 2014 (12 hours CET) Closing date for the submission of the EoI document 24 October 2014 (12 hours CET) ‘White Rocks Malta’ is part of the Maltese Government Strategy to make Malta the best in the EU.,Maria Cassar,cassarm@state.gov,https://meib.gov.mt/en/ministry/The-Minister/Documents/White%20Rocks%20Malta.pdf,,,,1,In Procurement,0,POINT (1611998.9558224275 4290497.333478742),"
International Expression of Interest for the Concession to Design, Build and Operate White Rocks Malta
Country: Malta
Sector: Construction
Date Added: 2014-07-28
Primary Funding Source: Private
Project Size (USD): 1000
Status: In Procurement

Description:
This Expression of Interest has the primary objective of exploring the possibility of implementing an up-market and development project with the participation of the private sector at ‘White Rocks Malta’. This EoI’s objective is to seek modern, creative and innovative ideas from prospective entrepreneurs regarding the utilization of ‘White Rocks Malta’. The total planned location has an approximate area of 449,885 square meters (45 Hectares). The former White Rocks Holiday Complex and its grounds occupy approximately 135, 600 square meters of land on the southern part of the site, which comprises roughly 38% of the total planned location. The developmet of ‘White Rocks Malta’ may be utilized for up-market real estate development that includes amongst others; Luxury Hotels of not less than 5 stars, Luxury units and a High quality lifestyle community village. The development of ‘ White Rocks Malta’ will need to adhere to rigid sustainable development concepts based on green construction principles in the design, build and operation of the planned location.

Post Comments:
Closing date for collecting EoI document 20 September 2014 (12 hours CET) Closing date for the submission of the EoI document 24 October 2014 (12 hours CET) ‘White Rocks Malta’ is part of the Maltese Government Strategy to make Malta the best in the EU.

" DATATABLE.310,2013-12-12T22:58:59.533,2013-12-12T22:58:59.533,113.92132700000002,-0.789275,Indonesia,,,Indonesia Second Power Transmission Development Project,P123994,Utilities,325000000,"The development objective of the Second Power Transmission Development Project for Indonesia is to meet growing electricity demand and increase access to electricity in the project area through strengthening and expanding the capacity of the power transmission networks in the project area in a sustainable manner. The project has single component with following two parts: first part is extension and rehabilitation of selected existing 150-20 Kilovolt (kV) substations and 70-20 kV substations in the project area, including adding one or more new transformers and associated equipment; and or replacing existing transformers with new transformers and associated equipment with higher capacity; and second part is construction of selected new 150-20 kV substations in the project area, including installation of transformers and associated equipment.","Electricity, World Bank, Transmission and Distribution",World Bank,2013-07-08,2014-12-31,Development Banks,Republic of Indonesia,PT PLN,sasongko@pln.co.id,Phase II of World Bank Project Transmission and Distribution of Electricity Across Indonesia,U.S. Embassy Jakarta,allentj@state.gov,http://www.worldbank.org/projects/P123994/indonesia-second-power-transmission-development-project?lang=en,,,,1,Fulfilled,1,,"
Indonesia Second Power Transmission Development Project
Country: Indonesia
Sector: Utilities
Date Added: 2013-12-12
Primary Funding Source: Development Banks
Project Size (USD): 325000000
Status: Fulfilled

Archived: Yes
Description:
The development objective of the Second Power Transmission Development Project for Indonesia is to meet growing electricity demand and increase access to electricity in the project area through strengthening and expanding the capacity of the power transmission networks in the project area in a sustainable manner. The project has single component with following two parts: first part is extension and rehabilitation of selected existing 150-20 Kilovolt (kV) substations and 70-20 kV substations in the project area, including adding one or more new transformers and associated equipment; and or replacing existing transformers with new transformers and associated equipment with higher capacity; and second part is construction of selected new 150-20 kV substations in the project area, including installation of transformers and associated equipment.

Post Comments:
Phase II of World Bank Project Transmission and Distribution of Electricity Across Indonesia

" DATATABLE.923,2014-09-04T08:58:49.731,2014-09-04T08:58:49.731,21.005858999999987,44.016521,Serbia,Serbia,,Public Invitation for collecting Letters of Interest for privatization of 502 Serbian companies,,Manufacturing,100000000,"In order to survey the interest of potential investors, Privatization Agency of the Republic of Serbia announces the public invitation for collecting letters of interest, inviting investors to express their interest in privatization of specific companies. In line with expressed interest of potential investors on one side, and evaluation of company’s business viability on the other, the Agency shall submit to the Ministry of Economy, within 45 days after the deadline for submitting letters of interest, models and methods of privatization for each individual company in privatization. Based on Agency’s proposal, a decision shall be passed on the model and method of privatization, the initial price and measures for preparation and disburdening the company in privatization. Privatization Agency portfolio includes 502 parent companies and their subsidiaries from the following industries: administrative and support service activities (13), construction (51), public administration and defense; compulsory social security (1), human health services (16), IT and other information services (73), education (1), other services (4), agriculture, forestry and fishing (35), real estate activities (1), manufacturing (113), mining and quarrying (6), transportation and storage (21), electricity, gas, steam and air conditioning supply (7), water supply, sewerage, waste management and remediation (5), professional, scientific and technical activities (67), wholesale and retail trade; repair of motor vehicles and motorcycles (83), arts, entertainment and recreation (3), accommodation and food service activities (21), financial and insurance activities (15), for which the Public Invitation is announced. All interested investors are to submit their Letters of Interest for a particular company to the Privatization Agency of the Republic of Serbia by mail or directly to the Agency at 23 Terazije Street, or via e-mail to loi@priv.rs, not later than September 15, 2014. Full text of the public invitation, with basic information on companies from the portfolio of the Privatization Agency is available at www.priv.rs/public-invitation. Public Invitation for collecting Letters of Interest for privatization of 502 Serbian companies
Country: Serbia
Sector: Manufacturing
Date Added: 2014-09-04
Primary Funding Source: Other
Project Size (USD): 100000000
Status: In Procurement

Description:
In order to survey the interest of potential investors, Privatization Agency of the Republic of Serbia announces the public invitation for collecting letters of interest, inviting investors to express their interest in privatization of specific companies. In line with expressed interest of potential investors on one side, and evaluation of company’s business viability on the other, the Agency shall submit to the Ministry of Economy, within 45 days after the deadline for submitting letters of interest, models and methods of privatization for each individual company in privatization. Based on Agency’s proposal, a decision shall be passed on the model and method of privatization, the initial price and measures for preparation and disburdening the company in privatization. Privatization Agency portfolio includes 502 parent companies and their subsidiaries from the following industries: administrative and support service activities (13), construction (51), public administration and defense; compulsory social security (1), human health services (16), IT and other information services (73), education (1), other services (4), agriculture, forestry and fishing (35), real estate activities (1), manufacturing (113), mining and quarrying (6), transportation and storage (21), electricity, gas, steam and air conditioning supply (7), water supply, sewerage, waste management and remediation (5), professional, scientific and technical activities (67), wholesale and retail trade; repair of motor vehicles and motorcycles (83), arts, entertainment and recreation (3), accommodation and food service activities (21), financial and insurance activities (15), for which the Public Invitation is announced. All interested investors are to submit their Letters of Interest for a particular company to the Privatization Agency of the Republic of Serbia by mail or directly to the Agency at 23 Terazije Street, or via e-mail to loi@priv.rs, not later than September 15, 2014. Full text of the public invitation, with basic information on companies from the portfolio of the Privatization Agency is available at www.priv.rs/public-invitation.

" DATATABLE.932,2014-09-14T00:57:12.727,2014-09-14T00:57:12.727,90.41251809999994,23.810332,Bangladesh,District: Narayanganj; Division: Dhaka,,Operation & Maintenance Services of Siddhirganj 335 MW Combined Cycle Power Plant: Electricity Generation Company of Bangladesh Limited (EGCB),W-1461-EGCB/2014 (IDA Credit # 4508-BD),"Professional, Scientific, and Technical Services",443037975,"Government of Bangladesh has received a credit from the International Development Association (World Bank) in various currencies towards the cost of Siddhirganj Power Project. It is intended that part of the proceeds of this loan will be applied to eligible payments under the contract for Operations & Maintenance Services of the power plant. The power plant is under construction and is expected to be commissioned on February 2016. International competitive bidding will be conducted in accordance with World Bank's Single Stage Bidding Procedure following guidelines: Procurement under IBRD loans and IDA credits May 2004 revised October 2006 & May 2010. The bidder shall be a firm/company/joint venture of firms/companies from eligible source companies. The bidder shall have at least 10 years business experience in O&M service provision as prime contractor in the power industry with minimum average annual turnover of $ 3 million in the last 5 years. The bidder shall have experience of at least two service contracts (of which one overseas) of nature & complexity equivalent to the Services over the last 10 years from the bid submission deadline (to comply with this requirement, one Service contract cited should be at least 70% complete and another Service contract cited should be fully completed). Bids will be opened on the same day in the presence of bidder's representatives who choose to attend at 1130 hours BST on October 27, 2014 at the office of the Company Secretary, EGCB Limited. Bidders are advised to attend a pre-bid conference which will be held at the Conference Room of EGCB Ltd. on September 23, 2014 at 1000 hours BST.",EGCB Tender,Post Identified Project,2014-08-19,2014-10-27,Development Banks,Government of Bangladesh,'Electricity Generation Company of Bangladesh Limited (an enterprise of Bangladesh Power Development Board) ,"Mr. Kazi Nazrul Islam/Company Secretary/EGCB Ltd./Tel # +8802-8124197, 9134029, 9134032/Email: secretary@egcb.com.bd","A complete set of bidding documents may be purchased by the interested bidders on submission of a written application to the Company Secretary and upon receipt of a non-refundable fee of $ 400 only in the form pay order or demand draft in favor of 'Electricity Generation Company of Bangladesh Limited""",Syeda Shahrazad Rahman,RahmanSS@state.gov,http://www.egcb.com.bd,http://dhaka.usembassy.gov/business.html,,,1,In Procurement,0,POINT (10064675.476229623 2730313.2108322787),"
Operation & Maintenance Services of Siddhirganj 335 MW Combined Cycle Power Plant: Electricity Generation Company of Bangladesh Limited (EGCB)
Country: Bangladesh
Sector: Professional, Scientific, and Technical Services
Date Added: 2014-09-14
Primary Funding Source: Development Banks
Project Size (USD): 443037975
Status: In Procurement

Description:
Government of Bangladesh has received a credit from the International Development Association (World Bank) in various currencies towards the cost of Siddhirganj Power Project. It is intended that part of the proceeds of this loan will be applied to eligible payments under the contract for Operations & Maintenance Services of the power plant. The power plant is under construction and is expected to be commissioned on February 2016. International competitive bidding will be conducted in accordance with World Bank's Single Stage Bidding Procedure following guidelines: Procurement under IBRD loans and IDA credits May 2004 revised October 2006 & May 2010. The bidder shall be a firm/company/joint venture of firms/companies from eligible source companies. The bidder shall have at least 10 years business experience in O&M service provision as prime contractor in the power industry with minimum average annual turnover of $ 3 million in the last 5 years. The bidder shall have experience of at least two service contracts (of which one overseas) of nature & complexity equivalent to the Services over the last 10 years from the bid submission deadline (to comply with this requirement, one Service contract cited should be at least 70% complete and another Service contract cited should be fully completed). Bids must be delivered to the Company Secretary's office on or before October 27, 2014 at 1100 hours BST and must be accompanied by a security of $ 150,000 in favor of 'Electricity Generation Company of Bangladesh Limited'. Bids will be opened on the same day in the presence of bidder's representatives who choose to attend at 1130 hours BST on October 27, 2014 at the office of the Company Secretary, EGCB Limited. Bidders are advised to attend a pre-bid conference which will be held at the Conference Room of EGCB Ltd. on September 23, 2014 at 1000 hours BST.

Post Comments:
A complete set of bidding documents may be purchased by the interested bidders on submission of a written application to the Company Secretary and upon receipt of a non-refundable fee of $ 400 only in the form pay order or demand draft in favor of 'Electricity Generation Company of Bangladesh Limited""

Description:

It will provide climate resilient municipal infrastructure, including water supply, sanitation, drainage, flood protection, urban roads, and solid waste management facilities, and will strengthen institutional capacity and local governance for operating, maintaining, and expanding access to such services. The project will also mainstream climate resilience into urban planning.

BDPC would like to invite reputable local, international or joint-venture, consultant and solution provider with relevant experience for the above mentioned project. 2. BDPC is a statutory body established to administer the deposit protection scheme aimed at protecting depositors against the loss of part or all of the deposits of a member institution in the event the member institution is unable to meet its obligations to depositors. There are total of 10 financial institutions that are licensed under Section 4 or 23 of the Banking Order, 2006, Section 4 or 23 of the Islamic Banking Order, 2008 and Section 3 of the Finance Companies Act (Chapter 89). 3. The objectives of CPS are as follows: i. The accuracy of the calculation for the eligible protected deposits (including of profit/interest). ii. BDPC to reimburse all eligible depositors in a short period of time. 4. The scope of services to be provided by consultant include but not limited as follows:- A. CONSULTANCY WORK i. Carry out analysis of current business process and requirement; ii. Conduct necessary surveys and data collection on member institutions for the purpose of CPS; iii. Identify risk and security requirements; and iv. Identify end-to-end process flow and the best practices for the proposed system taking into account the Deposit Protection Order, 2010; B. IMPLEMENTATION WORK i. To produce implementation plan which include the design and implementation period; ii. Supply hardware and software; iii. Develop and delivery of the system and provide end user training; iv. User Acceptance Test; v. Develop contract and service agreements; vi. To deliver post implementation review reports and related documents 5. Interested consultants are required to submit their EXPRESSION OF INTEREST (EOI) and provide the following information: i. Name and description of consultant and solution provider (if applicable); ii. Number of years of experience as a consultant and solution provider; iii. Detailed description of similar project(s) undertaken by the consultant, including value of the project(s) in BND and the consultant’s specific role in the project(s); iv. The consultant’s and solution provider’s details on financial support; v. Experience of consultant’s professional staff including detailed CVs; vi. Experience of solution provider’s professional staff including detailed CVs; and vii. Brief proposed concept of consultancy work and the system implementation. Expression of Interest (EOI) must be submitted to the address below by 25/09/2014 (Thursday) latest by 4.00pm to: Chief Executive Officer Brunei Darussalam Deposit Protection Corporation Level 3, Ministry of Finance Building Commonwealth Drive Jalan Kebangsaan Brunei Darussalam BB3910 For further information please contact us during office hours: Office No: +673 2384597/8 Fax No: +673 2384596 Email: general@bdpc.gov.bn",IN-LINE PIPELINE MAINTENANCE,Post Identified Project,2014-08-25,2014-09-25,Government,,BRUNEI DARUSSALAM DEPOSIT PROTECTION CORPORATION,"U.S. Embassy Bandar seri Begawan, +673-238-4616",The project value is an estimate by post and that the government has not specified a value. Proponents are expected to provide the project value in the proposal.,Matthew Stannard,stannardmb@state.gov,,http://www.brunei.usembassy.gov,,,1,In Procurement,0,POINT (12795309.623687407 545045.4233517295),"

Country: Brunei
Sector: Finance and Insurance
Date Added: 2014-08-25
Primary Funding Source: Government
Project Size (USD): 2500000
Status: In Procurement

Description:
INVITATION FOR EXPRESSION OF INTEREST (EOI) FOR CONSULTANCY SERVICES, SUPPLY, DELIVERY, INSTALLATION AND THE IMPLEMENTATION OF COMPENSATION PAYOUT SYSTEM (CPS) FOR BRUNEI DARUSSALAM DEPOSIT PROTECTION CORPORATION 1. BDPC would like to invite reputable local, international or joint-venture, consultant and solution provider with relevant experience for the above mentioned project. 2. BDPC is a statutory body established to administer the deposit protection scheme aimed at protecting depositors against the loss of part or all of the deposits of a member institution in the event the member institution is unable to meet its obligations to depositors. There are total of 10 financial institutions that are licensed under Section 4 or 23 of the Banking Order, 2006, Section 4 or 23 of the Islamic Banking Order, 2008 and Section 3 of the Finance Companies Act (Chapter 89). 3. The objectives of CPS are as follows: i. The accuracy of the calculation for the eligible protected deposits (including of profit/interest). ii. BDPC to reimburse all eligible depositors in a short period of time. 4. The scope of services to be provided by consultant include but not limited as follows:- A. CONSULTANCY WORK i. Carry out analysis of current business process and requirement; ii. Conduct necessary surveys and data collection on member institutions for the purpose of CPS; iii. Identify risk and security requirements; and iv. Identify end-to-end process flow and the best practices for the proposed system taking into account the Deposit Protection Order, 2010; B. IMPLEMENTATION WORK i. To produce implementation plan which include the design and implementation period; ii. Supply hardware and software; iii. Develop and delivery of the system and provide end user training; iv. User Acceptance Test; v. Develop contract and service agreements; vi. To deliver post implementation review reports and related documents 5. Interested consultants are required to submit their EXPRESSION OF INTEREST (EOI) and provide the following information: i. Name and description of consultant and solution provider (if applicable); ii. Number of years of experience as a consultant and solution provider; iii. Detailed description of similar project(s) undertaken by the consultant, including value of the project(s) in BND and the consultant’s specific role in the project(s); iv. The consultant’s and solution provider’s details on financial support; v. Experience of consultant’s professional staff including detailed CVs; vi. Experience of solution provider’s professional staff including detailed CVs; and vii. Brief proposed concept of consultancy work and the system implementation. Expression of Interest (EOI) must be submitted to the address below by 25/09/2014 (Thursday) latest by 4.00pm to: Chief Executive Officer Brunei Darussalam Deposit Protection Corporation Level 3, Ministry of Finance Building Commonwealth Drive Jalan Kebangsaan Brunei Darussalam BB3910 For further information please contact us during office hours: Office No: +673 2384597/8 Fax No: +673 2384596 Email: general@bdpc.gov.bn

" DATATABLE.750,2014-06-09T02:51:40.88,2014-06-09T02:51:40.88,23.785365800000022,38.01632499999999,GREECE AND ALBANIA,VARIOUS,,TRANS ADRIATIC ONSHORE PIPELINE CONSTRUCTION,2014/S 090-158271,Construction,500000000,"This is the Pre-Qualification Questionnaire (the PQQ) under the negotiated procedure (the Procurement Process) with publication of a contract notice for the tendering of one (1) to five (5) contracts (the Contract(s)) for onshore pipeline construction in Greece and Albania. The Procurement Process is to contract the Work for endorsement of the currently existing design engineering and to finalise the outstanding detailed design, procurement of material that is not provided by Trans Adriatic Pipeline AG (hereafter referred to as TAP or the Contracting Entity) and construction, testing and pre-commissioning of the onshore pipeline in Greece and Albania. According to the Contracting Entity’s Overall Procurement Strategy the pipeline construction in Greece and Albania shall be tendered in five (5) separate sections (but the TAP shall have the right to combine sections into larger contracts). The TAP pipeline will start close to the Turkish / Greek border, cross Greece, cross Albania, cross the Adriatic Sea and come ashore in southern Italy. Construction of the TAP pipeline is planned to start in 2016 with the overall TAP gas-transport system being ready for commissioning in July 2019. More about TAP AG and the TAP Project can be found on www.tap-ag.com (TAP Project). ",Pipeline Construction,Post Identified Project,,,Self Financed,,Trans Adriatic Pipeline AG,,,Michael Durnan,DurnanMJ@state.gov,,,,,1,In Procurement,0,POINT (2647774.809187746 4581732.2446098225),"
TRANS ADRIATIC ONSHORE PIPELINE CONSTRUCTION
Country: GREECE AND ALBANIA
Sector: Construction
Date Added: 2014-06-09
Primary Funding Source: Self Financed
Project Size (USD): 500000000
Status: In Procurement

Description:
This is the Pre-Qualification Questionnaire (the PQQ) under the negotiated procedure (the Procurement Process) with publication of a contract notice for the tendering of one (1) to five (5) contracts (the Contract(s)) for onshore pipeline construction in Greece and Albania. The Procurement Process is to contract the Work for endorsement of the currently existing design engineering and to finalise the outstanding detailed design, procurement of material that is not provided by Trans Adriatic Pipeline AG (hereafter referred to as TAP or the Contracting Entity) and construction, testing and pre-commissioning of the onshore pipeline in Greece and Albania. According to the Contracting Entity’s Overall Procurement Strategy the pipeline construction in Greece and Albania shall be tendered in five (5) separate sections (but the TAP shall have the right to combine sections into larger contracts). The TAP pipeline will start close to the Turkish / Greek border, cross Greece, cross Albania, cross the Adriatic Sea and come ashore in southern Italy. Construction of the TAP pipeline is planned to start in 2016 with the overall TAP gas-transport system being ready for commissioning in July 2019. More about TAP AG and the TAP Project can be found on www.tap-ag.com (TAP Project).

Contact

Firms may assocaite to enhance their qualifications. Further information may be obatined from the Quality Assurance Manager, Transport Board, Weymouth, Roebuck Street, Bridgetown, Barbados between Monday August 11, 2014 and Friday August 29, 2014 during the hours of 9:00 am and 3:00pm except Public Holidays. All corporate applications must include with the application a copy of the company's Certificate of Incorporation as evidence of the fact that the compnay is an existing registered company as at the date of application. The referred to above menas a Certificate of Incorporation issued under the 1985 Companies Act of Barbados or where applicable a Certificate of Amendment. Certificates must be dated after December 31, 1984. A shortlist of no more than six (6) persons expressing interest will be invited to submit proposals. Applicants will be advised of the results of their application in due course. Any company incorporated outside of Barbados which is awarded a contract will be required to be registered in Barbados as an external company under the Companies Act of Barbados. The original and one (1) copy of the Expression of Interest for the purchase of buses"" must be prepared in English and delivered in sealed envelopes to the following address no later than 4:30pm on September 1, 2014: The General Manager Transport Board Weymouth Roebuck Street Bridgetown Barbados Expressions of Interest must be placed in the Tenders Box located at the above address. Request for Expression of Interest For the Purchase of New Buses
Country: Barbados
Sector: Transportation and Warehousing
Date Added: 2014-08-15
Primary Funding Source: Government
Project Size (USD): 2000000
Status: Pipeline

Description:
The Government of Barbados through the Transport board invites Expressions of Interest for the purchase of 110 buses comprising of 40 small and 70 large to supplement the excisting fleet to provide a moree efficient and reliable public transportation system to service the general public of Barbados. The bus specifications may be collected from: the General manager Transport Board Weymouth Roebuck Street Bridgetown Interested firms/consultants must provide information establishing that they are qualified to provide the buses by submitting evidence of their past experience in undertaking similar projects, the availability of appropiate skills, equipment capabilities and historical contract performance. Firms may assocaite to enhance their qualifications. Further information may be obatined from the Quality Assurance Manager, Transport Board, Weymouth, Roebuck Street, Bridgetown, Barbados between Monday August 11, 2014 and Friday August 29, 2014 during the hours of 9:00 am and 3:00pm except Public Holidays. All corporate applications must include with the application a copy of the company's Certificate of Incorporation as evidence of the fact that the compnay is an existing registered company as at the date of application. The referred to above menas a Certificate of Incorporation issued under the 1985 Companies Act of Barbados or where applicable a Certificate of Amendment. Certificates must be dated after December 31, 1984. A shortlist of no more than six (6) persons expressing interest will be invited to submit proposals. Applicants will be advised of the results of their application in due course. Any company incorporated outside of Barbados which is awarded a contract will be required to be registered in Barbados as an external company under the Companies Act of Barbados. The original and one (1) copy of the Expression of Interest for the purchase of buses"" must be prepared in English and delivered in sealed envelopes to the following address no later than 4:30pm on September 1, 2014: The General Manager Transport Board Weymouth Roebuck Street Bridgetown Barbados Expressions of Interest must be placed in the Tenders Box located at the above address. Late submissions will not be accepted and will be returned unopened to the applicants The Transport Board reserves the right to accept or reject Expressions of Interest received.

Post Comments:
The project value of US$ 2 miilion is an estimate based on the average cost of a bus exclusive of duties. This project is at the tendering stage and therefore the Government is looking at the each bid individually.

Contact
" DATATABLE.892,2014-08-19T08:39:28.332,2014-08-19T08:39:28.332,21.42799560000003,41.9973462,Macedonia,SKOPJE,,Natural Gas Distribution Network Expansion,,Utilities,210000000,"As expected, the Goverment of Macedonia announced on August 15 that it will expand its plans for a natural gas distribution network to include not just Skopje but 63 additional municipalities in eastern and western Macedonia. Deputy Prime Minister for Economy Vladimir Peshevski announced that public tenders will be issued by late September 2014 and added that Macedonia will invest $210 million in total ($140 million for Skopje and $70 million for the rest) in the 650-kilometer distribution network. The GOM has received only two bids for its gasification plan for Skopje, and the government has not yet announced the winner. Macedonia currently has very limited capacity to import natural gas, and government officials have expressed interest in connecting via a spur to Russia’s planned South Stream pipeline or the planned Trans Adriatic Pipeline (TAP), which would deliver natural gas from Azerbaijan.","Natural Gas, Pipeline, Infrastructure",Post Identified Project,2014-08-19,2014-09-30,Government,Unknown,Government of Macedonia,,,Brian T. Smith,smithbt@state.gov,http://mtc.gov.mk/new_site/en/storija.asp?id=4255,http://macedonia.usembassy.gov/business.html,,,1,Pipeline,0,POINT (2385353.55891251 5160581.925968987),"
Natural Gas Distribution Network Expansion
Country: Macedonia
Sector: Utilities
Date Added: 2014-08-19
Primary Funding Source: Government
Project Size (USD): 210000000
Status: Pipeline

Description:
As expected, the Goverment of Macedonia announced on August 15 that it will expand its plans for a natural gas distribution network to include not just Skopje but 63 additional municipalities in eastern and western Macedonia. Deputy Prime Minister for Economy Vladimir Peshevski announced that public tenders will be issued by late September 2014 and added that Macedonia will invest $210 million in total ($140 million for Skopje and $70 million for the rest) in the 650-kilometer distribution network. The GOM has received only two bids for its gasification plan for Skopje, and the government has not yet announced the winner. Macedonia currently has very limited capacity to import natural gas, and government officials have expressed interest in connecting via a spur to Russia’s planned South Stream pipeline or the planned Trans Adriatic Pipeline (TAP), which would deliver natural gas from Azerbaijan.

Project Website   Embassy Website   Contact
" DATATABLE.929,2014-09-09T14:43:48.939,2014-09-09T14:43:48.939,-60.98746870000002,14.0101094,St. Lucia,Castries,,Geothermal Project preparations,,"Professional, Scientific, and Technical Services",2000000,"The Government of Saint Lucia is expecting funding in the amount of two million United States dollars equivalent from the World Bank towards the cost of the Geothermal Resource Development Project, and it intends to apply part of the funding for payments for goods, works, related services and consulting services to be procured under this project. The development objective of the project is to provide support for the Government of Saint Lucia to make an informed decision regarding geothermal exploration and development in Saint Lucia by undertaking upstream preparatory activities. Such support would help the Government of Saint Lucia confirm areas for drilling, partner with a qualified developer, and design a geothermal exploration/resource confirmation program for sustainable implementation – all in line with good industry practices and international standards. The project will include the following components: Component 1: Upstream geothermal development preparation and project management.This component will aim at advancing surface level reconnaissance that is necessary to determine whether several areas identified maybe suitable for geothermal exploration within the Qualibou region. It will also include a review of previous analysis such as geological, geophysical and geochemical surveys, as well as available data from previously drilled wells. The component will also initiate environmental and social evaluations, including stakeholder consultations, to ascertain baseline conditions and the steps that may be necessary to mitigate any impacts so that geothermal can be developed in a safe and sustainable manner. Funding will also be applied towards technical advisory support to coordinate the technical assessments and integrate the results in a pre-feasibility study. Funding will also be allocated to cover incremental operating costs for project implementation and management including hiring local specialists to manage grant activities, enhancing domestic capacity by transferring knowledge through on-the-job training and workshops:. Component 2: Transaction and regulatory support. The component will support the GoSL in designing, structuring and negotiating an equitable agreement with a potential qualified geothermal developer; and will ensure a fair allocation of potential risks. It will also help facilitate initial off-take arrangements with the power company that is essential for moving forward with potential investments. The work will also help ensure that the legal and regulatory framework provides an adequate investment climate for a potential power project; and it will lead to the inclusion of geothermal as a part of LUCELEC’s formal expansion plans, providing the certainty for investing in exploration drilling. The project is expected to be completed by January 31, 2017. Procurement of contracts financed by the World Bank will be conducted through the procedures as specified in the World Bank’s Guidelines: Procurement under IBRD Loans and IDA Credits (January 2011), and is open to all eligible bidders as defined in the guidelines. Consulting services will be selected in accordance with the World Bank’s Guidelines: Selection and Employment of Consultants by World Bank Borrowers (January 2011). Interested eligible bidders who wish to be included on the mailing list to receive invitations to bid, and interested consultants who wish to receive a copy of advertisement requesting expressions of interest for consultancy contracts, or those requiring additional information, should contact the address below:",St. Lucia; Geothermal; Energy,Post Identified Project,2014-08-29,2015-08-23,Development Banks,,"Ministry of Finance, Government f St. Lucia","Project Coordination Unit Project Coordinator Attn: Ms. Cheryl Mathurin, 5th Level Conway Business Centre Waterfront – Castries Tel: 1-758-468-2180 ext 2413/5814/5/6 Fax: 1-758-453-0417 E-mail: slupcu@gosl.gov.lc Website: http://finance.gov.lc/",,Michael Carver,CarverMJ@state.gov,http://www.finance.gov.lc/,,,,1,In Procurement,0,POINT (-6789093.960454713 1575376.3986998422),"
Geothermal Project preparations
Country: St. Lucia
Sector: Professional, Scientific, and Technical Services
Date Added: 2014-09-09
Primary Funding Source: Development Banks
Project Size (USD): 2000000
Status: In Procurement

Description:
The Government of Saint Lucia is expecting funding in the amount of two million United States dollars equivalent from the World Bank towards the cost of the Geothermal Resource Development Project, and it intends to apply part of the funding for payments for goods, works, related services and consulting services to be procured under this project. The development objective of the project is to provide support for the Government of Saint Lucia to make an informed decision regarding geothermal exploration and development in Saint Lucia by undertaking upstream preparatory activities. Such support would help the Government of Saint Lucia confirm areas for drilling, partner with a qualified developer, and design a geothermal exploration/resource confirmation program for sustainable implementation – all in line with good industry practices and international standards. The project will include the following components: Component 1: Upstream geothermal development preparation and project management.This component will aim at advancing surface level reconnaissance that is necessary to determine whether several areas identified maybe suitable for geothermal exploration within the Qualibou region. It will also include a review of previous analysis such as geological, geophysical and geochemical surveys, as well as available data from previously drilled wells. The component will also initiate environmental and social evaluations, including stakeholder consultations, to ascertain baseline conditions and the steps that may be necessary to mitigate any impacts so that geothermal can be developed in a safe and sustainable manner. Funding will also be applied towards technical advisory support to coordinate the technical assessments and integrate the results in a pre-feasibility study. Funding will also be allocated to cover incremental operating costs for project implementation and management including hiring local specialists to manage grant activities, enhancing domestic capacity by transferring knowledge through on-the-job training and workshops:. Component 2: Transaction and regulatory support. The component will support the GoSL in designing, structuring and negotiating an equitable agreement with a potential qualified geothermal developer; and will ensure a fair allocation of potential risks. It will also help facilitate initial off-take arrangements with the power company that is essential for moving forward with potential investments. The work will also help ensure that the legal and regulatory framework provides an adequate investment climate for a potential power project; and it will lead to the inclusion of geothermal as a part of LUCELEC’s formal expansion plans, providing the certainty for investing in exploration drilling. The project is expected to be completed by January 31, 2017. Procurement of contracts financed by the World Bank will be conducted through the procedures as specified in the World Bank’s Guidelines: Procurement under IBRD Loans and IDA Credits (January 2011), and is open to all eligible bidders as defined in the guidelines. Consulting services will be selected in accordance with the World Bank’s Guidelines: Selection and Employment of Consultants by World Bank Borrowers (January 2011). Interested eligible bidders who wish to be included on the mailing list to receive invitations to bid, and interested consultants who wish to receive a copy of advertisement requesting expressions of interest for consultancy contracts, or those requiring additional information, should contact the address below:

Project Website   Contact

Sector: Educational Services
Date Added: 2013-02-01
Primary Funding Source: Development Bank
Project Size (USD): 100000000
Status: Fulfilled

Archived: Yes
Description:
The project aims to raise school readiness for 5-year old children by targeting the following outcomes: (1) Expand full day preschool enrolments with near universal participation in full-day preschool being achieved for 5-year olds by 2016; (2) Improve preschool quality; and (3) strengthen preschool teacher and manager professional expertise.

Colombian 4G road expansion program PPP
Country: Colombia
Sector: Transportation and Warehousing
Date Added: 2014-03-10
Primary Funding Source: Private
Project Size (USD): 20000000000
Status: In Procurement

Description:
With a number of large-scale roads and highways in disarray, PPPs in Colombia are underway to assist the government’s aim to improve the country’s transport system. Fourth Generation (4G) of the Road Concessions Program has been developed. This ambitious programme includes 40 projects to build some 8,000km with a total investment of $25bn during the course of the next seven years. Projects will be carried out under a Public Private Partnership (PPP) approach and will furnish a road infrastructure more suitable to the economic development of the country.

" DATATABLE.69,2012-12-01T00:00:00,2013-12-06T00:00:00,34.301525,-13.254308,Malawi,Malawi,AF,MCC Power Sector Compact,,Utilities,350700000,"Rehabilitate, upgrade and modernize generation, transmission and distribution assets in most urgent need of repair, in order to preserve existing generation, improve the capability of the transmission system, and increase the efficiency and sustainability of hydropower generation. MCC Power Sector Compact
Country: Malawi
Sector: Utilities
Date Added: 2012-12-01
Primary Funding Source: Private
Project Size (USD): 350700000
Status: Pipeline

Description:
Rehabilitate, upgrade and modernize generation, transmission and distribution assets in most urgent need of repair, in order to preserve existing generation, improve the capability of the transmission system, and increase the efficiency and sustainability of hydropower generation. The Infrastructure Development Activity is only viable, technically and economically, if the Government and ESCOM maintain current generation assets and expand the generation capacity of the power system. Under the Infrastructure Development Activity, the Government will invest in new generation by completing the construction of the Kapichira II hydropower plant. Additionally, the Government will continue to seek to attract sustainable investment from the private sector and other donors to add significant amounts of new generation to the system.

Country: Botswana
Sector: Agriculture, Forestry, Fishing and Hunting
Date Added: 2014-10-20
Primary Funding Source: Private
Project Size (USD): 1000000
Status: In Procurement

Description:
The Nata Bird Sanctuary is a community conservation area located in the north-eastern periphery of Sowa Pan adjacent to the Francistown-Nata road, approximately 20km from Nata and 170km from Francistown. The sanctuary covers an area of 230km2 compromising of pans and open grasslands. Companies that express interest should provide the folowing: a. Background of the company/partnership or consortia b. Clear demonstration of ability to source, contract or partner with entity which has proven track record and experience in tourism operation management. c. Brief outline of proposed ideas for possible developments and activities. On offer wil be a sub lease for Operation of non-consumptive Tourism activities within the Nata Bird Sanctuary. Amanagement plan has been developed, but it is not exhaustive, and will act as a guide to possible developments and activities. 1. Sortlisted expression of interest will be expected to participate in a self-funded site visit coordinated by Botswana Tourism Organisation at a date to be communicated. 2. All those shortlisted at the EOI and attended the site visit will be allowed to tender for the development, management and operations of tourist facilities and activities at Nata Bird Sanctuary and will be expected to pay P1000 (Appx $110.00) as tender fee. The closing date for for reciept of the Expression of Interest submission is 31st October 2014 at 1200hrs (0600 EST) and should be addressed to ""The Chief Executive Officer"" and delivered to the following address: Fairgrounds Office Park. Block B, Ground Floor, Plot 50676, Gaborone, Tel: 3913111

Post Comments:
Any assistance that might be needed in regard to this EOI, please do not hesitate to contact the above mentioned person at the U.S Embassy Gaborone, Botswana. Tel: +267 373 2431/ +267 71372650.

The EDPMO is offering complimentary standard exhibition booth (3x3 meters) for exhibitors recruited by Post. Brunei Energy Exhibition
Country: Brunei
Sector: Utilities
Date Added: 2014-02-28
Primary Funding Source: Government
Project Size (USD): 500000
Status: Pipeline

Archived: Yes
Description:
(U) Upcoming Energy Week Exhibition March 24 – 29, 2014: The Energy Efficiency and Conservation (EEC) Unit of the Energy Department of the Prime Minister’s Office (EDPMO) will host the Brunei Energy Exhibition 2014 on March 24 – 29, 2014. They are inviting international and local companies to showcase new technologies, appliances and products in the fields of Energy Efficiency and Conservation. The EDPMO is offering complimentary standard exhibition booth (3x3 meters) for exhibitors recruited by Post. The deadline for registration is February 28, 2014 but Post just received the invitation and was assured that registration will be accepted past the deadline. Post would appreciate Desk’s assistance in passing this information to relevant business groups. The exhibition is an exciting business opportunity for U.S. companies specializing in the manufacture and supply of energy efficient products, equipment and technology for domestic and commercial applications. Consulting firms with the capability to design energy efficiency plans and policies would also benefit through offering services to Brunei governmental organizations and SMEs.

Post Comments:


Project Website   Embassy Website   Contact

" DATATABLE.79,2013-01-01T00:00:00,2013-11-24T19:00:00,90.356331,23.684994,Bangladesh,Bangladesh,SCA,Climate Resilient Participatory Afforestation and Reforestation Project,P127015,"Agriculture, Forestry, Fishing and Hunting",35000000,"The overall project development objective is to increase the resilience of coastal population to natural disasters and climate change. More specifically, the project aims at (a) reducing the loss of life, assets, crops and livestock during natural disasters; (b) reducing the time of recovery after natural disaster such as cyclone; and (c) improving agricultural production by reducing saline water intrusion which is expected to worsen due climate change. This objective will be achieved by rehabilitating and improving the polder system in the coastal area.","Resource Management, Forestry",World Bank,2012-11-13,2013-01-15,Development Bank,"Government of Bangladesh, Ministry of Environment And Forests",Bangladesh Forest Department,Contact: Shakil Ahmed Ferdausi Title: Senior Environmental Specialist Email: sferdausi@worldbank.org,,,,http://www.worldbank.org/projects/P127015/climate-resilient-participatory-afforestation-reforestation-project?lang=en,http://dhaka.usembassy.gov/business.html,,,1,Fulfilled,1,POINT (10058420.75686848 2715069.9672812214),"
Climate Resilient Participatory Afforestation and Reforestation Project
Country: Bangladesh
Sector: Agriculture, Forestry, Fishing and Hunting
Date Added: 2013-01-01
Primary Funding Source: Development Bank
Project Size (USD): 35000000
Status: Fulfilled

Archived: Yes
Description:
The overall project development objective is to increase the resilience of coastal population to natural disasters and climate change. More specifically, the project aims at (a) reducing the loss of life, assets, crops and livestock during natural disasters; (b) reducing the time of recovery after natural disaster such as cyclone; and (c) improving agricultural production by reducing saline water intrusion which is expected to worsen due climate change. This objective will be achieved by rehabilitating and improving the polder system in the coastal area.

43000000, 44000000, 48000000 II.5) Information about Government Procurement Agreement (GPA) The contract is covered by the Government Procurement Agreement (GPA): no Section III: Legal, economic, financial and technical information III.1) Conditions for participation III.1.1) Qualification for the system: Conditions to be fulfilled by economic operators in view of their qualification: Each registered purchaser may impose further qualification stages or may proceed directly to select tenderers or candidates for negotiations from the suppliers or contractors registered in the FPAL database. Each registered purchaser may also, at his own discretion, use the system as the basis for selection of tender lists for contracts which are below the EU thresholds or are not subject to EU rules. The database may also be used by registered purchasers for sourcing goods and services relating to facilities or operations out with the European Economic Area (EEA). Those companies wishing to register for the first time on the FPAL database should reply to FPAL at the address in Annex A below. Applicants wishing to register will be required to make a supplier application, and pay an annual registration fee levied as a contribution towards the annual administration costs of the system. The annual fee for registration on the FPAL database is identified on the registration form sent to suppliers prior to joining the scheme. Suppliers and contractors who have already registered on the FPAL database need not reapply, but may wish to consider updating their registration to cover additional product/service codes. Methods according to which each of those conditions will be verified: These will be described in the details of the scheme available from the FPAL Customer Support team. III.1.2) Information about reserved contracts Section V: Procedure IV.1) Award criteria IV.1.1) Award criteria The most economically advantageous tender in terms of the criteria stated in the specifications or in the invitation to tender or to negotiate IV.1.2) Information about electronic auction An electronic auction will be used: yes Additional information about electronic auction: An e-auction may be used for some procurements by some or all of the subscribers. IV.2) Administrative information IV.2.1) File reference number attributed by the contracting entity: IV.2.2) Duration of the qualification system Indefinite duration IV.2.3) Information about renewals Renewal of the qualification system: no Section VI: Complementary information VI.1) Information about European Union funds The contract is related to a project and/or programme financed by European Union funds: yes Reference to project(s) and/or programme(s): May be used by some subscribers for funded contracts. VI.2) Additional information: First Point Assessment (FPAL) has been established as an industry based company to create opportunities for improving efficiency and reducing costs throughout the supply chain. FPAL provide a register of suppliers and contractors to the subscribing oil and gas industry purchasing group companies (see below) who may use the database as their first stage of qualification in the selection of tenderers for contracts subject to EU rules. VI.3) Procedures for appeal VI.3.1) Body responsible for appeal procedures VI.3.2) Lodging of appeals Precise information on deadline(s) for lodging appeals: Utilities subject to the EC procurement legislation of England, Wales and Northern Ireland will incorporate a standstill period at the point information on the award of the contract is communicated to tenderers. That notification will provide full information on the award decision. The standstill period, which will be for a minimum of 10 calendar days, provides time for unsuccessful tenderers to challenge the award decision before the contract is entered into. The Utilities Contracts Regulations (SI 2005 No 6) provide for aggrieved parties who have been harmed or are at risk of harm by a breach of the rules to take action in the High Court (England, Wales and Northern Ireland). Any such action must be brought within 30 days of knowledge of any breach. Utilities subject to the EC procurement legislation of Scotland will where appropriate incorporate a minimum 10 calendar day standstill period (or 15 days if non electronic or fax methods used) at the point that information on the award of the contract is communicated to tenderers. If an appeal regarding the award of contract has not been successfully resolved then the Utilities Contracts (Scotland) Regulations 2012 provide for aggrieved parties who have been harmed or are at risk of harm by a breach of the rule to take action in the Sheriff Court or Court of Session. Any such action must be brought within 30 days of knowledge of any breach. VI.3.3) Service from which information about the lodging of appeals may be obtained VI.4) Date of dispatch of this notice: 12.8.2014","Oil, Gas, Extraction, Exploration",Post Identified Project,2014-08-12,,Private,,First Point Assessment,"First Point Assessment 7 Burnbank Business Centre, Souterhead Road, Altens AB12 3LF Aberdeen UNITED KINGDOM enquiries@fpal.com",,Sean R Smith,smithsr1@state.gov,http://ted.europa.eu/udl?uri=TED:NOTICE:281755-2014:TEXT:EN:HTML&src=0,,,,1,In Procurement,0,POINT (-467836.3904404929 7656721.01017786),"

Status: In Procurement

Description:
Section I: Contracting entity I.1) Name, addresses and contact point(s) First Point Assessment 7 Burnbank Business Centre, Souterhead Road, Altens Contact point(s): Customer Support Department AB12 3LF Aberdeen UNITED KINGDOM Telephone: +44 1224337533 Fax: +44 1224337544 Internet address(es): General address of the contracting entity: www.fpal.com Further information can be obtained from First Point Assessment 7 Burnbank Business Centre, Souterhead Road, Altens Contact point(s): Customer Support Department AB12 3LF Aberdeen UNITED KINGDOM Telephone: +44 1224337533 E-mail: enquiries@fpal.com Fax: +44 1224337544 Internet address: www.fpal.com Further documentation can be obtained from First Point Assessment 7 Burnbank Business Centre, Souterhead Road, Altens Contact point(s): Customer Support Department AB12 3LF Aberdeen UNITED KINGDOM Telephone: +44 1224337533 E-mail: enquiries@fpal.com Fax: +44 1224337544 Internet address: www.fpal.com Requests to participate or candidatures must be sent to First Point Assessment 7 Burnbank Business Centre, Souterhead Road, Altens Contact point(s): Customer Support Department AB12 3LF Aberdeen UNITED KINGDOM Telephone: +44 1224337533 E-mail: enquiries@fpal.com Fax: +44 1224337544 Internet address: www.fpal.com I.2) Main activity Exploration and extraction of gas and oil I.3) Contract award on behalf of other contracting entities The contracting entity is purchasing on behalf of other contracting entities: yes First Point Assessment 7 Burnbank Business Centre, Souterhead Road, Altens AB12 3LF Aberdeen UNITED KINGDOM Section II: Object of the qualification system II.1) Title attributed to the contract by the contracting entity: Qualification Notice. II.2) Type of contract Supplies II.3) Description of the works, services or goods to be procured through the qualification system: First Point Assessment (FPAL) has been established as an industry based company to create opportunities for improving efficiency and reducing costs throughout the supply chain. FPAL provide a register of suppliers and contractors to the above list of subscribing oil and gas industry purchasing group companies who may use the database as their first stage of qualification in the selection of tenderers for contracts subject to EU rules. 1.0.0 Products / Equipment / Materials 1.1.0 Drilling Equipment 1.1.1 Drilling Machinery, Mud Equipment and Accessories 1.1.2 Production 43000000, 44000000, 48000000 II.5) Information about Government Procurement Agreement (GPA) The contract is covered by the Government Procurement Agreement (GPA): no Section III: Legal, economic, financial and technical information III.1) Conditions for participation III.1.1) Qualification for the system: Conditions to be fulfilled by economic operators in view of their qualification: Each registered purchaser may impose further qualification stages or may proceed directly to select tenderers or candidates for negotiations from the suppliers or contractors registered in the FPAL database. Each registered purchaser may also, at his own discretion, use the system as the basis for selection of tender lists for contracts which are below the EU thresholds or are not subject to EU rules. The database may also be used by registered purchasers for sourcing goods and services relating to facilities or operations out with the European Economic Area (EEA). Those companies wishing to register for the first time on the FPAL database should reply to FPAL at the address in Annex A below. Applicants wishing to register will be required to make a supplier application, and pay an annual registration fee levied as a contribution towards the annual administration costs of the system. The annual fee for registration on the FPAL database is identified on the registration form sent to suppliers prior to joining the scheme. Suppliers and contractors who have already registered on the FPAL database need not reapply, but may wish to consider updating their registration to cover additional product/service codes. Methods according to which each of those conditions will be verified: These will be described in the details of the scheme available from the FPAL Customer Support team. III.1.2) Information about reserved contracts Section V: Procedure IV.1) Award criteria IV.1.1) Award criteria The most economically advantageous tender in terms of the criteria stated in the specifications or in the invitation to tender or to negotiate IV.1.2) Information about electronic auction An electronic auction will be used: yes Additional information about electronic auction: An e-auction may be used for some procurements by some or all of the subscribers. IV.2) Administrative information IV.2.1) File reference number attributed by the contracting entity: IV.2.2) Duration of the qualification system Indefinite duration IV.2.3) Information about renewals Renewal of the qualification system: no Section VI: Complementary information VI.1) Information about European Union funds The contract is related to a project and/or programme financed by European Union funds: yes Reference to project(s) and/or programme(s): May be used by some subscribers for funded contracts. VI.2) Additional information: First Point Assessment (FPAL) has been established as an industry based company to create opportunities for improving efficiency and reducing costs throughout the supply chain. FPAL provide a register of suppliers and contractors to the subscribing oil and gas industry purchasing group companies (see below) who may use the database as their first stage of qualification in the selection of tenderers for contracts subject to EU rules. VI.3) Procedures for appeal VI.3.1) Body responsible for appeal procedures VI.3.2) Lodging of appeals Precise information on deadline(s) for lodging appeals: Utilities subject to the EC procurement legislation of England, Wales and Northern Ireland will incorporate a standstill period at the point information on the award of the contract is communicated to tenderers. That notification will provide full information on the award decision. The standstill period, which will be for a minimum of 10 calendar days, provides time for unsuccessful tenderers to challenge the award decision before the contract is entered into. The Utilities Contracts Regulations (SI 2005 No 6) provide for aggrieved parties who have been harmed or are at risk of harm by a breach of the rules to take action in the High Court (England, Wales and Northern Ireland). Any such action must be brought within 30 days of knowledge of any breach. Utilities subject to the EC procurement legislation of Scotland will where appropriate incorporate a minimum 10 calendar day standstill period (or 15 days if non electronic or fax methods used) at the point that information on the award of the contract is communicated to tenderers. If an appeal regarding the award of contract has not been successfully resolved then the Utilities Contracts (Scotland) Regulations 2012 provide for aggrieved parties who have been harmed or are at risk of harm by a breach of the rule to take action in the Sheriff Court or Court of Session. Any such action must be brought within 30 days of knowledge of any breach. VI.3.3) Service from which information about the lodging of appeals may be obtained VI.4) Date of dispatch of this notice: 12.8.2014

DRC Forest Investment Program
Country: Democratic Republic of the Congo
Sector: Agriculture, Forestry, Fishing and Hunting
Date Added: 2013-07-23
Primary Funding Source: Development Bank
Project Size (USD): 36900000
Status: Pipeline

Archived: Yes
Description:
This project promotes sustainable forest management around Kinshasa while improving the livelihoods of rural communities and testing sustainable forest management techniques. It also promotes private sector engagement in REDD+ (Reducing Emissions from Deforestation and Forest Degradation).

Project Website   Embassy Website   " DATATABLE.887,2014-08-13T14:31:38.086,2014-08-13T14:31:38.086,41.581660599999964,42.4003008,Georgia,Anaklia,,Deep Water Black Sea Port,,Construction,100000000,"Government of Georgia invites the expressions of interest to enjoy the strategic location of the country and build, operate and transfer a new deep water port on the Black Sea, near Anaklia. Therefore Government of Georgia acting through the Ministry of Economy and Sustainable Development of Georgia invites local and international companies and Consortiums to submit their expressions of interest (“EOI’s”) to act as Investor in relation to the Project. The objective is to complete the development of the port in 7 phases and upon the completion of the construction to reach 100 million ton annual turnover capacity. Georgia is the shortest route from Asia to Europe. It is part of the TRACECA corridor and home for ports of Batumi (liquid, dry bulk cargo and containers) operated through a wholly-owned subsidiary of JSC NC “KazMunayGas"", Supsa (owned by BP, oil terminal), Poti (dry bulk and containers) owned by APM Terminals and Kulevi (liquid cargo) owned by SOCAR. Due to the ever-increasing trade between Europe and Asia, North and South, there is a need to construct a new deep water sea port with a capacity to accept vessels of at least 6,500 TEU capacity. The Government of Georgia will provide the Investor with up to one thousand (1000) hectares of land for the Project. The legal framework and necessary actions to be undertaken by the parties for provision of such land are to be finalized prior to execution of the Investment Agreement. The Government shall also consider the possibility of establishing a free industrial zone (“FIZ”) for the Anaklia Port. Candidates should have at least five (5) years of experience in the building, operation and attracting financing for projects of a similar nature; experience in the development and operation of one or more port projects and experience in, and/or knowledge of meeting the requirements of the sea transport and related land side logistics. Expressions of Interest due before 2:00 p.m. Tbilisi time on October 1, 2014. More details available at http://www.economy.ge/uploads/anaklia_port/Anaklia_Port_EOI__1_eng__01.08.14.pdf ","Port, Construction, BOT, operation, transportation, sea transport, investment",Post Identified Project,2014-08-01,,Government,,Ministry of Economy and Sustanable Development,"For more detailed information contact David Javakhadze, e-mail: djavakhadze@economy.ge; or Giorgi Chichinadze, e-mail: gchichinadze@economy.ge at the Ministry of Economy and Sustainable Development of Georgia. ",Posted at the request of the Government of Georgia. The project value is not specified in the documents provided so value listed here is notional only.,Kristian Moore,MooreKG@state.gov,http://government.gov.ge,http://georgia.usembassy.gov/business.html,,,1,Pipeline,0,POINT (4628849.284330722 5221132.454942298),"
Deep Water Black Sea Port
Country: Georgia
Sector: Construction
Date Added: 2014-08-13
Primary Funding Source: Government
Project Size (USD): 100000000
Status: Pipeline

Description:
Government of Georgia invites the expressions of interest to enjoy the strategic location of the country and build, operate and transfer a new deep water port on the Black Sea, near Anaklia. Therefore Government of Georgia acting through the Ministry of Economy and Sustainable Development of Georgia invites local and international companies and Consortiums to submit their expressions of interest (“EOI’s”) to act as Investor in relation to the Project. The objective is to complete the development of the port in 7 phases and upon the completion of the construction to reach 100 million ton annual turnover capacity. Georgia is the shortest route from Asia to Europe. It is part of the TRACECA corridor and home for ports of Batumi (liquid, dry bulk cargo and containers) operated through a wholly-owned subsidiary of JSC NC “KazMunayGas"", Supsa (owned by BP, oil terminal), Poti (dry bulk and containers) owned by APM Terminals and Kulevi (liquid cargo) owned by SOCAR. Due to the ever-increasing trade between Europe and Asia, North and South, there is a need to construct a new deep water sea port with a capacity to accept vessels of at least 6,500 TEU capacity. The Government of Georgia will provide the Investor with up to one thousand (1000) hectares of land for the Project. The legal framework and necessary actions to be undertaken by the parties for provision of such land are to be finalized prior to execution of the Investment Agreement. The Government shall also consider the possibility of establishing a free industrial zone (“FIZ”) for the Anaklia Port. Candidates should have at least five (5) years of experience in the building, operation and attracting financing for projects of a similar nature; experience in the development and operation of one or more port projects and experience in, and/or knowledge of meeting the requirements of the sea transport and related land side logistics. Expressions of Interest due before 2:00 p.m. Tbilisi time on October 1, 2014. More details available at http://www.economy.ge/uploads/anaklia_port/Anaklia_Port_EOI__1_eng__01.08.14.pdf

Post Comments:
Posted at the request of the Government of Georgia. The project value is not specified in the documents provided so value listed here is notional only.

Project Website   Embassy Website   Contact

Cauzione definitiva 10 % dell'importo di aggiudicazione. Riduzioni e aumenti ex art. 113 D.Lgs n. 163/2006. Requisiti ec artt. 38 e 39 D.Lgs n. 163/2006. Requisiti antimafia ex D.Lgs n. 159/2011. IV.3.7)Minimum time frame during which the tenderer must maintain the tender IV.3.8)Conditions for opening of tenders Section VI: Complementary information VI.1)Information about recurrence VI.2)Information about European Union funds VI.3)Additional information CIG 5832308CCE. Le domande, in carta semplice, dovranno essere contenute in una busta, chiusa e sigillata con ceralacca o nastro adesivo e controfirmata sui lembi, riportante l'indicazione del mittente ed il riferimento “DLL — richiesta di partecipazione gara fornitura tre autocompattatori laterali”.
