" DATATABLE.812,2014-07-23T12:02:41.675,2014-07-23T12:02:41.675,47.81666700000005,30.5,Iraq,Basra,,Tender Pre-qualification and Selection Process Hill International Contract with Basra Governate Summer 2014,N/A,Construction,14000000000,"In November 2013, U.S. project management company Hill International signed a three-year contract to oversee development planning and provincial procurement for the Basrah governorate. This contract is expected to help the Basrah provincial government attract high-quality international construction and project-management firms to execute the many infrastructure and development projects that are expected in the near future. Iraq’s Provincial Powers Law allots a portion of Iraq’s national budget to each province of Iraq, based on its oil wealth. Under this law, the Governorate of Basrah could have access to $14 billion in new funds for infrastructure projects, depending on how and when the 2014 national budget is approved. U.S. firms interested in these upcoming major construction and development projects should pre-qualify with Hill International and check the Basrah governorate’s website (http://basra.gov.iq/ar/178/380/index.1.html) for announcements of specific opportunities, and apply for them using the process outlined below, which is subject to change in the future. Hill International’s planning is currently divided into two tracks. The first is a long-term city development plan, Basrah 2040, which envisions a major redevelopment and expansion of city infrastructure and resources over the next 25 years, to include whole new districts, residential and office areas, new universities, and other similarly large-scale projects. The draft of this plan is expected to be presented to Basrah government officials at the end of 2014. The first contracts related to the Basrah 2040 project, therefore, will not be issued for several years. The second track consists of several groups of projects to improve Basrah’s current infrastructure in the near-to-medium term. The first group, of about 40 projects, consists of roads, bridges, schools, hospitals, sewer projects, communications infrastructure, housing, parks, an entertainment city, and others. These projects will total about $14 billion. The second group will include more than 20 strategic projects, with budgets of $100 million or more; the third will consist of more than 600 smaller projects, with budgets between $10 to $50 million. However, funding for these groups of projects will come from Iraq’s 2014 budget, which, as of July 2014, had not yet been approved. Therefore, although planning has begun, most of these projects are on hold. The Basrah governorate and Hill International will probably move quickly to implement them once the budget has passed. However, there are about 14 smaller projects, totaling about $3 billion, that will begin in the near future, with contracts to be signed in the summer of 2014 and implementation to take place in late 2014 and early 2015. These include roads and other infrastructure projects, including a redesign of Basrah’s iconic Corniche and refurbishment of its city canals. As of early July 2014, these projects are posted at the Basrah Governorate’s procurement website: (http://basra.gov.iq/ar/178/380/index.1.html) ",Construction;Infrastructure,Post Identified Project,2013-11-29,2015-01-01,Government,None,Hill International,Lonnie Kelley,,Lonnie Kelley,KelleyL@state.gov,http://basra.gov.iq/ar/178/380/index.1.html) ,http://iraq.usembassy.gov/business.html,,,1,Pipeline,0,POINT (5322927.021871534 3567983.4559358195),"
Tender Pre-qualification and Selection Process Hill International Contract with Basra Governate Summer 2014
Country: Iraq
Sector: Construction
Date Added: 2014-07-23
Primary Funding Source: Government
Project Size (USD): 14000000000
Status: Pipeline

Description:
In November 2013, U.S. project management company Hill International signed a three-year contract to oversee development planning and provincial procurement for the Basrah governorate. This contract is expected to help the Basrah provincial government attract high-quality international construction and project-management firms to execute the many infrastructure and development projects that are expected in the near future. Iraq’s Provincial Powers Law allots a portion of Iraq’s national budget to each province of Iraq, based on its oil wealth. Under this law, the Governorate of Basrah could have access to $14 billion in new funds for infrastructure projects, depending on how and when the 2014 national budget is approved. U.S. firms interested in these upcoming major construction and development projects should pre-qualify with Hill International and check the Basrah governorate’s website (http://basra.gov.iq/ar/178/380/index.1.html) for announcements of specific opportunities, and apply for them using the process outlined below, which is subject to change in the future. Hill International’s planning is currently divided into two tracks. The first is a long-term city development plan, Basrah 2040, which envisions a major redevelopment and expansion of city infrastructure and resources over the next 25 years, to include whole new districts, residential and office areas, new universities, and other similarly large-scale projects. The draft of this plan is expected to be presented to Basrah government officials at the end of 2014. The first contracts related to the Basrah 2040 project, therefore, will not be issued for several years. The second track consists of several groups of projects to improve Basrah’s current infrastructure in the near-to-medium term. The first group, of about 40 projects, consists of roads, bridges, schools, hospitals, sewer projects, communications infrastructure, housing, parks, an entertainment city, and others. These projects will total about $14 billion. The second group will include more than 20 strategic projects, with budgets of $100 million or more; the third will consist of more than 600 smaller projects, with budgets between $10 to $50 million. However, funding for these groups of projects will come from Iraq’s 2014 budget, which, as of July 2014, had not yet been approved. Therefore, although planning has begun, most of these projects are on hold. The Basrah governorate and Hill International will probably move quickly to implement them once the budget has passed. However, there are about 14 smaller projects, totaling about $3 billion, that will begin in the near future, with contracts to be signed in the summer of 2014 and implementation to take place in late 2014 and early 2015. These include roads and other infrastructure projects, including a redesign of Basrah’s iconic Corniche and refurbishment of its city canals. As of early July 2014, these projects are posted at the Basrah Governorate’s procurement website: (http://basra.gov.iq/ar/178/380/index.1.html)

Project Website   Embassy Website   Contact
" DATATABLE.340,2014-01-28T03:41:36.645,2014-01-28T03:41:36.645,47.81666670000004,30.5,Iraq,Basrah,,constructing industrial area in Khour Azubeir /Phase1,,Construction,42881647,Estimate Cost,Industrail city,Post Identified Project,,,Government,,Basrah province ,contracts@basra.gov.iq,,Steve Perry ,PerrySJ2@state.gov,,,,,1,Pipeline,0,POINT (5322926.988475686 3567983.4559358195),"

Country: Iraq
Sector: Construction
Date Added: 2014-01-28
Primary Funding Source: Government
Project Size (USD): 42881647
Status: Pipeline

Description:
Estimate Cost

Contact

Bidding is open to all bidders from eligible source countries as defined in the Guidelines: Procurement under IBRD Loans and IDA Credits. 1. Ministry of Finance, Economic Affairs, Planning and Social Security, Department of Planning and National Development of Saint Lucia now invites sealed bids from eligible bidders for the Procurement of Water Quality Field Testing Equipment: • Field Bacteriological testing kits. • Multi-parameter meter for testing dissolved oxygen, temperature, salinity and conductivity • Advanced portable lab for rugged use and for testing physical, chemical and bacteriological parameters • Van Dorn Samplers • Well samplers • Seechi Disks 2. Bidding will be conducted through the shopping procedures specified in the World Bank’s Guidelines: Procurement of Goods, Works and Non-consulting Services under IBRD Loans and IDA Credits and Grants, dated January 2011, and is open to all eligible bidders as defined in the guidelines. 3. Interested bidders may inspect the Bidding Documents and obtain further information at the address below (*) from August 28, 2014, from 0900 hours (9:00am) to 1500 hours (3:00 pm) daily from Monday to Friday. 4. Bids shall be delivered to the address below (**) on or before September 12, 2014 at 12:00 noon (1200 hours) and shall be valid for a period of 90 days after bid submission. Late bids will be rejected. Bids will be opened in the presence of the bidder’s representatives who choose to attend at the address below (***) on September 22, 2014 at 2:00 p.m. 1400 hours. ",St. Lucia; Water Testing; Disaster; World Bank,World Bank,,,Development Banks,,"Ministry of Finance, Government of St. Lucia","*The Project Coordinator Hurricane Tomas Emergency Recovery Project Department of Planning and National Development 5th Floor, Conway Business Centre Waterfront, Castries, Saint Lucia Telephone: 758-468-5814/5 Fax: 758-453-0417 Email: slupcu@gosl.gov.lc **The Secretary (Submission of Bids) Departmental Tenders Board Ministry of Sustainable Development, Energy, Science and Technology Norman Francis Building Balata Castries ***Meeting of the Departmental Tenders Board Departmental Tenders Board Ministry of Sustainable Development, Energy, Science and Technology Norman Francis Building Balata Castries ",This is an estimate of value as this notice is a tender for procurement,Michael Carver,CarverMJ@state.gov,,,,,1,In Procurement,0,POINT (-6789093.960454713 1575376.3986998422),"
Procurement of Water Quality Field Testing Equipment
Country: St. Lucia
Sector: Professional, Scientific, and Technical Services
Date Added: 2014-09-09
Primary Funding Source: Development Banks
Project Size (USD): 250000
Status: In Procurement

Description:
Saint Lucia has received a Credit from the World Bank towards the cost of Preparation Advance - Disaster Vulnerability Reduction Project and intends to apply part of the funds to cover eligible payments under the Contract for Procurement of Water Quality Field Testing Equipment. Bidding is open to all bidders from eligible source countries as defined in the Guidelines: Procurement under IBRD Loans and IDA Credits. 1. Ministry of Finance, Economic Affairs, Planning and Social Security, Department of Planning and National Development of Saint Lucia now invites sealed bids from eligible bidders for the Procurement of Water Quality Field Testing Equipment: • Field Bacteriological testing kits. • Multi-parameter meter for testing dissolved oxygen, temperature, salinity and conductivity • Advanced portable lab for rugged use and for testing physical, chemical and bacteriological parameters • Van Dorn Samplers • Well samplers • Seechi Disks 2. Bidding will be conducted through the shopping procedures specified in the World Bank’s Guidelines: Procurement of Goods, Works and Non-consulting Services under IBRD Loans and IDA Credits and Grants, dated January 2011, and is open to all eligible bidders as defined in the guidelines. 3. Interested bidders may inspect the Bidding Documents and obtain further information at the address below (*) from August 28, 2014, from 0900 hours (9:00am) to 1500 hours (3:00 pm) daily from Monday to Friday. 4. Bids shall be delivered to the address below (**) on or before September 12, 2014 at 12:00 noon (1200 hours) and shall be valid for a period of 90 days after bid submission. Late bids will be rejected. Bids will be opened in the presence of the bidder’s representatives who choose to attend at the address below (***) on September 22, 2014 at 2:00 p.m. 1400 hours.

Post Comments:
This is an estimate of value as this notice is a tender for procurement

Contact
" DATATABLE.833,2014-07-30T03:18:18.674,2014-07-30T03:18:18.674,21.42799560000003,41.9973462,Macedonia,Skopje,,Air Navigation System Upgrade,7284-GPN-44067,Transportation and Warehousing,17460000,"M-NAV, Macedonian National Air Navigation Service Provider, has received a loan from the European Bank for Reconstruction and Development (the Bank) and intends to use its proceeds to contribute towards financing the upgrade of its air navigation system to comply with the standards of service as required by the European industry regulations. The proposed project, which has a total estimated cost of approximately EUR 13 million, will require the procurement of the following goods, works and services: · Procurement, installation and commissioning of New Air Traffic Management (ATM) System including technical-operating room for the same one; · Upgrade on several communication facilities, including procurement, installation and testing of new VHF radio system and MW link, new Voice Communication System and new Digital system for recording voice channels (Voice Logging System); · Procurement, installation and commissioning of a new Mode – S Secondary Surveillance Radar (Mode-S Enhanced Surveillance Ground Station Implementation); · Strengthening of the meteorological equipment, including procurement of Meteo equipment for Skopje and Ohrid Airports including Replacement of the existing AWOS/ATIS/VOLMET systems; and Tendering for the first contracts of the project is expected to begin the second quarter of 2014. Contracts to be financed with the proceeds of a loan from the Bank will be subject to the Bank's Procurement Policies and Rules and will be open to firms from any country. The proceeds of the Bank's loan will not be used for the purpose of any payment to persons or entities, of for any import of goods, if such payment or import is prohibited by a decision of the United Nations Security Council taken under Chapter VII of the Charter of the United Nations or under a law of official regulation of the Purchaser's country.",ANS Upgrade,European Bank for Reconstruction and Development,2014-02-17,2014-09-30,Development Banks,Macedonia Air Navigation System (M-NAV),M-NAV,"M-NAV; Financial and Procurement Issues; Mr. Nikolet Tagarinski; Airport ""Alexander the Great"" - Skopje; P.O. BOX 9, 1043 Petrovec, Macedonia; tel: +389 2 314 8100; +389 2 325 1800; E-mail: Nikolet.Tagarinski@mnavigation.mk",,"Arben Gega, Commercial Specialist",gegaa@state.gov,http://www.ebrd.com/english/pages/workingwithus/procurement/notices/project/140217a.shtml,http://macedonia.usembassy.gov/business.html,,,1,Pipeline,0,POINT (2385353.55891251 5160581.925968987),"
Air Navigation System Upgrade
Country: Macedonia
Sector: Transportation and Warehousing
Date Added: 2014-07-30
Primary Funding Source: Development Banks
Project Size (USD): 17460000
Status: Pipeline

Description:
M-NAV, Macedonian National Air Navigation Service Provider, has received a loan from the European Bank for Reconstruction and Development (the Bank) and intends to use its proceeds to contribute towards financing the upgrade of its air navigation system to comply with the standards of service as required by the European industry regulations. The proposed project, which has a total estimated cost of approximately EUR 13 million, will require the procurement of the following goods, works and services: · Procurement, installation and commissioning of New Air Traffic Management (ATM) System including technical-operating room for the same one; · Upgrade on several communication facilities, including procurement, installation and testing of new VHF radio system and MW link, new Voice Communication System and new Digital system for recording voice channels (Voice Logging System); · Procurement, installation and commissioning of a new Mode – S Secondary Surveillance Radar (Mode-S Enhanced Surveillance Ground Station Implementation); · Strengthening of the meteorological equipment, including procurement of Meteo equipment for Skopje and Ohrid Airports including Replacement of the existing AWOS/ATIS/VOLMET systems; and Tendering for the first contracts of the project is expected to begin the second quarter of 2014. Contracts to be financed with the proceeds of a loan from the Bank will be subject to the Bank's Procurement Policies and Rules and will be open to firms from any country. The proceeds of the Bank's loan will not be used for the purpose of any payment to persons or entities, of for any import of goods, if such payment or import is prohibited by a decision of the United Nations Security Council taken under Chapter VII of the Charter of the United Nations or under a law of official regulation of the Purchaser's country.

Project Website   Embassy Website   Contact
"
